DG.name: ACETYLENE, DISSOLVED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas with slight odour. Explosive limits: 2.1% to 80%. Lighter than air (0.907). Rough handling and exposure to local heating should be avoided, since these conditions may result in delayed explosion. Empty cylinders should be carried with the same precautions as filled cylinders.

DG.name: AIR, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable gas.

DG.name: AIR, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Strong oxidizing agent. Mixtures of liquid air with combustible materials or oils may explode. May ignite organic materials.

DG.name: AMMONIA, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with a pungent odour. Lighter than air (0.6). Suffocating in low concentrations. Even though this substance has a flammability hazard, it only exhibits such hazard under extreme fire conditions in confined areas. Reacts violently with acids. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ARGON, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Inert gas. Heavier than air (1.4).

DG.name: BORON TRIFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. Forms dense white corrosive fumes in moist air. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass and most metals. Much heavier than air (2.35). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BROMOTRIFLUOROMETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 13B1)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas with a slight odour. Much heavier than air (5.2).

DG.name: BUTADIENES, STABILIZED or BUTADIENES AND HYDROCARBON MIXTURE, STABILIZED, containing more than 20% butadienes
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas with an unpleasant odour. Explosive limits: 2% to 12%. Heavier than air (1.84).

DG.name: BUTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gas. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 8.4%. Heavier than air (2.11).

DG.name: BUTYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gas. Explosive limits: 1.6% to 10%. Heavier than air (2.0).

DG.name: CARBON DIOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Heavier than air (1.5). Cannot remain in the liquid state above 31°C.

DG.name: CARBON MONOXIDE, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, odourless gas. Explosive limits: 12% to 75%. Slightly lighter than air (0.97).

DG.name: CHLORINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive yellow gas with a pungent odour. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Much heavier than air (2.4). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Powerful oxidant which may cause fire.

DG.name: CHLORODIFLUOROMETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 22)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas with a chloroform-like odour. Much heavier than air (3.0).

DG.name: CHLOROPENTAFLUORO- ETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 115)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (5.4).

DG.name: 1-CHLORO-1,2,2,2-TETRA- FLUOROETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 124)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (4.7).

DG.name: CHLOROTRIFLUOROMETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 13)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (3.6). Cannot remain in the liquid state above 29°C.

DG.name: COAL GAS, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic gas. Explosive limits: 4.5% to 40%. Much lighter than air (0.4 to 0.6).

DG.name: CYANOGEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, toxic gas with a pungent odour. Explosive limits: 6.6% to 43%. Heavier than air (1.9).

DG.name: CYCLOPROPANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gas. Heavier than air.

DG.name: DICHLORODIFLUOROMETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 12)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (4.2).

DG.name: DICHLOROFLUOROMETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 21)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas with a chloroform-like odour. Much heavier than air (3.6). Boiling point: 9°C.

DG.name: 1,1-DIFLUOROETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 152a)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas. Explosive limits: 5% to 17%. Much heavier than air (2.3).

DG.name: DIMETHYLAMINE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas with an ammonia-like odour. Heavier than air (1.6). Boiling point: 7°C. Suffocating in low concentrations.

DG.name: DIMETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas with a chloroform-like odour. Heavier than air (1.6).

DG.name: ETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas. Explosive limits: 3% to 16%. Slightly heavier than air (1.05).

DG.name: ETHYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas with an ammonia-like odour. Explosive limits: 3.5% to 14%. Heavier than air (1.6). Boiling point: 17°C.

DG.name: ETHYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Explosive limits: 3.5% to 15%. Much heavier than air (2.2). Boiling point: 13°C.

DG.name: ETHYLENE, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Explosive limits: 3% to 34%. Lighter than air (0.98).

DG.name: ETHYL METHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Explosive limits: 2% to 10%. Much heavier than air (2.1). Boiling point: 11°C.

DG.name: ETHYLENE OXIDE or ETHYLENE OXIDE WITH NITROGEN up to a total pressure of 1 MPa (10 bar) at 50°C
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, toxic gases with an ether-like odour. Heavier than air (1.5). Boiling point: 11°C.

DG.name: ETHYLENE OXIDE AND CARBON DIOXIDE MIXTURE with more than 9% but not more than 87% ethylene oxide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas with an ether-like odour. Heavier than air (1.5).

DG.name: FERTILIZER AMMONIATING SOLUTION with free ammonia
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable aqueous solution of ammonium nitrate, calcium nitrate, urea and their mixtures containing ammonia gas. Emits toxic vapours of ammonia.

DG.name: FIRE EXTINGUISHERS with compressed or liquefied gas
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fire extinguishers, containing compressed or liquefied gases under pressure above 175 kPa for expelling fire-extinguishing contents.

DG.name: FLUORINE, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive pale yellowish gas with a pungent odour. Powerful oxidant which may cause fire. Reacts with water or moist air to produce toxic and corrosive fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Will explode when mixed with hydrogen. Heavier than air (1.3). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HELIUM, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Inert gas. Much lighter than air (0.14).

DG.name: HYDROGEN BROMIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with a pungent odour. Highly corrosive in the presence of water. Much heavier than air (3.6). Highly irritating to the skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGEN, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, odourless gas. Explosive limits: 4% to 75%. Much lighter than air (0.07).

DG.name: HYDROGEN CHLORIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive colourless gas with a pungent odour. Highly corrosive in the presence of water. Heavier than air (1.3). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGEN CYANIDE, STABILIZED containing less than 3% water
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Very volatile, colourless flammable liquid, evolving extremely toxic flammable vapours. Boiling point: 26°C. Flashpoint: -18°C c.c. Miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HYDROGEN FLUORIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, fuming and highly volatile liquid with an irritating and pungent odour. Highly corrosive to metals and glass in the presence of moisture. Boiling point: 20°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGEN SULPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, toxic gas with a foul odour. Heavier than air (1.2).

DG.name: ISOBUTYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gas. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 8.8%. May contain propane, cyclopropane, propylene, butane, butylene, etc., in varying proportions. Heavier than air (1.94).

DG.name: KRYPTON, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Inert gas. Much heavier than air (2.9).

DG.name: LIGHTERS or LIGHTER REFILLS containing flammable gas
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Lighters or lighter refills containing butane or other flammable gas.

DG.name: LIQUEFIED GASES non-flammable, charged with nitrogen, carbon dioxide or air
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable gases or mixtures of such gases which are used for filling receptacles from which the contents are to be dispersed under pressure. Vapour may be heavier than air.

DG.name: METHYLACETYLENE AND PROPADIENE MIXTURE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas. Explosive limits: 3% to 11%. Heavier than air (1.4).

DG.name: METHYLAMINE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas with an ammonia-like odour. Heavier than air (1.09).

DG.name: METHYL BROMIDE with not more than 2.0% chloropicrin
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, toxic gas with a chloroform-like odour. Much heavier than air (3.3). Boiling point: 4.5°C. Even though this substance has a flammability hazard, it only exhibits such hazard under extreme fire conditions in confined areas.

DG.name: METHYL CHLORIDE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 40)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Explosive limits: 8% to 20%. Heavier than air (1.8).

DG.name: METHYL MERCAPTAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, toxic gas with a foul odour. Heavier than air (1.7). Boiling point: 6°C.

DG.name: NEON, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Inert gas. Lighter than air (0.7).

DG.name: NITROGEN, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, odourless gas. Lighter than air (0.97).

DG.name: DINITROGEN TETROXIDE (NITROGEN DIOXIDE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas which gives off brown vapour with a pungent odour. Strong oxidizing agent. Boiling point: 21°C. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Toxic by inhalation, with delayed effect, similar to phosgene.

DG.name: NITROSYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic yellow gas with an irritating odour. Corrosive to steel. Much heavier than air (2.3). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROUS OXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable gas. Strong oxidizing agent. Heavier than air (1.5).

DG.name: OIL GAS, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic gas. A mixture of hydrocarbons and carbon monoxide.

DG.name: OXYGEN, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, odourless gas. Strong oxidizing agent. Heavier than air (1.1).

DG.name: OXYGEN, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Strong oxidizing agent. Mixtures of liquid oxygen with acetylene or oils may explode.

DG.name: PETROLEUM GASES, LIQUEFIED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gases or mixtures obtained from natural gas or by distillation of mineral oils or coal, etc. May contain propane, cyclopropane, propylene, butane, butylene, etc., in varying proportions. Heavier than air.

DG.name: PHOSGENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with a foul odour. Corrosive in the presence of water. Much heavier than air (3.5). Boiling point: 8°C. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. This gas is particularly dangerous in that it may be inhaled without immediate effect but can cause severe damage and death after a few hours’ delay.

DG.name: PROPYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gas. Explosive limits: 2% to 11.1%. Heavier than air (1.5).

DG.name: REFRIGERANT GAS, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Different chlorofluorohydrocarbons or other non-flammable, non-toxic gases considered as refrigerant agents.

DG.name: SULPHUR DIOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with a pungent odour. Much heavier than air (2.3). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHUR HEXAFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, odourless gas. Much heavier than air (5.1).

DG.name: TETRAFLUOROETHYLENE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Explosive limits: 11% to 60%. Much heavier than air (3.5). Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIFLUOROCHLORO- ETHYLENE, STABILIZED (REFRIGERANT GAS R 1113)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, odourless gas. Explosive limits: 8.4% to 38.7%. Much heavier than air (4.0).

DG.name: TRIMETHYLAMINE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas with a fishy odour. Explosive limits: 2% to 12%. Much heavier than air (2.1). Boiling point: 3°C.

DG.name: VINYL BROMIDE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Much heavier than air (3.7). Boiling point: 16°C.

DG.name: VINYL CHLORIDE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Explosive limits: 4% to 31%. Much heavier than air (2.2).

DG.name: VINYL METHYL ETHER, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Explosive limits: 2.6% to 39%. Heavier than air (2.0). Boiling point: 6°C.

DG.name: ACETAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an agreeable odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.6% to 10.4%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ACETALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent, fruity odour. Flashpoint: -27°C c.c. Explosive limits: 4% to 57%. Boiling point: 21°C. Miscible with water. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation.

DG.name: ACETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, clear liquid, with a characteristic mint-like odour. Flashpoint: -20°C to -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.5% to 13%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ACETONE OILS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Light yellow to brownish, oily liquids. Flashpoint: -4°C to 8°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ACROLEIN, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellow liquid with a most irritating odour. Flashpoint: -26°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.8% to 31%. Boiling point: 52°C. Miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ACRYLONITRILE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, mobile liquid with a mild pungent odour. Flashpoint: -5°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3% to 17%. Partially miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Practice has shown that this substance may leak from packagings that ordinarily are leakproof to other chemicals.

DG.name: ALLYL ALCOHOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent mustard-like odour. Flashpoint: 21°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.5% to 18%. Miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALLYL BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light yellow liquid with an irritating odour. Flashpoint: −1°C c.c. Explosive limits: 4.4% to 7.3%. Immiscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALLYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an unpleasant pungent odour. Flashpoint: -29°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.3% to 11.1%. Boiling point: 44°C. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: AMYL ACETATES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pear- or banana-like odour. normal-AMYL ACETATE: flashpoint 25°C c.c. secondary-AMYL ACETATE: flashpoint 32°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: PENTANOLS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a strong odour. Immiscible with water. tertiary-AMYL ALCOHOL: flashpoint 19°C to 21°C c.c.

DG.name: PENTANOLS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a strong odour. Immiscible with water. tertiary-AMYL ALCOHOL: flashpoint 19°C to 21°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 10.5%.

DG.name: AMYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, clear liquids. Explosive limits: 2.2% to 22%. normal-AMYLAMINE (1-PENTYLAMINE): flashpoint 4°C c.c. tertiary-AMYLAMINE (3-PENTYLAMINE): flashpoint 2°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, clear liquids. Explosive limits: 2.2% to 22%. normal-AMYLAMINE (1-PENTYLAMINE): flashpoint 4°C c.c. tertiary-AMYLAMINE (3-PENTYLAMINE): flashpoint 2°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. However, irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or light brown liquids with an aromatic odour. n-AMYL CHLORIDE: flashpoint 11°C. Explosive limits: normal-AMYL CHLORIDE 1.4% to 8.6%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 1-PENTENE (n-AMYLENE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a disagreeable odour. Flashpoint: -20°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 8.7%. Boiling point: 30°C. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Narcotic in high concentrations.

DG.name: AMYL FORMATES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pleasant odour. normal-AMYL FORMATE: flashpoint 27°C c.c. ISOAMYL FORMATE: flashpoint 26°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 10%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: n-AMYL METHYL KETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 49°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: AMYL MERCAPTAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellow liquids with an extremely disagreeable garlic- like odour. tertiary-AMYL MERCAPTAN: flashpoint -7°C c.c. normal-AMYL MERCAPTAN: flashpoint 19°C c.c. ISOAMYL MERCAPTAN: flashpoint 18°C c.c. Immiscible with water. These substances may leak from packagings that ordinarily are leakproof to other chemicals.

DG.name: AMYL NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with an ether-like odour. normal-AMYL NITRATE: flashpoint 48°C c.c. ISOAMYL NITRATE: flashpoint 52°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: AMYL NITRITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish, transparent, volatile liquid with a fragrant fruity odour. Flashpoint of the pure ISOAMYL NITRITE: -20°C c.c. Flashpoint of pure normal-AMYL NITRITE: 10°C c.c. Decomposes on exposure to air, light or water, evolving toxic nitrous fumes which are orange in colour. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: BENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a characteristic odour. Flashpoint: -11°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 8%. Freezing point 5°C; flashes below its freezing point. Immiscible with water. Narcotic. Exposure to this substance may produce serious chronic effects of a toxic nature.

DG.name: BUTANOLS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a disagreeable odour. Explosive limits: normal-BUTANOL 1.4% to 11.2%. secondary-BUTANOL 1.7% to 9.8%. tertiary-BUTANOL 2.4% to 8%. tertiary-BUTANOL solidifies at about 25°C. normal-BUTANOL is immiscible with water. secondary-BUTANOL is immiscible with water. tertiary-BUTANOL is miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BUTANOLS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a disagreeable odour. Explosive limits: normal-BUTANOL 1.4% to 11.2%. secondary-BUTANOL 1.7% to 9.8%. tertiary-BUTANOL 2.4% to 8%. tertiary-BUTANOL solidifies at about 25°C. normal-BUTANOL is immiscible with water. secondary-BUTANOL is immiscible with water. tertiary-BUTANOL is miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BUTYL ACETATES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pineapple-like odour. Immiscible with water. normal-BUTYL ACETATE: flashpoint 27°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 15%.

DG.name: BUTYL ACETATES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pineapple-like odour. Immiscible with water. normal-BUTYL ACETATE: flashpoint 27°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 15%.

DG.name: n-BUTYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flashpoint: −9°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 10%. Colourless, volatile liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Miscible with water. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1-BROMOBUTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to pale straw-coloured, clear liquid. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.6% to 6.6%. Immiscible with water. Narcotic.

DG.name: CHLOROBUTANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. tertiary-BUTYL CHLORIDE: flashpoint -30°C c.c., boiling point 51°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: n-BUTYL FORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.6% to 8.3%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: BUTYRALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a characteristic pungent odour. Flashpoint: -7°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 12.5%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CAMPHOR OIL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless oil with a characteristic odour. Flashpoint: 47°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CARBON DISULPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or faintly yellow, clear liquid, almost odourless when pure; the commercial substance has a strong disagreeable odour. Flashpoint: -30°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1% to 60%. Boiling point: 46°C. Ignition temperature: 100°C. Immiscible with water. Vapours are heavier than air, will travel a considerable distance to a source of ignition and will flash back. Vapours may be ignited by contact with an ordinary light bulb or a warm steam pipe. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ADHESIVES containing flammable liquid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Adhesives are solutions of gums, resins, etc., usually volatile due to the solvents. Miscibility with water depends upon their composition.

DG.name: ADHESIVES containing flammable liquid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Adhesives are solutions of gums, resins, etc., usually volatile due to the solvents. Miscibility with water depends upon their composition.

DG.name: ADHESIVES containing flammable liquid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Adhesives are solutions of gums, resins, etc., usually volatile due to the solvents. Miscibility with water depends upon their composition.

DG.name: CHLOROBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an almond-like odour. Flashpoint: 29°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.3% to 11%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYLENE CHLOROHYDRIN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a faint, ethereal odour. Flashpoint: 60°C o.c. Explosive limits: 4.9% to 15.9%. Miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves extremely toxic (phosgene) and corrosive (hydrogen chloride) fumes. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: COAL TAR DISTILLATES, FLAMMABLE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: COAL TAR DISTILLATES, FLAMMABLE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: COATING SOLUTION (includes surface treatments or coatings used for industrial or other purposes such as vehicle under- coating, drum or barrel lining)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition.

DG.name: COATING SOLUTION (includes surface treatments or coatings used for industrial or other purposes such as vehicle under- coating, drum or barrel lining)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition.

DG.name: COATING SOLUTION (includes surface treatments or coatings used for industrial or other purposes such as vehicle under- coating, drum or barrel lining)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition.

DG.name: CROTONALDEHYDE or CROTONALDEHYDE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, mobile liquid with a pungent odour. Turns to pale yellow in contact with light and air. Miscible with water. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. May cause lung damage.

DG.name: CROTONYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: −53°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.4% to … Boiling point: 27°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CYCLOHEXANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, mobile liquid with a sweet aromatic odour. Flashpoint: -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 8.4%. Immiscible with water. Slightly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Narcotic in high concentrations.

DG.name: CYCLOPENTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 8%. Boiling point: 49°C. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Narcotic in high concentrations.

DG.name: DECAHYDRONAPHTHALENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with an aromatic odour. Flashpoint: 52°C to 57°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.7% to 4.9%. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: DIACETONE ALCOHOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 8%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: DIACETONE ALCOHOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 8%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: DIBUTYL ETHERS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a mild ether-like odour. Explosive limits: 0.9% to 8.5%. Immiscible with water. normal-DIBUTYL ETHER: flashpoint 25°C c.c.

DG.name: 1,2-DICHLOROETHYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a chloroform-like odour. Flashpoint: 6°C c.c. Explosive limits: 5.6% to 16%. Immiscible with water. Boiling range: 48°C to 61°C.

DG.name: DICHLOROPENTANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Light yellow liquids. 1,5-DICHLOROPENTANE: flashpoint 26°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYLENE GLYCOL DIETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ether-like odour. Flashpoint: 35°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYLENE GLYCOL DIETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ether-like odour. Flashpoint: 35°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: DIETHYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint: -39°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 10.1%. Boiling point: 55°C. Miscible with water. Harmful if swallowed. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Higher concentrations cause dangerous lung irritation.

DG.name: DIETHYL ETHER (ETHYL ETHER)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile and mobile liquid with a pleasant aromatic odour. Flashpoint: -40°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 48%. Boiling point: 34°C. Immiscible with water. In the presence of oxygen or on long standing or exposure to sunlight, unstable peroxides sometimes form; these may explode spontaneously or when heated. Strongly narcotic. Readily ignited by static electricity.

DG.name: DIETHYL KETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, mobile liquid. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.6% to … Immiscible with water.

DG.name: DIISOBUTYL KETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 49°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.8% to 7.1%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: DIISOPROPYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: -7°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.1% to 7.1%. Partially miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIISOPROPYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ether-like odour. Flashpoint: -29°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.1% to 21%. Immiscible with water. In the presence of oxygen or on long standing or exposure to sunlight, unstable peroxides sometimes form; these may explode spontaneously or when heated. Strongly narcotic. Readily ignited by static electricity.

DG.name: DIMETHYLAMINE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Aqueous solution of a flammable gas with an ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint for 60% solution in water: -32°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.8% to 14.4%. Boiling point for 60% solution in water: 36°C. Flashpoint for 25% solution in water: 0°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: DIMETHYL CARBONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Flashpoint: 18°C c.c.

DG.name: DIMETHYLDICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: -9°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 9.5%. Immiscible with water. Reacts with water to form a complex mixture of dimethylsiloxanes and evolves hydrogen chloride, a toxic and corrosive gas. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIMETHYLHYDRAZINE, UNSYMMETRICAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint: -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2% to 95%. Miscible with water, generating heat. Reacts violently with acids. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. May react dangerously with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: DIMETHYL SULPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a disagreeable odour. Flashpoint: -37°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.2% to 19.7%. Boiling point: 37°C. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Narcotic in high concentrations.

DG.name: DIOXANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ether-like odour. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2% to 22%. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: DIOXOLANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 2°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: DIVINYL ETHER, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, clear liquid with a characteristic odour. Flashpoint: -30°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 27%. Boiling point: 30°C. Immiscible with water. In the presence of oxygen or on long standing or exposure to sunlight, unstable peroxides sometimes form; these may explode spontaneously or when heated. Strongly narcotic. Readily ignited by static electricity.

DG.name: ETHANOL (ETHYL ALCOHOL) or ETHANOL SOLUTION (ETHYL ALCOHOL SOLUTION)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquids. Pure ETHANOL: flashpoint 13°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.3% to 19%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ETHANOL (ETHYL ALCOHOL) or ETHANOL SOLUTION (ETHYL ALCOHOL SOLUTION)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquids. Pure ETHANOL: flashpoint 13°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.3% to 19%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYLENE GLYCOL MONOETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 40°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 15.6%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYLENE GLYCOL MONOETHYL ETHER ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 51°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 10.1%. Partially miscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fragrant odour. Flashpoint: -4°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.18% to 11.5%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYLBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an aromatic odour. Flashpoint: 22°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1% to 6.7%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL BORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 11°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 2-ETHYLBUTYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 54°C o.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 2-ETHYLBUTYRALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 11°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 7.7%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL BUTYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -1°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL BUTYRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a pineapple-like odour. Flashpoint: 26°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL CHLOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with a pungent and fruity odour. Flashpoint: 54°C c.c. Immiscible with water. When heated, evolves toxic and corrosive fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 16°C c.c. Reacts and decomposes with water or heat, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYLDICHLOROSILANE
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG5 SG8 SG13 SG25 SG26 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, very volatile liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: -1°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Reacts violently with water or steam to produce heat which may lead to self-ignition; toxic and corrosive fumes will be evolved. May react vigorously in contact with oxidizing substances. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYLENE DICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a chloroform-like odour. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Explosive limits: 6.2% to 15.9%. Immiscible with water. Toxic by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYLENEIMINE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless oily flammable liquid with a pungent ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint: -13°C c.c. Boiling point: 55°C. Explosive limits: 3.6% to 6.0%. Miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHYLENE GLYCOL MONOMETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 38°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 20%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYLENE GLYCOL MONOMETHYL ETHER ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a characteristic odour. Flashpoint: 44°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 8.2%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL FORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pleasant aromatic odour. Flashpoint: -20°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.5% to 16.5%. Boiling point: 54°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: OCTYL ALDEHYDES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a characteristic odour. Flashpoint: 44°C to 52°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.9% to 7.2%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL LACTATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 46°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 11.4%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL METHYL KETONE (METHYL ETHYL KETONE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -1°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 11.5%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL NITRITE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Alcoholic solution of ethyl nitrite. Extremely volatile, with an aromatic, ethereal odour. Explosive limits of the pure product: 3% to 50%. Boiling point of pure product: 17°C. Miscible or partially miscible with water. Decomposes under exposure to air, light, water or heat to evolve toxic nitrous fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Inhalation of ethyl nitrite vapours, even in small quantities, rapidly affects the heart and can be dangerous. Transport of ETHYL NITRITE pure is prohibited.

DG.name: ETHYL PROPIONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pineapple-like odour. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 11%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 14°C c.c. Readily hydrolysed by moisture, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: EXTRACTS, LIQUID, for flavour or aroma
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually consist of alcoholic solutions. Miscibility with water depends upon the composition.

DG.name: EXTRACTS, LIQUID, for flavour or aroma
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually consist of alcoholic solutions. Miscibility with water depends upon the composition.

DG.name: FORMALDEHYDE SOLUTION, FLAMMABLE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 32–60°C c.c. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FURALDEHYDES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or reddish-brown, mobile liquids with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. Explosive limits for 2-FURALDEHYDE: 2.1% to 19.3%. Flashpoints: 2-FURALDEHYDE 60°C c.c., 3-FURALDEHYDE 48°C c.c. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: FUSEL OIL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid with a disagreeable odour. A mixture consisting of amyl alcohols. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: FUSEL OIL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid with a disagreeable odour. A mixture consisting of amyl alcohols. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: GAS OIL or DIESEL FUEL or HEATING OIL, LIGHT
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water.

DG.name: MOTOR SPIRIT or GASOLINE or PETROL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water.

DG.name: NITROGLYCERIN SOLUTION IN ALCOHOL with not more than 1% nitroglycerin
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. Ignites readily. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic nitrous fumes. Not explosive in this state but damage to, or leakage from, a package may allow solvent to evaporate and thus leave the nitroglycerin in an explosive state.

DG.name: HEPTANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquids. Explosive limits: 1.1% to 6.7%. n-HEPTANE: flashpoint -4°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 32°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: HEXANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquids with a faint odour. Explosive limits: 1.1% to 7.5%. n-HEXANE: flashpoint -22°C c.c., boiling point 69°C. NEOHEXANE: flashpoint -48°C c.c., boiling point 50°C. Immiscible with water. Slightly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PRINTING INK flammable or PRINTING INK RELATED MATERIAL (including printing ink thinning or reducing compound), flammable
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fluid or viscous liquid containing colouring matter in solution or suspension. Miscibility with water depends upon the solvent.

DG.name: PRINTING INK flammable or PRINTING INK RELATED MATERIAL (including printing ink thinning or reducing compound), flammable
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fluid or viscous liquid containing colouring matter in solution or suspension. Miscibility with water depends upon the solvent.

DG.name: PRINTING INK flammable or PRINTING INK RELATED MATERIAL (including printing ink thinning or reducing compound), flammable
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fluid or viscous liquid containing colouring matter in solution or suspension. Miscibility with water depends upon the solvent.

DG.name: ISOBUTANOL (ISOBUTYL ALCOHOL)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a sweet odour. Flashpoint: 28°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 10.9%. Partially miscible with water.

DG.name: ISOBUTYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pineapple-like odour. Flashpoint: 18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.3% to 10.5%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOBUTYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -9°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.4% to 9%. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOOCTENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOPRENE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid. Flashpoint: -48°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 9.7%. Boiling point: 34°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOPROPANOL (ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, mobile liquid. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2% to 12%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an aromatic odour. Flashpoint: 11°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 7.8%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOPROPYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint: -37°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.3% to 10.4%. Boiling point: 32°C. Miscible with water. Harmful if swallowed. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Explosive limits: up to 100%. Immiscible with water. May explode on heating. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: KEROSENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water.

DG.name: MERCAPTANS, LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S. or MERCAPTAN MIXTURE, LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellow liquids with a garlic odour. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MERCAPTANS, LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S. or MERCAPTAN MIXTURE, LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellow liquids with a garlic odour. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MESITYL OXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid with a sweet odour. Flashpoint: 32°C c.c. Miscible with water.

DG.name: METHANOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Explosive limits: 6% to 36.5%. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed; may cause blindness. Avoid skin contact.

DG.name: METHYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a fragrant odour. Flashpoint: -10°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3% to 16%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: METHYLAMYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 43°C o.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYLAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a chloroform-like odour. Flashpoint: -28°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.6% to 12.6%. Boiling point: 42°C. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYLAMINE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Aqueous solution of a flammable gas having an ammonia-like odour. Explosive limits: 5% to 20.7% (pure product). Boiling point: -7°C (pure product). Commercial product is a 40% solution with: boiling point 48°C, flashpoint -13°C c.c. Miscible with water. May react explosively with mercury. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL BUTYRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 14°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 5°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL CHLOROMETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: METHYLDICHLOROSILANE
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG5 SG8 SG13 SG25 SG26 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, very volatile liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: -26°C c.c. Explosive limits: 4.5% to 70%. Boiling point: 41°C. Immiscible with water. Reacts violently with water or steam to produce heat which may lead to self-ignition; toxic and corrosive fumes will be evolved. May react vigorously in contact with oxidizing substances. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL FORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an agreeable odour. Flashpoint: -32°C c.c. Explosive limits: 5% to 22.7%. Boiling point: 32°C. Miscible with water.

DG.name: METHYLHYDRAZINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint: 20°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.5% to 98%. Miscible with water. Reacts violently with acids. May react dangerously with oxidizing substances. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL ISOBUTYL KETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pleasant odour. Flashpoint: 14°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 7.5%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYL ISOPROPENYL KETONE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pleasant odour. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 9%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYL METHACRYLATE MONOMER, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid. Flashpoint: 8°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 11.6%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL PROPIONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -2°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.4% to 13%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYL PROPYL KETONE

DG.name: METHYLTRICHLOROSILANE

Readily hydrolysed by moisture, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL VINYL KETONE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. Explosive limits: 2.1% to 15.6%. Flashpoint: -7°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NICKEL CARBONYL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellow, volatile, flammable liquid. Flashpoint: below -20°C c.c. Oxidizes in air and explodes at a temperature of 60°C. Lower explosive limit: 2.0%. Immiscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROMETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 35°C c.c. Explosive limits: 7.1% to 63%. Miscible with water. Fire and explosion hazard if package is ruptured.

DG.name: OCTANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Explosive limits: 1% to 6.5%. ISOOCTANE: flashpoint −12°C c.c. n-OCTANE: flashpoint 13°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Flashpoint: 17°C to 23°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.1% to 7%. Immiscible with water. Flashpoint: 23°C to 30°C c.c.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM, SUSPENDED IN A FLAMMABLE LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Finely divided zirconium metal in a flammable liquid. Immiscible with water. Spillage is liable to self-ignition.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM, SUSPENDED IN A FLAMMABLE LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Finely divided zirconium metal in a flammable liquid. Immiscible with water. Spillage is liable to self-ignition.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM, SUSPENDED IN A FLAMMABLE LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Finely divided zirconium metal in a flammable liquid. Immiscible with water. Spillage is liable to self-ignition.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM POWDER, COATED
DG.Segregation: SGG15 SG17 SG25 SG26 SG32 SG35 SG36 SG52
DG.Propertiesandobservations: If uncoated, it possesses the property of evolving hydrogen gas when in contact with water, especially seawater; if treated with oil or wax, it does not at ordinary temperatures. Reacts readily with acids and caustic alkalis, evolving hydrogen, a flammable gas. Reacts readily with iron oxide, producing a thermite effect. May form explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances. In the event of breakage of receptacles, the scattered powder is readily ignited by sparks or open flame and may give rise to an explosive atmosphere.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM POWDER, COATED
DG.Segregation: SGG15 SG17 SG25 SG26 SG32 SG35 SG36 SG52
DG.Propertiesandobservations: If uncoated, it possesses the property of evolving hydrogen gas when in contact with water, especially seawater; if treated with oil or wax, it does not at ordinary temperatures. Reacts readily with acids and caustic alkalis, evolving hydrogen, a flammable gas. Reacts readily with iron oxide, producing a thermite effect. May form explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances. In the event of breakage of receptacles, the scattered powder is readily ignited by sparks or open flame and may give rise to an explosive atmosphere.

DG.name: AMMONIUM PICRATE, WETTED with not less than 10% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance in pure form consists of yellow crystals. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: BORNEOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, translucent lumps. Camphor-like odour. Insoluble in water. Harmful by ingestion.

DG.name: CALCIUM RESINATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish-white, amorphous powder or lumps. Insoluble in water. Liable to spontaneous heating. Irritating to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM RESINATE, FUSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish-white, amorphous powder or lumps. Insoluble in water. Liable to spontaneous heating. Irritating to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: COBALT RESINATE, PRECIPITATED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark brownish-black solid. Insoluble in water. Readily combustible; may ignite spontaneously if contaminated with vegetable fibres (such as cotton). Irritating to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DINITROPHENOL, WETTED with not less than 15% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance when pure consists of yellow crystals. Slightly soluble in water. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DINITROPHENOLATES, WETTED with not less than 15% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosives. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DINITRORESORCINOL, WETTED with not less than 15% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Explosive when dry. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: FERROCERIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Alloy derived from cerium or mischmetal, with the addition of 10% to 65% iron. Emits sparks when struck.

DG.name: FILMS, NITROCELLULOSE BASE gelatin coated, except scrap
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Ignites readily. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air.

DG.name: HAFNIUM POWDER, WETTED with not less than 25% water (a visible excess of water must be present) (a) mechanically produced, particle size less than 53 microns; (b) chemically produced, particle size less than 840 microns
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Insoluble in water. Liable to spontaneous combustion when dry. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: HAY, STRAW or BHUSA
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Ignites readily. Liable to spontaneous combustion when wet, damp or contaminated with oil. Refuse for shipment when loose, damp, wet or contaminated with oil.

DG.name: HEXAMETHYLENETETRAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, crystalline powder. Soluble in water.

DG.name: MANGANESE RESINATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Very dark brown solid. Insoluble in water. Liable to spontaneous heating. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: MATCHES, “STRIKE ANYWHERE”
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Ignite by friction; prepared surface is not required.

DG.name: METALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals, powder or tablets. Insoluble in water. Harmful if swallowed or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CERIUM, slabs, ingots or rods
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Contains 94–99% rare earth metals. In contact with water or moist air, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. Emits sparks when scratched or struck.

DG.name: NAPHTHALENE, CRUDE or NAPHTHALENE, REFINED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline flakes or powder with a persistent odour. Evolves flammable vapours at, or below, its melting point.

DG.name: NITROGUANIDINE (PICRITE), WETTED with not less than 20% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. White solid. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: NITROSTARCH, WETTED with not less than 20% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Orange powder. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS, AMORPHOUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reddish-brown powder. Insoluble in water. Ignites readily by friction. When involved in a fire, evolves irritating fumes. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances. Harmful if swallowed or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS HEPTASULPHIDE free from yellow or white phosphorus
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow solid. Ignites readily by friction. Develops heat in contact with moist air, evolving toxic and flammable gases. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances. Harmful if swallowed or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS PENTASULPHIDE free from yellow or white phosphorus
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow solid. Ignites readily by friction. Develops heat in contact with moist air, evolving toxic and flammable gases. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances. Harmful if swallowed or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS SESQUISULPHIDE free from yellow or white phosphorus
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow solid. Ignites readily by friction. Develops heat in contact with moist air, evolving toxic and flammable gases. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances. Harmful if swallowed or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS TRISULPHIDE free from yellow or white phosphorus
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow solid. Ignites readily by friction. Develops heat in contact with moist air, evolving toxic and flammable gases. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances. Harmful if swallowed or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: TRINITROPHENOL (PICRIC ACID), WETTED with not less than 30% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance in pure form consists of yellow crystals. Soluble in water. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: RUBBER SCRAP powdered or granulated, not exceeding 840 microns and rubber content exceeding 45% or RUBBER SHODDY powdered or granulated, not exceeding 840 microns and rubber content exceeding 45%
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to spontaneous heating.

DG.name: SILICON POWDER, AMORPHOUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark brown, non-metallic powder. Burns in air, when ignited; readily flammable when mixed with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: SILVER PICRATE, WETTED with not less than 30% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Yellow crystals. Soluble in water. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Transport of SILVER PICRATE, dry or wetted with less than 30% water, by mass is prohibited.

DG.name: SODIUM DINITRO-o- CRESOLATE, WETTED with not less than 15% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance in pure form consists of yellow powder. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM PICRAMATE, WETTED with not less than 20% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance in pure form consists of yellow powder. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: SULPHUR
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When involved in a fire, evolves toxic, very irritating and suffocating gas. The dust forms an explosive mixture with air which may be ignited by static electricity. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances. Corrosive to steel, in particular in the presence of moisture. The provisions of this Code should not apply to sulphur when it is formed to a specific shape (such as prills, granules, pellets, pastilles or flakes).

DG.name: TITANIUM POWDER, WETTED with not less than 25% water (a visible excess of water must be present) (a) mechanically produced, particle size less than 53 microns; (b) chemically produced, particle size less than 840 microns
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Grey powder. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: FIBRES or FABRICS IMPREGNATED WITH WEAKLY NITRATED NITROCELLULOSE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toe board used in the manufacture of boots and shoes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air.

DG.name: TRINITROBENZENE, WETTED with not less than 30% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance in pure form consists of yellow crystals. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: TRINITROBENZOIC ACID, WETTED with not less than 30% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance in pure form consists of yellow crystals. Soluble in water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: TRINITROTOLUENE (TNT), WETTED with not less than 30% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance in pure form consists of yellow crystals. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: UREA NITRATE, WETTED with not less than 20% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Substance in pure form consists of white crystals. Soluble in water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM POWDER, WETTED with not less than 25% water (a visible excess of water must be present) (a) mechanically produced, particle size less than 53 microns; (b) chemically produced, particle size less than 840 microns
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Grey powder. Insoluble in water. Liable to spontaneous combustion when dry. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: CALCIUM PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Red to brown crystals. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CARBON, animal or vegetable origin
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black material originating from organic sources. Particularly includes carbon blacks of animal or vegetable origin, other non-activated carbon materials and charcoal produced from materials such as bone, bamboo, coconut shell, jute and wood. Liable to heat slowly and ignite spontaneously in air.

DG.name: CARBON animal or vegetable origin
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black material originating from organic sources. Particularly includes carbon blacks of animal or vegetable origin, other non-activated carbon materials and charcoal produced from materials such as bone, bamboo, coconut shell, jute and wood. Liable to heat slowly and ignite spontaneously in air.

DG.name: CARBON, ACTIVATED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Activated porous black carbon materials not including charcoal (see UN 1361). May be in the form of powder, granules, pellets, fibres or felts. If chemically activated, may self-heat, and may ignite spontaneously in air.

DG.name: COPRA
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dried kernels of coconuts, with a penetrating rancid odour which may taint other cargoes.

DG.name: COTTON WASTE, OILY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fibres of vegetable origin.

DG.name: COTTON, WET
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Readily combustible, liable to ignite spontaneously according to moisture content.

DG.name: p-NITROSODIMETHYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark green, crystalline solid, insoluble in water. Ignites spontaneously in air when dry. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: FIBRES, ANIMAL or FIBRES, VEGETABLE burnt, wet or damp
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously according to moisture content.

DG.name: FIBRES or FABRICS, ANIMAL or VEGETABLE or SYNTHETIC, N.O.S. with oil
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously according to the oil content.

DG.name: FISH MEAL, UNSTABILIZED or FISH SCRAP, UNSTABILIZED High hazard. Unrestricted moisture content. Unrestricted fat content in excess of 12%, by mass; unrestricted fat content in excess of 15%, by mass, in the case of anti-oxidant treated fishmeal or fishscrap
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown to greenish-brown product derived from oily fish. Strong odour which may affect other cargo. Liable to heat and ignite spontaneously.

DG.name: FISH MEAL, UNSTABILIZED or FISH SCRAP, UNSTABILIZED Not anti-oxidant treated. Moisture content: more than 5% but not more than 12%, by mass. Fat content: not more than 12%, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown to greenish-brown product derived from oily fish. Strong odour which may affect other cargo. Liable to heat and ignite spontaneously.

DG.name: IRON OXIDE, SPENT or IRON SPONGE, SPENT obtained from coal gas purification
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Obtained from coal gas purification. Strong odour which may taint other cargo. Liable to heat and ignite spontaneously. May evolve hydrogen sulphide, sulphur dioxide and hydrogen cyanide, which are toxic gases. This substance should have been cooled and weathered for not less than eight weeks before shipment, unless packed in a metal drum.

DG.name: METAL CATALYST, WETTED with a visible excess of liquid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously if dry.

DG.name: PAPER, UNSATURATED OIL TREATED incompletely dried (including carbon paper)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously. The provisions of this Code should not apply to manufactured articles properly aged.

DG.name: PENTABORANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Boiling point range: 48°C to 63°C. Ignites spontaneously in air. Decomposes in contact with water, evolving hydrogen, a flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS, WHITE or YELLOW, DRY or UNDER WATER or IN SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Ignites spontaneously in air. Melting point: 44°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Receptacles are usually filled with substance in the liquid state which subsequently solidifies. A sufficient ullage should be allowed.

DG.name: POTASSIUM SULPHIDE, ANHYDROUS or POTASSIUM SULPHIDE with less than 30% water of crystallization
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black solid, absorbs moisture to become crystalline. Liable to ignite spontaneously. In contact with acids, evolves hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: PYROPHORIC METAL, N.O.S. or PYROPHORIC ALLOY, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. If shaken, may produce sparks. In contact with water, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas.

DG.name: SODIUM DITHIONITE (SODIUM HYDROSULPHITE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or grey crystalline powder. Liable to heat and ignite spontaneously in air and to evolve sulphur dioxide, an irritating gas.

DG.name: SODIUM SULPHIDE, ANHYDROUS or SODIUM SULPHIDE with less than 30% water of crystallization
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black solid, absorbs moisture to become crystalline. Liable to ignite spontaneously. In contact with acids, evolves hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: SEED CAKE, containing vegetable oil (a) mechanically expelled seeds, containing more than 10% oil or more than 20% oil and moisture combined
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Residue remaining after oil has been expelled mechanically from oil-bearing seeds. Used mainly as animal feed or fertilizer. The most common seed cakes include those derived from coconut (copra), cottonseed, groundnut (peanut), linseed, maize (hominy chop), niger seed, palm kernel, rape seed, rice bran, soya bean and sunflower seed and they may be shipped in the form of cake, flakes, pellets, meal, etc. May self-heat slowly and, if wet or containing an excessive proportion of unoxidized oil, ignite spontaneously. Before shipment, this cargo should be properly aged. The duration of ageing varies with the oil content. Smoking and the use of naked lights should be prohibited during loading and unloading and on entry to the cargo space(s) at any time.

DG.name: SEED CAKE, containing vegetable oil (b) solvent extractions and expelled seeds, containing not more than 10% of oil and when the amount of moisture is higher than 10%, not more than 20% of oil and moisture combined
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Residue remaining after oil has been expelled mechanically from oil-bearing seeds. Used mainly as animal feed or fertilizer. The most common seed cakes include those derived from coconut (copra), cottonseed, groundnut (peanut), linseed, maize (hominy chop), niger seed, palm kernel, rape seed, rice bran, soya bean and sunflower seed and they may be shipped in the form of cake, flakes, pellets, meal, etc. May self-heat slowly and, if wet or containing an excessive proportion of unoxidized oil, ignite spontaneously. Before shipment, this cargo should be properly aged. The duration of ageing varies with the oil content. Smoking and the use of naked lights should be prohibited during loading and unloading and on entry to the cargo space(s) at any time.

DG.name: WOOL WASTE, WET
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air according to moisture content.

DG.name: ALKALI METAL AMALGAM, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Silvery liquid, consisting of metal alloyed with mercury. Reacts with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, a flammable gas. When heated, evolves toxic vapours.

DG.name: ALKALI METAL AMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Small crystals. Decomposes in contact with water or acids, evolving ammonia vapour and producing highly caustic alkaline solutions.

DG.name: ALKALI METAL DISPERSION or ALKALINE EARTH METAL DISPERSION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Finely divided alkali metal or alkaline earth metal, suspended in a liquid. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: ALKALINE EARTH METAL AMALGAM, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Consists of metal alloyed with mercury. Contains 2% to 10% alkaline earth metals and may contain up to 98% mercury. Reacts with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, a flammable gas. When heated, evolves toxic vapours.

DG.name: ALKALINE EARTH METAL ALLOY, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When containing a substantial proportion of alkaline earth metals, readily decomposed by water and reacts violently with acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM CARBIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals or powder. In contact with water, rapidly evolves methane, a flammable gas. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM FERROSILICON POWDER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, caustic alkalis or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. Impurities may, under similar circumstances, produce phosphine and arsine, which are highly toxic gases.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM POWDER, UNCOATED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, caustic alkalis or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. When finely divided aluminium dust is scattered, it is easily ignited by naked lights, causing explosion. May explode when in contact with oxidizing substances. Reacts with liquid halogenated hydrocarbons.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM POWDER, UNCOATED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, caustic alkalis or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. When finely divided aluminium dust is scattered, it is easily ignited by naked lights, causing explosion. May explode when in contact with oxidizing substances. Reacts with liquid halogenated hydrocarbons.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals or powder. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM SILICON POWDER, UNCOATED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, caustic alkalis or acids, generates heat and evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. May also evolve silanes, which are toxic and may ignite spontaneously.

DG.name: BARIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Readily decomposes in water and reacts violently with acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Harmful if swallowed or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CALCIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Readily decomposes in water and reacts violently with acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: CALCIUM CARBIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. In contact with water, rapidly evolves acetylene, a highly flammable gas, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Acetylene forms highly explosive compounds with salts of some heavy metals. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: CALCIUM CARBIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. In contact with water, rapidly evolves acetylene, a highly flammable gas, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Acetylene forms highly explosive compounds with salts of some heavy metals. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: CALCIUM CYANAMIDE with more than 0.1% calcium carbide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Powder or granules. Contains calcium carbide as an impurity. In contact with water, evolves ammonia and acetylene, which is a highly flammable gas. Reacts vigorously with acids.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. In contact with water, acids or moisture, evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: CALCIUM SILICIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. If calcium carbide is present as an impurity, acetylene will also be evolved. In contact with acids, evolves silane, a spontaneously flammable gas.

DG.name: CALCIUM SILICIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. If calcium carbide is present as an impurity, acetylene will also be evolved. In contact with acids, evolves silane, a spontaneously flammable gas.

DG.name: CAESIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, ductile, soft metal. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Highly reactive, sometimes with explosive effect.

DG.name: FERROSILICON with 30% or more but less than 90% silicon
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with moisture, water, alkalis or acids, may evolve hydrogen, a flammable gas, which may form explosive mixtures with air, and also arsine and phosphine, which are highly toxic gases. These gases are evolved in proportions which, under mechanically ventilated conditions, make the poison hazard by far predominant over the explosion hazard. The rate of gas evolution is greatest from freshly broken surfaces, so is liable to increase whenever the cargo is disturbed, such as during loading. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by vapour inhalation.

DG.name: METAL HYDRIDES, WATER-REACTIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React with water, moisture or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: METAL HYDRIDES, WATER-REACTIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React with water, moisture or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: LITHIUM ALUMINIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. In contact with water, acids or moisture, evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: LITHIUM ALUMINIUM HYDRIDE, ETHEREAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear, colourless solution of lithium aluminium hydride in ether. Reacts readily with water, evolving hydrogen, a flammable gas. Evaporates readily to leave a residue which is easily ignited by a spark or friction.

DG.name: LITHIUM BOROHYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline, hygroscopic solid. In contact with water, acids or moisture, evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: LITHIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. In contact with water, acids or moisture, evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: LITHIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, ductile, soft metal. Floats on water. Readily decomposes in water and reacts violently with acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. For fire-fighting purposes, dry lithium chloride powder, dry sodium chloride or graphite powder should be carried on board when this substance is transported.

DG.name: LITHIUM SILICON
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Shiny lumps, crystals or powder, with sharp irritating odour. Reacts readily with water, evolving hydrogen and silane, flammable gases. Enough heat may be generated to ignite the gas mixture in air.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM POWDER or MAGNESIUM ALLOYS POWDER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with moisture, water or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. Magnesium dust is easily ignited, causing explosion. May explode when in contact with oxidizing substances. For fire-fighting purposes, dry lithium chloride powder, dry sodium chloride or graphite powder should be carried on board when this substance is transported. Reacts with liquid halogenated hydrocarbons.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM POWDER or MAGNESIUM ALLOYS POWDER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with moisture, water or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. Magnesium dust is easily ignited, causing explosion. May explode when in contact with oxidizing substances. For fire-fighting purposes, dry lithium chloride powder, dry sodium chloride or graphite powder should be carried on board when this substance is transported. Reacts with liquid halogenated hydrocarbons.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM POWDER or MAGNESIUM ALLOYS POWDER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with moisture, water or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. Magnesium dust is easily ignited, causing explosion. May explode when in contact with oxidizing substances. For fire-fighting purposes, dry lithium chloride powder, dry sodium chloride or graphite powder should be carried on board when this substance is transported. Reacts with liquid halogenated hydrocarbons.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM ALUMINIUM PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM METAL ALLOYS, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Soft, silvery metal liquid. Floats on water. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Highly reactive, sometimes with explosive effect.

DG.name: ALKALI METAL ALLOY, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flows like mercury at ordinary temperatures. Not volatile. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, a flammable gas, and developing considerable heat, which may ignite the gas.

DG.name: POTASSIUM SODIUM ALLOYS, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Soft, silvery metal liquid. Floats on water. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Highly reactive, sometimes with explosive effect.

DG.name: RUBIDIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Silvery-white, ductile, soft metal. Melting point: 39°C. Floats on water. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Highly reactive, sometimes with explosive effect.

DG.name: SODIUM BOROHYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline powder. In contact with water, acids or moisture, evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: SODIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. In contact with water, acids or moisture, evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: SODIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, ductile, soft metal. Floats on water. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Highly reactive, sometimes with explosive effect.

DG.name: SODIUM METHYLATE
