DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, amorphous, free-flowing, hygroscopic powder. Decomposed by water to form methanol, a flammable liquid, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SODIUM PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: STANNIC PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Silver-white solid. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ZINC ASHES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with moisture or water, liable to evolve dangerous gases, including hydrogen, a flammable gas.

DG.name: ZINC POWDER or ZINC DUST
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, alkalis or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. Zinc dust is easily ignited, causing explosion. May explode when in contact with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: ZINC POWDER or ZINC DUST
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, alkalis or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. Zinc dust is easily ignited, causing explosion. May explode when in contact with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: ZINC POWDER or ZINC DUST
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, alkalis or acids, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. Zinc dust is easily ignited, causing explosion. May explode when in contact with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black coloured powder.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or white crystals. Deliquescent. Soluble in water. Slightly corrosive. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: AMMONIUM DICHROMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Orange needles. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. May ignite spontaneously in contact with acids. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: AMMONIUM PERCHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. When heated, decomposes readily, even with explosion, evolving toxic fumes. Forms highly explosive mixtures with combustible material or powdered metals. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite.

DG.name: AMMONIUM PERSULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite.

DG.name: BARIUM CHLORATE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or powder. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM PERCHLORATE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder, soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM PERMANGANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brownish-violet crystals. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid and hydrogen peroxide. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM PEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BROMATES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React vigorously with sulphuric acid. React fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction, and may form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Transport of ammonium bromate and mixtures of a bromate with an ammonium salt is prohibited.

DG.name: CAESIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: CALCIUM CHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White to yellowish deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CALCIUM CHLORITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Sensitive to heat. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CALCIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White deliquescent solid, soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: CALCIUM PERCHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CALCIUM PERMANGANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Violet deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Occurs in hydrated form. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid and hydrogen peroxide. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CALCIUM PEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish powder. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or on contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen.

DG.name: CHLORATE AND BORATE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CHLORATE AND BORATE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CHLORATE AND MAGNESIUM CHLORIDE MIXTURE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Deliquescent solid. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CHLORATE AND MAGNESIUM CHLORIDE MIXTURE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Deliquescent solid. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CHLORATES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React vigorously with sulphuric acid. React fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Transport of ammonium chlorate and mixtures of a chlorate with an ammonium salt is prohibited.

DG.name: CHLORITES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React vigorously with sulphuric acid. React fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Transport of ammonium chlorite and mixtures of a chlorite with an ammonium salt is prohibited.

DG.name: CHROMIUM TRIOXIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark purplish-red deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material may ignite spontaneously and may even explode. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIDYMIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Hygroscopic solid. Mixture of neodymium nitrate and praseodymium nitrate. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: FERRIC NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Violet deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Melting point: 47°C. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Solutions in water are slightly corrosive to most metals. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: GUANIDINE NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White granules. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. NITROGUANIDINE is a different substance.

DG.name: LEAD NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: LEAD PERCHLORATE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: LITHIUM HYPOCHLORITE, DRY or LITHIUM HYPOCHLORITE MIXTURE
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder with pungent odour. Soluble in water. Critical ambient temperature of decomposition may be as low as 60°C. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Dust irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: LITHIUM HYPOCHLORITE, DRY or LITHIUM HYPOCHLORITE MIXTURE
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder with pungent odour. Soluble in water. Critical ambient temperature of decomposition may be as low as 60°C. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Dust irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: LITHIUM PEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Soluble in water. Solution in water is an alkaline corrosive liquid. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM BROMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White deliquescent crystals or crystalline powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White deliquescent crystals, soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM PERCHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM PEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: NITRATES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. Solid mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: NITRATES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. Solid mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: PERCHLORATES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React vigorously with sulphuric acid. React fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: PERCHLORATES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React vigorously with sulphuric acid. React fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: PERMANGANATES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React vigorously with sulphuric acid. React fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Transport of ammonium permanganate and mixtures of a permanganate with an ammonium salt is prohibited.

DG.name: PERMANGANATES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. React vigorously with sulphuric acid. React fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Transport of ammonium permanganate and mixtures of a permanganate with an ammonium salt is prohibited.

DG.name: PEROXIDES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen.

DG.name: PEROXIDES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen.

DG.name: POTASSIUM BROMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible materials, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: POTASSIUM CHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: POTASSIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: POTASSIUM NITRATE AND SODIUM NITRITE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Deliquescent solid. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material such as wood, cotton or straw. Mixtures with ammonium compounds or cyanides may explode. Harmful if swallowed. May be shipped in the form of fused solid block or lumps.

DG.name: POTASSIUM NITRITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or slightly yellowish deliquescent crystals or sticks. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Mixtures with ammonium compounds or cyanides may explode. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: POTASSIUM PERCHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder, soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: POTASSIUM PERMANGANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark purple crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid and hydrogen peroxide. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: POTASSIUM PEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow powder. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite, following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM PERSULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixture with powdered metals or ammonium compounds.

DG.name: SILVER NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed. Irritating to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SODIUM BROMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: SODIUM CHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: SODIUM CHLORITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless deliquescent solid. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: SODIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless deliquescent solid. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed. This substance in the impure form is known as Chile Saltpetre.

DG.name: SODIUM NITRATE AND POTASSIUM NITRATE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, hygroscopic solid. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed. Mixture prepared as a fertilizer.

DG.name: SODIUM NITRITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless deliquescent solid. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Mixtures with ammonium compounds or cyanides may explode. Decomposes if heated, giving off toxic nitrous fumes and gases supporting combustion. Harmful if swallowed or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM PERCHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or powder, soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: SODIUM PERMANGANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Red crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid and hydrogen peroxide. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: SODIUM PEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale yellow coarse powder or granules. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite, following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SODIUM PERSULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixture with powdered metals or ammonium compounds.

DG.name: STRONTIUM CHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless deliquescent solid, soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: STRONTIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless solid. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: STRONTIUM PERCHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or powder, soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: STRONTIUM PEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless powder. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible materials may ignite following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen.

DG.name: TETRANITROMETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Freezing point: 12.5°C. Insoluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited, burn fiercely and may also explode by friction or shock. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: UREA HYDROGEN PEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ZINC AMMONIUM NITRITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Transport is prohibited.

DG.name: ZINC CHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish crystals. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: ZINC NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless solid. Soluble in water. Melting point: 36°C. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Solutions in water are slightly corrosive. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: ZINC PERMANGANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Violet-brown or black crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid and hydrogen peroxide. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: ZINC PEROXIDE
DG.Segregation: SGG7 SGG16 SG16 SG26 SG35 SG59
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM PICRAMATE, WETTED with not less than 20% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Highly explosive in the dry state or if insufficiently wetted. May react violently in contact with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: ACETONE CYANOHYDRIN, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to amber liquid evolving toxic vapour. Miscible with water. Unstable in contact with acids and alkalis, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALKALOIDS, SOLID, N.O.S. or ALKALOIDS SALTS, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids, generally of vegetable origin. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALKALOIDS, SOLID, N.O.S. or ALKALOIDS SALTS, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids, generally of vegetable origin. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALKALOIDS, SOLID, N.O.S. or ALKALOIDS SALTS, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids, generally of vegetable origin. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALLYL ISOTHIOCYANATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid evolving toxic vapour which is irritating and causes tears. Flashpoint: 46°C c.c. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: AMMONIUM ARSENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder or crystals. Soluble in water. Reacts with alkalis, evolving ammonia gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily, volatile liquid. Reacts with acids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ANILINE HYDROCHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, crystalline solid. Soluble in water. Decomposes to aniline in contact with alkalis. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ANTIMONY COMPOUND, INORGANIC, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ANTIMONY LACTATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder or crystals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ANTIMONY POTASSIUM TARTRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or white powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC ACID, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent crystals which readily become liquid. Melting point: approximately 35°C. Miscible with water. In contact with metals, may evolve arsine, an extremely toxic gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC ACID, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals with a relatively high melting point. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent crystals. Melting point: approximately 33°C. Decomposed by water, evolving hydrogen bromide, an irritating and corrosive gas, apparent as white fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S. inorganic, including: Arsenates, n.o.s., Arsenites, n.o.s., and Arsenic sulphides, n.o.s.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic liquids. In contact with acids, arsenic sulphide evolves hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S. inorganic, including: Arsenates, n.o.s., Arsenites, n.o.s., and Arsenic sulphides, n.o.s.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic liquids. In contact with acids, arsenic sulphide evolves hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S. inorganic, including: Arsenates, n.o.s., Arsenites, n.o.s., and Arsenic sulphides, n.o.s.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic liquids. In contact with acids, arsenic sulphide evolves hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S. inorganic, including: Arsenates, n.o.s.; Arsenites, n.o.s.; and Arsenic sulphides, n.o.s.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic solids. In contact with acids, arsenic sulphide evolves hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S. inorganic, including: Arsenates, n.o.s.; Arsenites, n.o.s.; and Arsenic sulphides, n.o.s.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic solids. In contact with acids, arsenic sulphide evolves hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S. inorganic, including: Arsenates, n.o.s.; Arsenites, n.o.s.; and Arsenic sulphides, n.o.s.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic solids. In contact with acids, arsenic sulphide evolves hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Silvery, brittle, crystalline solid with the appearance of a metal. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC PENTOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC TRICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid. Fumes in moist air, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas, apparent as white fumes. Reacts with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENIC TRIOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ARSENICAL DUST
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fine powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM COMPOUND, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder, lumps or crystals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM COMPOUND, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder, lumps or crystals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BERYLLIUM COMPOUND, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BERYLLIUM COMPOUND, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BERYLLIUM POWDER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, metallic powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOACETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When pure, colourless liquid evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Flashpoint: approximately 45°C c.c. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BRUCINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM AZIDE, WETTED with not less than 50% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. White crystals or powder. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: CACODYLIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or white powder with an offensive odour. Soluble in water. May react with acids, evolving dimethylarsine, an extremely toxic gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CALCIUM ARSENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CALCIUM ARSENATE AND CALCIUM ARSENITE MIXTURE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CALCIUM CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Decomposes slowly in water to form a weak hydrogen cyanide solution. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CHLORODINITROBENZENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. May explode if involved in a fire. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLORONITROBENZENES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals. Melting point: approximately 30°C to 80°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: 4-CHLORO-o-TOLUIDINE HYDROCHLORIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dry solid or paste. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROPICRIN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROPICRIN AND METHYL BROMIDE MIXTURE with more than 2% chloropicrin
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Extremely volatile liquid evolving highly toxic vapours. Highly toxic by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes; vapour irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROPICRIN AND METHYL CHLORIDE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Extremely volatile liquid evolving highly toxic vapours. Highly toxic by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes; vapour irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROPICRIN MIXTURE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of liquid mixtures. May evolve highly toxic vapour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROPICRIN MIXTURE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of liquid mixtures. May evolve highly toxic vapour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROPICRIN MIXTURE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of liquid mixtures. May evolve highly toxic vapour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: COPPER ACETOARSENITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: COPPER ARSENITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish-green powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: COPPER CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green powder. Slightly soluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CYANIDES, INORGANIC, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. May be soluble in water. On contact with water, may form a weak hydrogen cyanide solution. React with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. The provisions of this Code shall not apply to complex ferricyanides and ferrocyanides.

DG.name: CYANIDES, INORGANIC, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. May be soluble in water. On contact with water, may form a weak hydrogen cyanide solution. React with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. The provisions of this Code shall not apply to complex ferricyanides and ferrocyanides.

DG.name: CYANIDES, INORGANIC, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. May be soluble in water. On contact with water, may form a weak hydrogen cyanide solution. React with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. The provisions of this Code shall not apply to complex ferricyanides and ferrocyanides.

DG.name: CYANOGEN CHLORIDE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with an irritating odour. Produces severe tearing of the eyes. On contact with water, reacts violently to give off highly toxic and corrosive fumes. Much heavier than air (2.1). Boiling point: 13°C. Toxic by skin contact or by inhalation. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICHLOROANILINES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a penetrating odour. Liquid mixtures of various isomers of dichloroanilines, some of which in the pure state may be solid, with a melting point varying from 24°C to 72°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: o-DICHLOROBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Volatile liquid. Melting point: approximately -17°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DICHLOROMETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with heavy vapours. Boiling point: 40°C. When involved in a fire, evolves extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIETHYL SULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid. Readily hydrolysed by moisture to sulphuric acid, which is a corrosive liquid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIMETHYL SULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid evolving toxic vapours. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DINITROANILINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals in pure form. Insoluble in water. May explode if involved in a fire. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DINITROBENZENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow solutions. May explode if involved in a fire. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DINITROBENZENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow solutions. May explode if involved in a fire. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DINITRO-o-CRESOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals or crystallized mass. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: DINITROPHENOL SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Substance when pure consists of yellow crystals. Slightly soluble in water. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DINITROPHENOL SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Substance when pure consists of yellow crystals. Slightly soluble in water. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DINITROTOLUENES, MOLTEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Molten liquid. This entry covers the 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5-, 2,6-, 3,4- and 3,5-isomers having melting points between 52°C and 93°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DISINFECTANT, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DISINFECTANT, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DISINFECTANT, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DYE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S. or DYE INTERMEDIATE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic liquids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DYE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S. or DYE INTERMEDIATE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic liquids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DYE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S. or DYE INTERMEDIATE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic liquids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHYL BROMOACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Flashpoint: 58°C c.c. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHYLENEDIAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Volatile, colourless, hygroscopic flammable liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint: 34°C c.c. Miscible with water. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: ETHYLENE DIBROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: FERRIC ARSENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: FERRIC ARSENITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown or yellow powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: FERROUS ARSENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: HEXAETHYL TETRAPHOSPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HEXAETHYL TETRAPHOSPHATE AND COMPRESSED GAS MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HYDROCYANIC ACID, AQUEOUS SOLUTION (HYDROGEN CYANIDE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION) with not more than 20% hydrogen cyanide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid evolving extremely toxic vapour with a bitter almond odour. Miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Transport of HYDROCYANIC ACID, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with more than 20% hydrogen cyanide and of HYDROGEN CYANIDE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with more than 20% hydrogen cyanide is prohibited.

DG.name: HYDROGEN CYANIDE, STABILIZED containing less than 3% water and absorbed in a porous inert material
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Very volatile, colourless liquid, evolving extremely toxic flammable vapours, absorbed in a porous inert material. Miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: LEAD ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals, or brown or grey lumps. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: LEAD ARSENATES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: LEAD ARSENITES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: LEAD CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Slightly soluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: LONDON PURPLE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Mixture of arsenic trioxide, lime and ferric oxide, used as an insecticide. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM ARSENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURIC ARSENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURIC CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURIC NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURIC POTASSIUM CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Soluble in water. Reacts with acids, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCUROUS NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY AMMONIUM CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY BENZOATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY BROMIDES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY GLUCONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY IODIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Red crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY NUCLEATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown powder containing about 20% mercury. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY OLEATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow oily paste. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY OXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Orange powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY OXYCYANIDE, DESENSITIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. May explode if involved in a fire. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. Should be sufficiently phlegmatized (mercury oxycyanide–mercury cyanide mixtures containing not less than 65% by mass of mercury cyanide can be regarded as adequately phlegmatized). Transport of MERCURY OXYCYANIDE pure is prohibited.

DG.name: MERCURY POTASSIUM IODIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow, deliquescent crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY SALICYLATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY SULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Decomposes in water, forming sulphuric acid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY THIOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: METHYL BROMIDE AND ETHYLENE DIBROMIDE MIXTURE, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solutions of methyl bromide gas, evolving toxic vapour. Methyl bromide has a boiling point of approximately 4°C. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ACETONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid. Flashpoint: 2°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3% to 16%. Miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic cyanide fumes. Harmful if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MOTOR FUEL ANTI-KNOCK MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Volatile liquids evolving toxic vapour. Mixture of tetraethyllead or tetramethyllead with ethylene dibromide and ethylene dichloride. Insoluble in water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: beta-NAPHTHYLAMINE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NAPHTHYLTHIOUREA
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NAPHTHYLUREA
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NICKEL CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Thick colourless oil, turning brown on exposure to air. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S. or NICOTINE PREPARATION, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S. or NICOTINE PREPARATION, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S. or NICOTINE PREPARATION, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE HYDROCHLORIDE, LIQUID or SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE HYDROCHLORIDE, LIQUID or SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE SALICYLATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE SULPHATE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE SULPHATE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE TARTRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NITRIC OXIDE, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. Strong oxidizing agent. On contact with air, gives off brown fumes which are toxic by inhalation, with delayed effect similar to phosgene. Heavier than air (1.04). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROANILINES (o-, m-, p-)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. ortho-NITROANILINES may be carried in the molten state.

DG.name: NITROBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Oily liquid, evolving toxic vapour. Melting point: approximately 6°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROPHENOLS (o-, m-, p-)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals. Some isomers may have a melting point as low as 44°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. May be carried in the molten state.

DG.name: NITROTOLUENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquids. Melting points: ortho-NITROTOLUENE: -4°C, meta-NITROTOLUENE: 15°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROXYLENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquids. Melting points: 2-NITRO-3-XYLENE: 14°C to 16°C, 3-NITRO-2-XYLENE: 7°C to 9°C, 4-NITRO-3-XYLENE: 2°C. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PENTACHLOROETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PERCHLOROMETHYL MERCAPTAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow, oily, volatile liquid evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Slowly decomposes in contact with water, producing hydrochloric acid. Reacts with iron or steel, evolving carbon tetrachloride. Corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHENOL, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or white crystals or crystallized mass. Melting point: 43°C (pure product). Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by vapour inhalation. Rapidly absorbed through the skin.

DG.name: PHENYLCARBYLAMINE CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale yellow, oily liquid with an irritating unpleasant odour. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHENYLENEDIAMINES (o-, m-, p-)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. May be carried in the molten state.

DG.name: PHENYLMERCURIC ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM ARSENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or white powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM ARSENITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM CUPROCYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM CYANIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent crystals or lumps. Soluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SILVER ARSENITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SILVER CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Insoluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM ARSENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM ARSENITE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM ARSENITE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM AZIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. May react vigorously with acids to form hydrazoic acid, which is an explosive. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts. May explode if involved in a fire. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM CACODYLATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent solid with a foul odour. Reacts with acids, evolving dimethylarsine, an extremely toxic gas. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM CYANIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent crystals or lumps. Soluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM FLUORIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. React with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, irritating and corrosive gas, apparent as white fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: STRONTIUM ARSENITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: STRYCHNINE or STRYCHNINE SALTS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Strychnine is slightly soluble; the salts are soluble in water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: TEAR GAS SUBSTANCE, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: “Tear gas substance” is a generic term for substances which, in minute quantities dispersed in air, cause extreme eye irritation and profuse tears. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TEAR GAS SUBSTANCE, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: “Tear gas substance” is a generic term for substances which, in minute quantities dispersed in air, cause extreme eye irritation and profuse tears. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOBENZYL CYANIDES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Volatile liquids evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Melting points: ortho-BROMOBENZYL CYANIDE 1°C. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROACETONE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, corrosive, colourless liquid, evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Miscible with water. Flashpoint: 25°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROACETOPHENONE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Melting point may be as low as 20°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIPHENYLAMINE CHLOROARSINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Volatile, yellow crystals evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIPHENYLCHLOROARSINE, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When pure, colourless liquid. The commercial product may be a dark brown liquid. Volatile liquid evolving an irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TEAR GAS CANDLES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Devices containing tear-producing substances which, in minute quantities dispersed in air, cause extreme eye irritation and profuse tears.

DG.name: XYLYL BROMIDE, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid, evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 1,1,2,2-TETRACHLOROETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a chloroform-like odour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TETRAETHYL DITHIOPYROPHOSPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: THALLIUM COMPOUND, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: TOLUIDINES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2,4-TOLUYLENEDIAMINE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: TRICHLOROETHYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a chloroform-like odour. When involved in a fire, evolves extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: XYLIDINES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ZINC ARSENATE or ZINC ARSENITE or ZINC ARSENATE AND ZINC ARSENITE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solid. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ZINC CYANIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ZINC PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Grey crystals or powder. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: ACETIC ANHYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with an irritating odour. Flashpoint: 54°C c.c. Immiscible with water. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: ACETYL BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen bromide, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: ACETYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 5°C c.c. Boiling point: 51°C. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BUTYL ACID PHOSPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid. Insoluble in water. Mildly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: CAUSTIC ALKALI LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CAUSTIC ALKALI LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALLYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid, extremely irritating odour, causes tears. Flashpoint: 31°C c.c. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALLYL IODIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid with an irritating odour. Flashpoint: 5°C c.c. Immiscible with water. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALLYLTRICHLOROSILANE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 35°C c.c. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas, apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM BROMIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White to yellowish hygroscopic crystals. Forms corrosive vapours in moist air. Reacts violently with water, evolving heat and hydrogen bromide, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. The solid hydrated form of this substance is not subject to the provisions of this Code.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM CHLORIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White to yellowish hygroscopic crystals. Forms corrosive vapours in moist air. Reacts violently with water, evolving heat and hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. The solid hydrated form of this substance is not subject to the provisions of this Code.

DG.name: AMMONIUM HYDROGENDIFLUORIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White deliquescent crystals. Decomposed by heat or acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, extremely irritating and corrosive gas, apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Causes burns to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: ANISOYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline powder. Melting point: 22°C. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: ANTIMONY PENTACHLORIDE, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow, oily liquid with an offensive odour. May solidify by absorption of moisture. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ANTIMONY PENTACHLORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid with an offensive odour. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ANTIMONY PENTACHLORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid with an offensive odour. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ANTIMONY PENTAFLUORIDE
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG8 SG10 SG12 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. When anhydrous, mildly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an irritating gas, highly corrosive to glass and other siliceous materials and most metals. Powerful oxidant, may cause fire in contact with readily flammable organic substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ANTIMONY TRICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts slowly with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: BENZOYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid, very irritating odour, causes tears. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: BENZYL BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour, causes tears. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BENZYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Causes tears. Immiscible with water, but hydrolyses slowly in contact with it. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by vapour inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BENZYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an irritating odour. Reacts with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGENDIFLUORIDES, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solids. Decomposed by heat or acid, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an extremely irritating and corrosive gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGENDIFLUORIDES, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solids. Decomposed by heat or acid, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an extremely irritating and corrosive gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BORON TRICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. Forms dense white corrosive fumes in moist air. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Much heavier than air (2.35). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BORON TRIFLUORIDE ACETIC ACID COMPLEX, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BORON TRIFLUORIDE PROPIONIC ACID COMPLEX, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BROMINE or BROMINE SOLUTION
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Very dark brown, heavy liquid with an extremely irritating odour. Density: 3.1 (pure product). Boiling point: 59°C. Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. Highly corrosive to most metals. Solutions have the same properties to a lesser degree, depending on concentration. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BROMINE PENTAFLUORIDE
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, heavy liquid with an extremely irritating odour. Boiling point: 40°C. Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic material such as wood, cotton or straw. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, extremely corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In contact with acids or acid fumes, evolves highly toxic fumes of bromine, fluorine and their compounds. Highly corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BROMINE TRIFLUORIDE
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, heavy liquid with an extremely irritating odour. Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic material such as wood, cotton or straw. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, extremely corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In contact with acids or acid fumes, evolves highly toxic fumes of bromine, fluorine and their compounds. Highly corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BUTYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 52°C c.c. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, DRY or CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE MIXTURE, DRY with more than 39% available chlorine (8.8% available oxygen)
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine-like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Dust irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, DRY or CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE MIXTURE, DRY with more than 39% available chlorine (8.8% available oxygen)
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine-like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Dust irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLORINE TRIFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. Forms dense, white, corrosive fumes in moist air. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Powerful oxidizing agent which may cause fires with combustible materials. Much heavier than air. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROACETIC ACID SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROACETIC ACID, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, very deliquescent crystals. Melting point may be as low as 50°C. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROACETYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid, with extremely irritating odour, causing tears. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROPHENYL- TRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROSULPHONIC ACID (with or without sulphur trioxide)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHROMIC ACID SOLUTION
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG8 SG10 SG12 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Orange liquid. Powerful oxidant. May cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHROMIC ACID SOLUTION
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG8 SG10 SG12 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Orange liquid. Powerful oxidant. May cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHROMIC FLUORIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green or violet crystals. Slightly soluble in water. Reacts with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an extremely irritating and corrosive gas. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHROMIC FLUORIDE SOLUTION
