DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green liquid. Reacts with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an extremely irritating and corrosive gas. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHROMIC FLUORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green liquid. Reacts with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an extremely irritating and corrosive gas. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHROMIUM OXYCHLORIDE
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark red liquid. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride and chlorine, both highly irritating and corrosive gases apparent as white fumes. Oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. Highly corrosive to most metals. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CORROSIVE SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CORROSIVE SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CORROSIVE SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CORROSIVE LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CORROSIVE LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CORROSIVE LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CUPRIETHYLENEDIAMINE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark purple liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Corrosive to copper, aluminium, zinc and tin. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CUPRIETHYLENEDIAMINE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark purple liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Corrosive to copper, aluminium, zinc and tin. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CYCLOHEXENYLTRICHLORO- SILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CYCLOHEXYLTRICHLORO- SILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICHLOROACETIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Melting point: -4°C. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICHLOROACETYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an extremely irritating odour, causing tears. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICHLOROPHENYL- TRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIETHYLDICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 25°C c.c. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIFLUOROPHOSPHORIC ACID, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass and other siliceous materials. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: DIPHENYLDICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIPHENYLMETHYL BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid with an irritating odour. Causes tears. Melting point: 45°C. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: DODECYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FERRIC CHLORIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown solid. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. The provisions of this Code should not apply to the solid hydrated form.

DG.name: FIRE EXTINGUISHER CHARGES corrosive liquid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually, diluted sulphuric acid in small glass receptacles.

DG.name: FLUOROBORIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, clear liquid. Corrosive to most metals. May cause severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes if containing free hydrofluoric acid.

DG.name: FLUOROPHOSPHORIC ACID, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FLUOROSULPHONIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an extremely irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FLUOROSILICIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Highly corrosive to most metals. May cause severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes if containing free hydrofluoric acid.

DG.name: FORMIC ACID with more than 85% acid, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Pure FORMIC ACID: flashpoint 42°C c.c. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FUMARYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXADECYLTRICHLORO-SILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXAFLUOROPHOSPHORIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: HEXAMETHYLENEDIAMINE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXAMETHYLENEDIAMINE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROFLUORIC ACID AND SULPHURIC ACID MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless syrupy liquid with a pungent odour. Mixture consists of between 70% and 80% by mass of acids and contains not less than 25% by mass of hydrofluoric acid. Reacts violently with water, developing heat. Highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes severe burns to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDRIODIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. An aqueous solution of the gas hydrogen iodide. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDRIODIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. An aqueous solution of the gas hydrogen iodide. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROBROMIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. An aqueous solution of the gas hydrogen bromide. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROBROMIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. An aqueous solution of the gas hydrogen bromide. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROCHLORIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. An aqueous solution of the gas hydrogen chloride. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROCHLORIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. An aqueous solution of the gas hydrogen chloride. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROFLUORIC ACID solution, with more than 60% hydrogen fluoride
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an irritating odour. Highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Both the liquid and its fumes cause severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROFLUORIC ACID solution, with not more than 60% hydrogen fluoride
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an irritating odour. Highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Both the liquid and its fumes cause severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYPOCHLORITE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with chlorine odour. In contact with acids, evolves very irritating and corrosive gases. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYPOCHLORITE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with chlorine odour. In contact with acids, evolves very irritating and corrosive gases. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: IODINE MONOCHLORIDE, SOLID
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Red, brown or black crystals. Reacts violently with water, evolving irritating and corrosive gases apparent as white fumes. Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL ACID PHOSPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Oily liquid. Mildly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: LEAD SULPHATE with more than 3% free acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: May be dry solid or slurry. Corrosive to most metals. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: NITRATING ACID MIXTURE with more than 50% nitric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Mixture of concentrated nitric and sulphuric acids. Oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw, developing highly toxic gas (brown fumes). Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITRATING ACID MIXTURE with not more than 50% nitric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Mixture of concentrated nitric and sulphuric acids. Oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw, developing highly toxic gas (brown fumes). Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROHYDROCHLORIC ACID
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid; a mixture of nitric acid and hydrochloric acid, usually in the proportion of 1:3. Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw, evolving suffocating and highly toxic gases. Highly corrosive to all metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NONYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: OCTADECYLTRICHLORO- SILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: OCTYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: PERCHLORIC ACID with not more than 50% acid, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Oxidant. Highly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: PHENOLSULPHONIC ACID, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow, oily liquid. Corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: PHENYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHOSPHORIC ACID SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscible in water. Mildly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS PENTACHLORIDE
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG8 SG10 SG12 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, crystalline powder. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS PENTOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline powder, very deliquescent. Reacts violently with water and organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw, generating heat. In the presence of moisture, mildly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS TRIBROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen bromide, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS TRICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS OXYCHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM HYDROGEN DIFLUORIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline solid. Decomposed by heat or acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, extremely irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM FLUORIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent crystals or powder. Decomposed by acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an irritating and corrosive gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White pellets, flakes, lumps or solid blocks, deliquescent. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: PROPIONYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas, apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PROPYLTRICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid, with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 38°C c.c. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: PYROSULPHURYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: SILICON TETRACHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, extremely mobile liquid with a suffocating odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: SODIUM ALUMINATE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: SODIUM ALUMINATE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: SODIUM HYDROXIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White pellets, flakes, lumps or solid blocks, deliquescent. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: SODIUM MONOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Deliquescent crystalline solid. Reacts violently with water and acids, generating heat. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITRATING ACID MIXTURE, SPENT with more than 50% nitric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually a mixture of acids which has been used for nitration processes. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Prohibited for shipment unless the mixture is (1) chemically stable; and (2) certified as containing no explosive impurities.

DG.name: NITRATING ACID MIXTURE, SPENT with not more than 50% nitric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually a mixture of acids which has been used for nitration processes. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Prohibited for shipment unless the mixture is (1) chemically stable; and (2) certified as containing no explosive impurities.

DG.name: STANNIC CHLORIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. In the presence of water, corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHUR CHLORIDES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Red liquids with a suffocating odour. React violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride and sulphur dioxide, irritating and corrosive gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHUR TRIOXIDE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Very deliquescent solid. Melting point may be as low as 17°C. Reacts violently with water, generating heat. May cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHURIC ACID with more than 51% acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid, mixture over 1.41 up to 1.84 relative density. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHURIC ACID, FUMING
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid, may be partly crystallized. Solution of varying quantities of sulphur trioxide in sulphuric acid. Reacts violently with water and organic material, generating heat. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHURIC ACID, SPENT
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Sulphuric acid, usually of high concentration, which has been used for chemical processes. Highly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: SULPHUROUS ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solution of sulphur dioxide in water, with a suffocating odour. Corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHURYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Boiling point: 69°C. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TETRAMETHYLAMMONIUM HYDROXIDE AQUEOUS SOLUTION with more than 2.5% but less than 25% tetramethylammonium hydroxide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a strong ammonia-like odour that is miscible with water. Corrosive to metal. When heated emits toxic fumes of nitrogen oxides and ammonia. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes, and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: TETRAMETHYLAMMONIUM HYDROXIDE AQUEOUS SOLUTION with not more than 2.5% tetramethylammonium hydroxide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a strong ammonia-like odour that is miscible with water. Corrosive to metal. When heated emits toxic fumes of nitrogen oxides and ammonia. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes, and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: THIONYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow or red liquid. Boiling point: 79°C. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride and sulphur dioxide, irritating and corrosive gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: THIOPHOSPHORYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: TITANIUM TETRACHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRICHLOROACETIC ACID, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, deliquescent crystals. Melting point of the pure substance: 58°C. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ZINC CHLORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ACETALDEHYDE AMMONIA
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline solid. Soluble in water. When heated, decomposes into ammonia and acetaldehyde.

DG.name: AMMONIUM DINITRO-o- CRESOLATE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: May support combustion and burn without oxygen. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes. Forms extremely sensitive explosive compounds with lead, silver or other heavy metals and their compounds. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CARBON DIOXIDE, SOLID (DRY ICE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable gas in a white solid form. Slowly evolves vapours which are heavier than air (1.5). Inhalation of vapours may lead to unconsciousness. Can cause severe burns when in contact with the skin.

DG.name: CARBON TETRACHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a heavy anaesthetic vapour. Non-flammable; when involved in a fire, evolves extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM SULPHIDE, HYDRATED with not less than 30% water of crystallization
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solid. Melting point: 60°C. Reacts violently with acids, evolving hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PROPIONIC ACID with not less than 10% and less than 90% acid, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. Corrosive to lead and most other metals. Burns skin. Vapours irritate mucous membranes.

DG.name: SODIUM SULPHIDE, HYDRATED with not less than 30% water
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow-pink or white deliquescent crystals, flakes or lumps. Melting point: 50°C. Soluble in water. Reacts violently with acids, evolving hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: MEDICINE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MEDICINE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BARIUM ALLOYS, PYROPHORIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. If shaken, may produce sparks. In contact with water, evolve hydrogen, a flammable gas.

DG.name: CALCIUM, PYROPHORIC or CALCIUM ALLOYS, PYROPHORIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. If shaken, may produce sparks. In contact with water, evolve hydrogen, a flammable gas.

DG.name: RAGS, OILY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air according to oil content.

DG.name: TEXTILE WASTE, WET
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air according to moisture content.

DG.name: HEXAFLUOROPROPYLENE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 1216)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (5.2).

DG.name: SILICON TETRAFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with a pungent odour. Corrosive to metals. In moist air, produces hydrogen fluoride. Much heavier than air (3.6). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: VINYL FLUORIDE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas. Explosive limits: 2.9% to 29%. Heavier than air (1.6).

DG.name: ETHYL CROTONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 2°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: FUEL, AVIATION, TURBINE ENGINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Boiling range: -14°C upwards. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: FUEL, AVIATION, TURBINE ENGINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water.

DG.name: FUEL, AVIATION, TURBINE ENGINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water.

DG.name: n-PROPYL NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White to straw-coloured liquid with an ether-like odour. Flashpoint: 20°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2% to 100%. Immiscible with water. Oxidizing material. May explode on heating. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation.

DG.name: RESIN SOLUTION flammable
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition.

DG.name: RESIN SOLUTION flammable
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition.

DG.name: RESIN SOLUTION flammable
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition.

DG.name: DECABORANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Slightly soluble in water. Vapours may form explosive mixture in air. Forms explosive and extremely sensitive mixtures with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM or MAGNESIUM ALLOYS with more than 50% magnesium in pellets, turnings or ribbons
DG.Segregation: SG17 SG25 SG26 SG32 SG35 SG36 SG52
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Silvery white metal. Burns with an intense white light and heat. In contact with water, especially seawater, may evolve hydrogen, a flammable gas. Reacts readily with acids and caustic alkali, evolving hydrogen. Reacts readily with iron oxide, producing a thermite effect. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: POTASSIUM BOROHYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, crystalline powder. In contact with water, acids or moisture evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: TITANIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark grey powder or crystals.

DG.name: LEAD DIOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown powder or crystals. Insoluble in water. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: PERCHLORIC ACID with more than 50% but not more than 72% acid, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Mixtures with combustible material may ignite spontaneously and, when involved in a fire, by shock or by friction, may cause an explosion. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Transport of PERCHLORIC ACID with more than 72% acid, by mass, is prohibited.

DG.name: BARIUM OXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White solid. Evolves heat in contact with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BENZIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, crystalline solid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BENZYLIDENE CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid evolving vapour which is irritating to eyes and skin (“Tear Gas”). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOCHLOROMETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear, colourless, volatile liquid with a chloroform-like odour. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROFORM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid. Boiling point: 61°C. Non-flammable. When involved in a fire, evolves extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Anaesthetic.

DG.name: CYANOGEN BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals evolving toxic vapour which is irritating and causes tears. Melting point: approximately 52°C. Boiling point: approximately 62°C. In contact with water evolves hydrogen bromide and hydrogen cyanide, which are highly toxic, flammable and corrosive gases. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYL BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless volatile liquid evolving irritating vapour with a narcotic effect. Flashpoint -20°C c.c. Boiling point: 38°C. Vapour can be ignited by an electric spark or similar sources of ignition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHYLDICHLOROARSINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHENYLMERCURIC HYDROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHENYLMERCURIC NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TETRACHLOROETHYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ethereal odour. When involved in a fire, evolves extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ACETYL IODIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen iodide, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIISOOCTYL ACID PHOSPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Oily liquid. Mildly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: DISINFECTANT, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of corrosive liquids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DISINFECTANT, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of corrosive liquids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DISINFECTANT, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of corrosive liquids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SELENIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, very deliquescent crystalline solid. Melting point: 50°C. Soluble in water. Reacts violently with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SLUDGE ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Waste or spent sulphuric acid, usually a by-product of refining petroleum oils or crude benzenes. Highly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: SODA LIME with more than 4% sodium hydroxide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Deliquescent, granulated mixture of sodium hydroxide and calcium hydroxide. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLORITE SOLUTION
DG.Segregation: SGG5 SG6 SG8 SG10 SG12 SG20
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. In contact with acids, evolves very irritating and corrosive gases. Oxidizing solution. May cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLORITE SOLUTION
DG.Segregation: SGG5 SG6 SG8 SG10 SG12 SG20
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. In contact with acids, evolves very irritating and corrosive gases. Oxidizing solution. May cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM OXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Not subject to the provisions of this Code but may be subject to provisions governing the transport of dangerous goods by other modes.

DG.name: DIBORANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, toxic, colourless gas with an unpleasant odour. Explosive limits: 0.9% to 98%. Lighter than air (0.95). May decompose above -18°C with the formation of hydrogen and boron hydrides. Autoignition temperature: 90°C. Toxic by inhalation; forms boric acid and water by hydrolysis within the lungs.

DG.name: METHYL CHLORIDE AND METHYLENE CHLORIDE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solution of the flammable gas methyl chloride, UN No. 1063, in the liquid methylene chloride.

DG.name: NEON, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, inert gas. Lighter than air (0.7).

DG.name: BUTYL PROPIONATES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Flashpoint: 32°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CYCLOHEXANONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 38°C to 44°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.1% to 9.4%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 2,2’-DICHLORODIETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 55°C c.c. Immiscible with water, but reacts with it, forming corrosive and toxic fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHYL ACRYLATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 16°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 14%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPROPYLBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a chloroform-like odour. Flashpoint: 31°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.9% to 6.5%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYL ACRYLATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: -3°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 25%. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NONANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Explosive limits: 0.8% to 2.9%. normal-NONANE: flashpoint 31°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PROPYLENEIMINE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ammoniacal odour. Flashpoint: -4°C o.c. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes.

DG.name: PYRROLIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to pale yellow liquid with an ammoniacal odour. Reacts violently with acids. Flashpoint: 3°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM DITHIONITE (CALCIUM HYDROSULPHITE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to heat and ignite spontaneously in air and to evolve sulphur dioxide, an irritating gas.

DG.name: METHYLMAGNESIUM BROMIDE IN ETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, yellowish liquid. Decomposes violently in contact with water. Spillage will ignite spontaneously.

DG.name: POTASSIUM DITHIONITE (POTASSIUM HYDROSULPHITE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to heat and ignite spontaneously in air and to evolve sulphur dioxide, an irritating gas.

DG.name: ZINC DITHIONITE (ZINC HYDROSULPHITE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, amorphous solid material. Soluble in water. Liable to heat on contact with moisture and heating results in evolution of sulphur dioxide, an intensely irritating gas. Also evolves sulphur dioxide on contact with acids.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM, SCRAP
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Particle size larger than 840 microns. Readily flammable; may ignite spontaneously in air. In contact with water, may evolve hydrogen, a flammable gas.

DG.name: CYANIDE SOLUTION, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid evolving toxic vapour. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CYANIDE SOLUTION, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid evolving toxic vapour. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CYANIDE SOLUTION, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid evolving toxic vapour. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOACETIC ACID SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Corrosive to most metals. Harmful if swallowed. Causes burns to eyes and skin.

DG.name: BROMOACETIC ACID SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Corrosive to most metals. Harmful if swallowed. Causes burns to eyes and skin.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS OXYBROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Melting point: 56°C. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen bromide, a toxic and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Reacts violently with organic materials (such as wood, cotton, straw), causing fire. Decomposes when heated, evolving toxic and corrosive gases. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic and corrosive gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: THIOGLYCOLIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a strong, very unpleasant odour. Corrosive to most metals. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: DIBROMODIFLUOROMETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, heavy liquid. Boiling point: 24°C. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, may evolve toxic fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMMONIUM NITRATE with not more than 0.2% combustible substances, including any organic substance calculated as carbon, to the exclusion of any other added substance
DG.Segregation: SGG2 SG16 SG42 SG45 SG47 SG48 SG51 SG56 SG58 SG59 SG61
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals, granules or prills. Soluble in water. Supporter of combustion. A major fire aboard a ship carrying this substance may involve a risk of explosion in the event of contamination (e.g. by fuel oil) or strong confinement. An adjacent detonation may also involve the risk of explosion. If heated strongly, decomposes, giving off toxic gases and gases which support combustion. Transport of AMMONIUM NITRATE liable to self-heating sufficient to initiate decomposition is prohibited.

DG.name: MATCHES, SAFETY (book, card or strike on box)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Intended to be ignited on a specially prepared surface.

DG.name: MATCHES, WAX ‘VESTA’
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Ignite by friction; a prepared surface may be required.

DG.name: ARGON, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, inert gas. Heavier than air (1.4).

DG.name: ETHYLENE OXIDE AND CARBON DIOXIDE MIXTURE with not more than 9% ethylene oxide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas with an ether-like odour. Explosive limits: 31% to 52%. Heavier than air (1.5).

DG.name: DEUTERIUM, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, odourless gas. Much lighter than air (0.14).

DG.name: 1,2-DICHLORO-1,1,2,2- TETRAFLUOROETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 114)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas with a chloroform-like odour. Much heavier than air (5.9). Boiling point: 4°C.

DG.name: 1,1-DIFLUOROETHYLENE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 1132a)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas. Explosive limits: 2.3% to 25%. Much heavier than air (2.2).

DG.name: ETHANE, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas with a faint odour. Explosive limits: 3% to 16%. Slightly heavier than air (1.05).

DG.name: ETHYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas. Explosive limits: 3% to 34%. Slightly lighter than air (0.98).

DG.name: HELIUM, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, inert gas. Much lighter than air (0.14).

DG.name: HYDROCARBON GAS MIXTURE, COMPRESSED, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gas mixture obtained from natural gas or by distillation of mineral oils or coal, etc. May contain propane, cyclopropane, propylene, butane, butylene, etc., in varying proportions. Heavier than air.

DG.name: HYDROCARBON GAS MIXTURE, LIQUEFIED, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied flammable hydrocarbon gas obtained from natural gas or by distillation of mineral oils or coal, etc. May contain propane, cyclopropane, propylene, butane, butylene, etc., in varying proportions. Heavier than air.

DG.name: HYDROGEN, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, odourless gas. Explosive limits: 4% to 75%. Much lighter than air (0.07).

DG.name: INSECTICIDE GAS, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic mixtures of insecticides with liquefied gases. These mixtures may be flammable.

DG.name: INSECTICIDE GAS, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable and non-toxic mixtures of insecticides with liquefied gases.

DG.name: ISOBUTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon. Heavier than air.

DG.name: KRYPTON, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, inert gas. Much heavier than air (2.9).

DG.name: METHANE, COMPRESSED or NATURAL GAS, COMPRESSED with high methane content
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas. Explosive limits: 5% to 16%. Lighter than air (methane 0.55).

DG.name: METHANE, REFRIGERATED LIQUID or NATURAL GAS, REFRIGERATED LIQUID with high methane content
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable gas. Explosive limits: 5% to 16%. Lighter than air (methane 0.55).

DG.name: CHLORODIFLUOROMETHANE AND CHLOROPENTAFLUORO- ETHANE MIXTURE with a fixed boiling point, with approximately 49% chlorodifluoromethane (REFRIGERANT GAS R 502)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (4.2.)

DG.name: CHLORODIFLUOROBROMO- METHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 12B1)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (5.7).

DG.name: NITRIC OXIDE AND DINITROGEN TETROXIDE MIXTURE (NITRIC OXIDE AND NITROGEN DIOXIDE MIXTURE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive, brown gas mixtures of varying composition with a pungent odour. Strong oxidizing agent. Heavier than air. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Toxic by inhalation, with delayed effect similar to phosgene.

DG.name: OCTAFLUOROCYCLOBUTANE (REFRIGERANT GAS RC 318)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (7.0).

DG.name: NITROGEN, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, odourless gas. Lighter than air (0.97). Arrangements for the containment of the liquid nitrogen and fittings in use should be appropriate to the potential danger to the structure of the freight container or ship from the effect of misuse or accidental spillage.

DG.name: PROPANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gas. Explosive limits: 2.3% to 9.5%. Heavier than air (1.56).

DG.name: TETRAFLUOROMETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 14)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (3.1).

DG.name: 1-CHLORO-2,2,2-TRIFLUORO- ETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 133a)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (4.1). Boiling point: 7°C.

DG.name: TRIFLUOROMETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 23)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable gas. Much heavier than air (2.4).

DG.name: ALCOHOLS, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALCOHOLS, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALCOHOLS, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALDEHYDES, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALDEHYDES, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALDEHYDES, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BENZALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish volatile oil with a bitter almond odour. Slightly soluble in water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROPRENE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -20°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.5% to 12%. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: FLAMMABLE LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable toxic liquid which is not specified by name in this class or, on account of its characteristics, in some other class. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: FLAMMABLE LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable toxic liquid which is not specified by name in this class or, on account of its characteristics, in some other class. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: FLAMMABLE LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable toxic liquid which is not specified by name in this class or, on account of its characteristics, in some other class. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: IRON PENTACARBONYL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow to dark red, volatile flammable liquid. Flashpoint: -15°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.7% to 12.5%. May react with water or steam, evolving carbon monoxide, which is a toxic gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TARS, LIQUID, including road oils, and cutback bitumens
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Mobile liquids prepared by mixing asphalt with petroleum distillate. Pungent odour. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: TARS, LIQUID, including road oils, and cutback bitumens
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Mobile liquids prepared by mixing asphalt with petroleum distillate. Pungent odour. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CELLULOID in block, rods, rolls, sheets, tubes, etc., except scrap
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Ignites readily. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in enclosed cargo spaces, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air.

DG.name: COBALT NAPHTHENATES, POWDER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown, amorphous powder. Insoluble in water. Readily combustible.

DG.name: CELLULOID, SCRAP
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Ignites readily. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in enclosed cargo spaces, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM DIAMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Ignites spontaneously in air. Reacts violently in contact with water.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Amorphous powder. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Amorphous powder. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Amorphous powder. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM, DRY finished sheets, strip or coiled wire
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Hard, silvery metal, liable to ignite spontaneously in air.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. In contact with water, acids or moisture, evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: STRONTIUM PHOSPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Reacts with acids or decomposes slowly in contact with water or damp air, evolving phosphine, a spontaneously flammable and highly toxic gas. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HYDROGEN PEROXIDE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with not less than 20% but not more than 60% hydrogen peroxide (stabilized as necessary)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Slowly decomposes, evolving oxygen; the rate of decomposition increases in contact with metals, except aluminium. In contact with combustible material, may cause fire or explosion. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Even though stabilized, these solutions may evolve oxygen.

DG.name: HYDROGEN PEROXIDE, STABILIZED or HYDROGEN PEROXIDE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION, STABILIZED with more than 60% hydrogen peroxide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Slowly decomposes, evolving oxygen; the rate of decomposition increases in contact with metals, except aluminium. Decomposes vigorously in contact with permanganates. When involved in a fire, mixtures with combustible material may be explosive. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Even though stabilized, these solutions may evolve oxygen.

DG.name: AMMUNITION, TOXIC, NON- EXPLOSIVE without burster or expelling charge, non-fuzed
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Contents may evolve toxic fumes or vapour. Gases evolved are toxic by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: AMMUNITION, TEAR-PRODUCING, NON-EXPLOSIVE without burster or expelling charge, non-fuzed
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Contents may evolve irritant gas or vapour with lachrymatory effects.

DG.name: CHLOROANILINES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solid. Melting point of pure para-chloroaniline: 70°C approximately. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROANILINES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. May be a mixture of two of the isomers (e.g. ortho- and meta-) of chloroaniline. Reacts with acids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROPHENOLS, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROPHENOLS, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic liquids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CRESYLIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to brownish-yellow liquid mixture with a phenolic odour. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. “Cresylic acid” is a generic name for mixtures of cresols and higher alkylphenols, in varying proportions. It generally contains more than 95% phenolic compounds.

DG.name: EPICHLOROHYDRIN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a chloroform-like odour. Flashpoint: approximately 32°C c.c. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: MERCURY COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHENYLMERCURIC COMPOUND, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually white crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHENYLMERCURIC COMPOUND, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually white crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHENYLMERCURIC COMPOUND, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually white crystals or powder. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM ARSENITE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Greyish-white powder. Soluble in water. Reacts with oxidizing substances, evolving heat. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: BOMBS, SMOKE, NON-EXPLOSIVE with corrosive liquid, without initiating device
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Corrosive content evolves dense smoke when in contact with air. Corrosive content may cause acid burns to skin.

DG.name: HYDRAZINE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with an ammoniacal odour. Reacts violently with acids. Flashpoint: 52°C c.c. Miscible with water. Highly reactive reducing agent. Ignites spontaneously when in contact with porous materials such as earth, wood or cloth. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDRAZINE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with more than 37% hydrazine, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Powerful reducing agent, burns readily. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: HYDRAZINE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with more than 37% hydrazine, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Powerful reducing agent, burns readily. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: HYDRAZINE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with more than 37% hydrazine, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Powerful reducing agent, burns readily. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: NITRIC ACID other than red fuming, with more than 70% nitric acid
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw, evolving highly toxic gases (brown fumes). Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITRIC ACID other than red fuming, with at least 65% but with not more than 70% nitric acid.
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw, evolving highly toxic gases (brown fumes). Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITRIC ACID other than red fuming, with less than 65% nitric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw, evolving highly toxic gases (brown fumes). Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITRIC ACID, RED FUMING
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown liquid. Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. Highly corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by vapour inhalation. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM MONOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Deliquescent crystalline solid. Reacts violently with water, generating heat. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Reacts violently with acids. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGEN AND METHANE MIXTURE, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, odourless gas mixtures. Much lighter than air.

DG.name: 1,1,1-TRIFLUOROETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 143a)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas with a slight odour. Much heavier than air (2.9).

DG.name: XENON
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, inert gas. Much heavier than air (4.5).

DG.name: RECEPTACLES, SMALL, CONTAINING GAS (GAS CARTRIDGES) without a release device, non-refillable
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Normally contain mixtures of liquefied butane and propane in various proportions for use in camping stoves, etc.

DG.name: DINITROTOLUENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. A commercial grade consisting of a mixture of the 2,4-, 3,4- and 3,5-isomers is an oily liquid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2,2-DIMETHYLPROPANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable hydrocarbon gas. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 7.2%. Heavier than air (2.48).

DG.name: ISOBUTYL ALDEHYDE (ISOBUTYRALDEHYDE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a characteristic pungent odour. Flashpoint: -24°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1% to 12%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CYMENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with an aromatic odour. Immiscible with water. Explosive limits: 0.7% to 5.6%.

DG.name: DICHLOROPROPENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellow liquids with a sweet odour. Explosive limits: 5% to 14%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICHLOROPROPENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellow liquids with a sweet odour. Explosive limits: 5% to 14%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICYCLOPENTADIENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: The pure substance is a solid with a melting point of 34°C. Flashpoint: 26°C to 38°C o.c. Commercial products are liquids. Immiscible with water. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: DIETHYLBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Flashpoint: 49°C to 56°C c.c. Immiscible with water. The commercial product is a mixture of isomers.

DG.name: DIISOBUTYLENES, ISOMERIC COMPOUNDS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Flashpoint: -18°C to 21°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.8% to 4.8%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 2-DIMETHYLAMINOETHANOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: 31°C o.c. Miscible with water. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIPENTENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a lemon-like odour. Flashpoint: 43°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.7% to 6.1%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYL ISOBUTYL CARBINOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 41°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1% to 5.5%. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: MORPHOLINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: 38°C o.c. Explosive limits: 2% to 11.2%. Miscible with water. Harmful by skin contact or by inhalation. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: STYRENE MONOMER, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid. Flashpoint: 32°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.1% to 6.1%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TETRAHYDROFURAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ethereal odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 12%. Miscible with water.

DG.name: TRIPROPYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: TRIPROPYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: VALERALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROCELLULOSE SOLUTION, FLAMMABLE with not more than 12.6% nitrogen, by dry mass, and not more than 55% nitrocellulose
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When involved in a fire, evolves toxic nitrous fumes.

DG.name: NITROCELLULOSE SOLUTION, FLAMMABLE with not more than 12.6% nitrogen, by dry mass, and not more than 55% nitrocellulose
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When involved in a fire, evolves toxic nitrous fumes.

DG.name: NITROCELLULOSE SOLUTION, FLAMMABLE with not more than 12.6% nitrogen, by dry mass, and not more than 55% nitrocellulose
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When involved in a fire, evolves toxic nitrous fumes.

DG.name: AMMONIUM NITRATE BASED FERTILIZER
DG.Segregation: SGG2 SG16 SG42 SG45 SG47 SG48 SG51 SG56 SG58 SG59 SG61
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals, granules or prills. Wholly or partly soluble in water. Supporters of combustion. A major fire aboard a ship carrying these substances may involve a risk of explosion in the event of contamination (e.g. by fuel oil) or strong confinement. An adjacent detonation may also involve a risk of explosion. If heated strongly, decompose, giving off toxic gases and gases which support combustion. Transport of AMMONIUM NITRATE liable to self-heating sufficient to initiate decomposition is prohibited.

DG.name: AMMONIUM NITRATE BASED FERTILIZER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Usually granules. Wholly or partly soluble in water. These mixtures may be subject to self-sustaining decomposition if heated. The temperature in such a reaction can reach 500°C. Decomposition, once initiated, may spread throughout the remainder, producing gases which are toxic. None of these mixtures is subject to the explosion hazard. Transport of AMMONIUM NITRATE liable to self-heating sufficient to initiate decomposition is prohibited.

DG.name: AMMONIA SOLUTION relative density less than 0.880 at 15°C in water, with more than 35% but not more than 50% ammonia
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solution in water of non-flammable gas with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with acids. Extremely dangerous to the eyes.

DG.name: ACRYLAMIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals or powder. Soluble in water. May polymerise violently on melting. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLORAL, ANHYDROUS, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, mobile liquid, evolving toxic vapours which are considerably heavier than air. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CRESOLS, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light yellow liquids. Miscible with water. Melting point of meta-CRESOL: 12°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: alpha-NAPHTHYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOLUENE DIISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to pale yellow liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but reacts with it to form carbon dioxide. Melting point: 20°C (pure product). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIETHYLENETRIAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow hygroscopic liquid with ammoniacal odour. Soluble in water. Strongly alkaline, corrosive. Can form explosive mixtures with nitric acid. Reacts with oxidizing substances. Corrosive to copper and its alloys. Reacts violently with acids. Liquid and vapour can cause severe damage to skin and eyes.

DG.name: HYDROGEN CHLORIDE, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Transport is prohibited.

DG.name: CARBON DIOXIDE, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, liquefied gas, colourless and odourless. Heavier than air (1.5). Cannot remain in the liquid state above 31°C.

DG.name: ARSINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a garlic odour. Explosive limits: 3.9% to 77.8%. Much heavier than air (2.8).

DG.name: DICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: OXYGEN DIFLUORIDE, COMPRESSED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive, colourless gas with a foul odour. Strong oxidizing agent. Reacts slowly with water or moist air to produce poisonous and corrosive fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Heavier than air (1.9). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHURYL FLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic, colourless, odourless gas. Reacts with water or moist air to produce toxic and corrosive fumes. Much heavier than air (3.5). Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: GERMANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a pungent odour. Much heavier than air (2.6).

DG.name: HEXAFLUOROETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 116)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, colourless and odourless gas. Much heavier than air (4.8). Cannot remain in liquid state above 24.3°C.

DG.name: SELENIUM HEXAFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, toxic and corrosive gas. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Heavier than air. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TELLURIUM HEXAFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive colourless gas with an unpleasant odour. Decomposes in water, evolving highly toxic and corrosive fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Much heavier than air (7.2). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TUNGSTEN HEXAFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive, colourless gas, or yellow liquid. Decomposes in water or moist air, evolving highly toxic and corrosive fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Much heavier than air (10.3). Boiling point: 19.5°C. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGEN IODIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive colourless gas with a pungent odour. Highly corrosive in the presence of water. Much heavier than air (4.4). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS PENTAFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with an irritating odour. Reacts with water or moist air to produce toxic and corrosive fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Much heavier than air (4.3). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHOSPHINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a garlic odour. Ignites spontaneously in air. Heavier than air (1.2). Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PROPADIENE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, colourless gas. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 12%. Heavier than air (1.4). Boiling point: -34°C. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROUS OXIDE, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, colourless gas with a slightly sweet odour. Strong oxidizing agent. Heavier than air (1.5). Cannot remain in liquid state above 36.5°C.

DG.name: HYDROGEN SELENIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a disagreeable odour. Much heavier than air (2.8). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, colourless gas with a foul odour. Explosive limits: 1% to 100%. Ignites spontaneously in air. Strong reducing agent which reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Heavier than air (1.1).

DG.name: CARBONYL SULPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a foul odour. Much heavier than air (2.1).

DG.name: ADIPONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, odourless oil. Decomposes above 93°C, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ISOCYANATES, TOXIC, N.O.S. or ISOCYANATE SOLUTION, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but react with it to form carbon dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. If under deck, with mechanical ventilation, six air changes per hour, except when carried in closed containers, when two air changes per hour are required. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOCYANATES, TOXIC, N.O.S. or ISOCYANATE SOLUTION, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but react with it to form carbon dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. If under deck, with mechanical ventilation, six air changes per hour, except when carried in closed containers, when two air changes per hour are required. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE MIXTURE, DRY with more than 10% but not more than 39% available chlorine
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine- like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Dust irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: FORMALDEHYDE SOLUTION with not less than 25% formaldehyde
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, clear liquid, with a suffocating pungent odour. Usually stabilized with methyl alcohol. Miscible with water. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: MANEB or MANEB PREPARATION with not less than 60% maneb
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow powder, liable to heat and to ignite spontaneously in air. May evolve toxic, irritating or flammable fumes when wet, when involved in a fire or in contact with acids. Used as fungicide.

DG.name: POLYMERIC BEADS, EXPANDABLE evolving flammable vapour
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A moulding material in bead or granular form consisting predominantly of polystyrene, poly(methyl methacrylate) or other polymeric material and containing 5% to 8% of a volatile hydrocarbon which is predominantly pentane. During storage, a small proportion of this pentane is released to the atmosphere; this proportion increases at elevated temperatures.

DG.name: ASBESTOS, AMPHIBOLE (amosite, tremolite, actinolite, anthophyllite, crocidolite)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Mineral fibres of varying length. Non-combustible. Inhalation of the dust of asbestos fibres is dangerous and therefore exposure should be avoided at all times. Always prevent the generation of asbestos dust. A safe level of airborne concentration of asbestos fibres may be obtained through effective packing. Cargo spaces or freight containers that have contained any type of raw asbestos should be carefully cleaned before discharging any remaining cargo, loading other cargo or carrying out repair or maintenance work. Whenever possible, cleaning of cargo spaces should be carried out whilst the ship is in a port where proper facilities and equipment, including proper respiratory apparatus and protective clothing, is available. Parts of the body that may have been exposed should be immediately and thoroughly washed. All waste material should be collected in impermeable and sealed bags for safe disposal ashore. If cleaning cannot be carried out at the discharge port, arrangements should be made in advance for cleaning to be carried out at the next port where necessary facilities are available.

DG.name: PARAFORMALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder with a pungent odour. Evolves formaldehyde, particularly when heated, which is irritating to eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHTHALIC ANHYDRIDE with more than 0.05% of maleic anhydride
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder or flakes and lumps containing a high proportion of dust. Melting point: 131°C. The vapour of the molten substance has a flashpoint of 152°C c.c. and forms a flammable atmosphere with explosive limits of 1.7% to 10.4%. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. May be carried in the molten state. The molten substance can cause severe skin burns.

DG.name: MALEIC ANHYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder, needles, flakes, pellets, rods, briquettes, lumps or fused mass. Melting point: about 53°C. Fumes and dust are irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Inhalation can cause respiratory trouble.

DG.name: MALEIC ANHYDRIDE, MOLTEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Melting point: about 53°C. The vapour of the molten substance has a flashpoint of 103°C c.c. and forms a flammable atmosphere with explosive limits of 1.4% to 7.1%. Fumes are irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FISH MEAL (FISH SCRAP), STABILIZED Anti-oxidant treated. Moisture content greater than 5% but not exceeding 12%, by mass. Fat content not more than 15%
