DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown to greenish-brown product obtained through heating and drying of oily fish. Strong odour which may affect other cargo. Liable to heat spontaneously unless of low fat content or effectively anti-oxidant treated.

DG.name: SEED CAKE with not more than 1.5% oil and not more than 11% moisture
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Residue remaining after oil has been extracted by a solvent process from oil-bearing seeds. Used mainly as an animal feed or fertilizer. The most common seed cakes include those derived from coconut (copra), cottonseed, groundnut (peanut), linseed, maize (hominy chop), niger seed, palm kernel, rape seed, rice bran, soya bean and sunflower seed and they may be shipped in the form of cake, flakes, pellets, meal, etc. May self-heat slowly if wet and ignite spontaneously. Before shipment, this cargo should be properly aged. The duration of ageing varies with the oil content. The seed cake should be substantially free from flammable solvent. Smoking and the use of naked lights should not be allowed during loading and unloading, and on entry to cargo spaces at any other time.

DG.name: ACRYLIC ACID, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with an acrid odour. Melting point: 13°C. Flashpoint: 54°C o.c. Miscible with water. May polymerize violently, which may cause fire and explosion, unless properly stabilized. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALLYL GLYCIDYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 48°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ANISOLE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellow liquid. Flashpoint: 41°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.3% to 6.3%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BENZONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an odour similar to oil of bitter almonds. Reacts with acids, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BENZENESULPHONYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to slightly yellow liquid with a pungent odour. Melting point: 12°C. Immiscible with water. Decomposes slowly in water. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BENZOTRICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to slightly yellow or brown fuming liquid. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Harmful if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Burns skin and eyes. Vapour irritates eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: n-BUTYL METHACRYLATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 41°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2% to 8%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-CHLOROETHANAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROANISIDINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solid. Melting point: 52°C. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROBENZOTRIFLUORIDES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with an aromatic odour. Flashpoint: 36°C to 59°C c.c. On contact with moisture, can evolve hydrogen fluoride, which is a toxic and corrosive gas. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROBENZYL CHLORIDES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 3-CHLORO-4-METHYLPHENYL ISOCYANATE, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water. Reacts with water, evolving carbon dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLORONITROANILINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow or orange crystalline powders or needles. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROTOLUENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to brown liquids. Flashpoint: 43°C to 47°C c.c. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. Harmful by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROTOLUIDINES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solids. Some isomers may melt at low temperature: melting range between 0°C and 24°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHROMOSULPHURIC ACID
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A liquid mixture of sulphuric acid and a chromium compound (e.g. chromium trioxide or sodium dichromate) and sometimes also water. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CYCLOHEPTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Oily liquid. Immiscible with water. Narcotic.

DG.name: CYCLOHEPTENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Oily liquid. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CYCLOHEXYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 56°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CYCLOPENTANOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid. Flashpoint: 51°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CYCLOPENTANONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 31°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: CYCLOPENTENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -30°C c.c. Boiling point: 44°C. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Narcotic.

DG.name: n-DECANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 47°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.6% to 5.5%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: DI-n-BUTYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with an amine odour. Flashpoint: 39°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. Decomposes when heated, evolving flammable and toxic gases. Liquid is corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICHLORODIMETHYL ETHER, SYMMETRICAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile, flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 42°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Decomposed by heat and water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. The transport of this substance is prohibited except with special authorization granted by the competent authorities.

DG.name: DICHLOROPHENYL ISOCYANATES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish crystalline solid with an irritating odour. Insoluble in water. Reacts with water, evolving carbon dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. May be carried in the molten state. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BICYCLO[2.2.1]HEPTA-2,5- DIENE, STABILIZED (2,5-NORBORNADIENE, STABILIZED)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 6.3%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 1,2-DIMETHOXYETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ethereal odour. Flashpoint: 1°C c.c. Miscible with water.

DG.name: N,N-DIMETHYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish to brownish oily liquid. Combustible. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MATCHES, FUSEE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Matches, the heads of which are prepared with a friction-sensitive igniter composition and a pyrotechnic composition which burns with little or no flame, but with intense heat, regardless of wind or other weather conditions.

DG.name: CYCLOHEXENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an aromatic odour. Immiscible with water. Slightly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Soft, silvery metal, solid or liquid. Floats on water. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction. Highly reactive, sometimes with explosive effect.

DG.name: 1,2-PROPYLENEDIAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with an ammoniacal odour. Flashpoint range: 33°C to 48°C c.c. Miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIETHYLENETETRAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Moderately viscous, yellow combustible liquid with an ammoniacal odour. Miscible with water. Strongly alkaline. Can form explosive mixtures with nitric acid. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Corrosive to copper and copper alloys. Reacts violently with acids. Liquid and vapours cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Causes skin allergy.

DG.name: TRIPROPYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 35°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: XYLENOLS, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals or needles. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIMETHYLCARBAMOYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellow liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water. Reacts with water, evolving toxic and corrosive fumes. Causes tears. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIMETHYLCYCLOHEXANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Flashpoint: 5°C to 16°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: N,N-DIMETHYL- CYCLOHEXYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 43°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: N,N-DIMETHYLFORMAMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 58°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.2% to 16%. Miscible with water. May react violently with oxidizing materials.

DG.name: DIMETHYL-N-PROPYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: -11°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIMETHYL THIOPHOSPHORYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, combustible liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts slowly with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. May decompose above 60°C, evolving flammable gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 3,3’-IMINODIPROPYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless combustible liquid. Miscible with water. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYLAMINE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with not less than 50% but not more than 70% ethylamine
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Aqueous solution of a flammable gas with an ammonia-like odour. Explosive limits: 3.5% to 14%. ETHYLAMINE SOLUTION, concentration 50%: flashpoint -11°C c.c.; boiling point 56°C. Pure ETHYLAMINE: boiling point 17°C. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: ETHYL AMYL KETONES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Vapour is much heavier than air (4.4). ETHYL normal-AMYL KETONE: flashpoint 43°C c.c. ETHYL secondary-AMYL KETONE: flashpoint 57°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Dissolves some types of plastics. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: N-ETHYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish oily liquid. Reacts with acids, evolving highly toxic fumes of aniline and oxides of nitrogen. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-ETHYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown liquid. Immiscible with water. Reacts with acids, evolving highly toxic fumes of aniline and oxides of nitrogen. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: N-ETHYL-N-BENZYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Light yellow, oily liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-ETHYLBUTANOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 57°C o.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 2-ETHYLHEXYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 50°C c.c. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYL METHACRYLATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 20°C o.c. Explosive limits: 1.8% to … Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: n-HEPTENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -3°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: HEXACHLOROBUTADIENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HEXAMETHYLENEDIAMINE, MOLTEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or shiny flakes with a specific odour. Melting point: 29°C. Soluble in water; solution in water is a strong alkali. Decomposes when heated, evolving flammable and toxic gases. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXAMETHYLENEDIAMINE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or shiny flakes with a specific odour. Melting point: 29°C. Soluble in water; solution in water is a strong alkali. Decomposes when heated, evolving flammable and toxic gases. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXAMETHYLENE DIISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light yellow liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but reacts with it, evolving heat and carbon dioxide gas. When heated, evolves toxic nitrous fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXANOLS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. normal-HEXANOL: flashpoint 57°C c.c. Miscible with water.

DG.name: ISOBUTYL METHACRYLATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 49°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOBUTYRONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 8°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Toxic by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ISOCYANATOBENZO- TRIFLUORIDES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish liquids with a pungent odour. Flashpoint of ortho- and meta-isomers: 56°C. Immiscible with water, but reacts with it to form carbon dioxide gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PENTAMETHYLHEPTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 43°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOHEPTENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOHEXENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Boiling range: 54°C to 69°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOPHORONEDIAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, slightly hygroscopic liquid with a slight amine odour. Combustible. Miscible with water. Harmful if swallowed. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPHORONE DIISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish liquid. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves nitrous fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: LEAD COMPOUND, SOLUBLE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: 4-METHOXY-4-METHYL- PENTAN-2-ONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 49°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: N-METHYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to brown combustible liquid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: METHYL CHLOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 47°C c.c. Vapour much heavier than air (vapour density relative to air: 3.8). Immiscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: METHYLCYCLOHEXANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -4°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 6.7%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYLCYCLOHEXANONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to pale yellow liquids with a sweet odour. 2-METHYLCYCLOHEXANONE: flashpoint 46°C c.c. 3-METHYLCYCLOHEXANONE: flashpoint 51°C c.c. 4-METHYLCYCLOHEXANONE: flashpoint 40°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYLCYCLOPENTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: below -10°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1% to 8.4%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL DICHLOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-METHYL-5-ETHYLPYRIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-METHYLFURAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a sweetish odour. Flashpoint: -30°C c.c. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 5-METHYLHEXAN-2-ONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 43°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOPROPENYLBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 38°C to 54°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.7% to 6.6%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NAPHTHALENE, MOLTEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Molten liquid with a persistent odour. Melting point: 80°C. Evolves flammable vapours. As the melting point of naphthalene approximates very closely its flashpoint, care should be taken to avoid all possible causes of ignition. Contact between water and molten naphthalene above 110°C must be avoided, as the addition of water will cause violent foaming or even an explosion.

DG.name: NITROBENZENESULPHONIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals. Soluble in water. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROBENZOTRIFLUORIDES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale straw-coloured, oily liquids with an aromatic odour. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 3-NITRO-4-CHLORO- BENZOTRIFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish, oily liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROSYLSULPHURIC ACID, LIQUID
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear, straw-coloured, oily liquid. Oxidant which may cause fire with organic materials (such as wood, straw, etc.). When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: OCTADIENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 9°C to 15°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: PENTANE-2,4-DIONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 34°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to … Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHENETIDINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquids. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHENOL, MOLTEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Molten liquid with a distinctive strong odour. Melting point: 10°C to 43°C (pure product). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Rapidly absorbed through the skin.

DG.name: PICOLINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellow liquids with a pungent or sweet odour. Explosive limits: 1.3% to 8.7%. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. alpha-Picoline flashpoint: 28°C c.c. beta-Picoline flashpoint: 40°C c.c. gamma-Picoline flashpoint 40°C c.c. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POLYCHLORINATED BIPHENYLS, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid (pure product) with perceptible odours. Immiscible with water. Harmful by ingestion or by skin contact. If spilled, can be a persistent hazard to the environment. This entry also covers articles, such as transformers and condensers, containing free liquid polychlorinated biphenyls.

DG.name: SODIUM CUPROCYANIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Soluble in water. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM CUPROCYANIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Miscible with water. Decomposed by acids, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM HYDROSULPHIDE with less than 25% water of crystallization
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless needles to lemon-coloured flakes. Soluble in water. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: TERPENE HYDROCARBONS, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish liquids. Flashpoint: 32°C to 49°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: TETRAETHYLENEPENTAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Viscous liquid. Miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: TRICHLOROBENZENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TRICHLOROBUTENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. When heated, develops toxic and irritant gases such as phosgene and hydrogen chloride and may also explode. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TRIETHYL PHOSPHITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 44°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIISOBUTYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 1,3,5-TRIMETHYLBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 44°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: TRIMETHYLCYCLOHEXYL- AMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, slightly hygroscopic, combustible liquid with a slight amine odour. Immiscible with water. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIMETHYLHEXAMETHYLENE- DIAMINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, slightly hygroscopic, combustible liquids. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIMETHYLHEXAMETHYLENE DIISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish liquid. Reacts with water, evolving carbon dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIMETHYL PHOSPHITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 23°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: UNDECANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 60°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ZINC CHLORIDE, ANHYDROUS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Dust causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ACETALDEHYDE OXIME
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 40°C c.c. Explosive limits: 4.2% to 52%. Freezing point 12°C. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALLYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 7°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: ALLYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light yellow volatile liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: -29°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.2% to 22%. Boiling range: 55°C to 58°C. Miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves highly toxic gases. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALLYL ETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -11°C c.c. Vapour heavier than air. Immiscible with water. Narcotic. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ALLYL FORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHENYL MERCAPTAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a foul odour. Flashpoint: 50°C c.c. Immiscible with water. In contact with acids or when involved in a fire, evolves highly toxic sulphurous fumes. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BENZOTRIFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an aromatic odour. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.1% to … Immiscible with water. On contact with moisture or air evolves hydrogen fluoride, which is a toxic and corrosive gas. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-BROMOBUTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pleasant odour. Flashpoint: 21°C c.c. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes. Narcotic.

DG.name: 2-BROMOETHYL ETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ethereal odour. Partially miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: 1-BROMO-3-METHYLBUTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 23°C to 32°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: BROMOMETHYLPROPANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-BROMOPENTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellow liquid with a strong odour. Flashpoint: 21°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOPROPANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic fumes. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOPROPANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic fumes. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: 3-BROMOPROPYNE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light amber liquid with a sharp odour. Flashpoint: 10°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3% to … Vapour much heavier than air (4.1). The pure product is shock-sensitive and decomposes with explosive violence, and the possibility of detonation, when heated under confinement. Can be ignited by impact. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Causes tears.

DG.name: BUTANEDIONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Greenish-yellow liquid with a strong odour. Flashpoint: 6°C c.c. Miscible with water.

DG.name: BUTYL MERCAPTAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a foul odour. tertiary-BUTYL MERCAPTAN: flashpoint -26°C c.c. secondary-BUTYL MERCAPTAN: flashpoint -23°C c.c. 1-BUTANETHIOL (normal-BUTYL MERCAPTAN): flashpoint 12°C c.c. ISOBUTYL MERCAPTAN: flashpoint -9°C c.c. Immiscible with water. On contact with acids, emit highly toxic fumes.

DG.name: BUTYL ACRYLATES, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an unpleasant odour. Flashpoint: 36°C to 41°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 9.9%. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BUTYL METHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: BUTYL NITRITES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish, volatile, oily liquids. Partially miscible with water. Decompose on exposure to air, light, water or heat, evolving toxic nitrous fumes. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: BUTYL NITRITES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish, volatile, oily liquids. Partially miscible with water. Decompose on exposure to air, light, water or heat, evolving toxic nitrous fumes. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: BUTYL VINYL ETHER, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a sharp ethereal odour. Flashpoint: -9°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BUTYRYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROMETHYL ETHYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Partially miscible with water. Fumes in air, evolving hydrogen chloride, which is an irritating and corrosive gas. Toxic by inhalation. Strong lachrymator.

DG.name: 2-CHLOROPROPANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -32°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.8% to 10.7%. Boiling point: 35°C. Immiscible with water. On contact with heat or flame, emits highly toxic phosgene gas. Can react vigorously with oxidizing materials.

DG.name: CYCLOHEXYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish flammable liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: 27°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.5% to 21.7%. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: CYCLOOCTATETRAENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Freezing point: -4°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: DIALLYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a disagreeable odour. Flashpoint: 7°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIALLYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a perceptible odour. Flashpoint: -11°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIISOBUTYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: 29°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1,1-DICHLOROETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an aromatic, ethereal odour. Flashpoint: -10°C c.c. Explosive limits: 5.6% to … Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, emits toxic fumes of phosgene. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHYL MERCAPTAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Volatile liquid with a strong unpleasant odour. Flashpoint: -45°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.8% to 18.2%. Boiling point: 35°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: n-PROPYLBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 39°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.8% to 6%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: DIETHYL CARBONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 25°C to 31°C c.c. Vapour much heavier than air (4.1). Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: alpha-METHYL-VALERALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: alpha-PINENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an odour of turpentine. Flashpoint: 33°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.8% to 6%. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1-HEXENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 6.9%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOPENTENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a disagreeable odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1,2-DI(DIMETHYLAMINO) ETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 21°C c.c. Miscible with water. Irritability to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIETHOXYMETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: below -5°C c.c. Miscible with water.

DG.name: 3,3-DIETHOXYPROPENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 15°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: DIETHYL SULPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an odour of garlic. Flashpoint: -10°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 2,3-DIHYDROPYRAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an ethereal odour. Flashpoint: -16°C c.c. Miscible with water.

DG.name: 1,1-DIMETHOXYETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a strong aromatic odour. Miscible with water.

DG.name: 2-DIMETHYLAMINO- ACETONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 35°C c.c. Immiscible with water. On contact with water and acids, evolves toxic fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 1,3-DIMETHYLBUTYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint: 9°C to 13°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Reacts violently with acids. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIMETHYLDIETHOXYSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIMETHYL DISULPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid with an unpleasant odour. Flashpoint: 15°C c.c. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIMETHYLHYDRAZINE, SYMMETRICAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable, volatile liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Miscible with water. Reacts violently with acids. May react dangerously with oxidizing substances. Flashpoint: -17°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIPROPYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: 7°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DI-n-PROPYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint (pure product): -21°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to … Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL ISOBUTYRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an aromatic odour. Flashpoint: 21°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 1-ETHYLPIPERIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 19°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Reacts violently with acids. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. May cause lung damage.

DG.name: FLUOROBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a benzene odour. Flashpoint: -15°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: FLUOROTOLUENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. ortho-FLUOROTOLUENE: flashpoint 9°C c.c. meta-FLUOROTOLUENE: flashpoint 12°C c.c. para-FLUOROTOLUENE: flashpoint 10°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: FURAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a strong odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.3% to 14.3%. Boiling point: 31°C. Immiscible with water. Harmful if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-IODOBUTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 21°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: IODOMETHYLPROPANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: IODOPROPANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. 1-IODOPROPANE: flashpoint 34°C c.c. 2-IODOPROPANE: flashpoint approx. 25°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOBUTYL FORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 5°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 8%. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOBUTYL PROPIONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 31°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOBUTYRYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHACRYLALDEHYDE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 2°C c.c. Miscible with water. Toxic by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 3-METHYLBUTAN-2-ONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -3°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 8%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: METHYL tert-BUTYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 8.4%. Boiling point: 55°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 1-METHYLPIPERIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 3°C c.c. Miscible with water. Reacts violently with acids. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL ISOVALERATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: PIPERIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fish-like odour. Miscible with water. Reacts violently with acids. Solution in water is a strong alkali and is corrosive. When involved in fire, evolves toxic nitrous fumes.

DG.name: PROPANETHIOLS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish liquids with a strong unpleasant odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Boiling range: 53°C to 67°C. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOPROPENYL ACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 10°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: PROPIONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an ether-like odour. Flashpoint: 2°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.1% to … Miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves highly toxic cyanide fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL BUTYRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 25°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL ISOBUTYRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 20°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Narcotic. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 16°C c.c. Decomposed by water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL PROPIONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 21°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: 1,2,3,6-TETRAHYDROPYRIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 16°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: BUTYRONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 21°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.6% to … Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TETRAHYDROTHIOPHENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pleasant odour. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: TETRAPROPYL ORTHOTITANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 38°C c.c.

DG.name: THIOPHENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an unpleasant odour. Flashpoint: -9°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 12.5%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIMETHYL BORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts with water, evolving flammable vapours.

DG.name: CARBONYL FLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive colourless gas with a pungent odour. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Corrosive in the presence of water. Much heavier than air (2.3). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SULPHUR TETRAFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive, colourless gas with a pungent odour. Reacts with water, moist air or acids to produce toxic and corrosive fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Much heavier than air (3.7). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BROMOTRIFLUOROETHYLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, colourless gas. Much heavier than air (5.6). Boiling point: -3°C.

DG.name: HEXAFLUOROACETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive, colourless, hygroscopic gas with an unpleasant odour. Reacts vigorously with water, evolving heat. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Fumes in moist air. Much heavier than air (5.7). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROGEN TRIOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. At lower temperatures, present as a blue liquid. Strong oxidizing agent. Much heavier than air (2.6). Boiling point: 3.5°C. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: OCTAFLUOROBUT-2-ENE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 1318)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, colourless gas. Much heavier than air (6.9). Boiling point: 1.2°C.

DG.name: OCTAFLUOROPROPANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 218)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, non-flammable, colourless gas. Much heavier than air (6.6). Boiling point: -36°C.

DG.name: AMMONIUM NITRATE, LIQUID (hot concentrated solution)
DG.Segregation: SGG2 SG42 SG45 SG47 SG48 SG51 SG56 SG58 SG59 SG61
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Hot aqueous solution of not more than 93% ammonium nitrate with not more than 0.2% combustible material (including organic material calculated as carbon) and free from any other added matter, containing at least 7% water, while the maximum content of chloride ions should not exceed 0.02%. May cause fire and explosion in contact with combustible material (e.g. wood, straw, cotton, oil, sugar, etc.), acids, and other class 5.1 substances and burn fiercely. Maximum allowable transport temperature of the solution 140°C. This temperature should be indicated on the transport unit. The acidity (pH) of the cargo when diluted with ten parts of water to one part of cargo, by mass, should be between 5.0 and 7.0. The concentration and temperature of the solution at the time of loading, its percentage of combustible materials and of chlorides, and the contents of free acid should be certified.

DG.name: POTASSIUM CHLORATE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Leakage and subsequent evaporation of the water may present increased dangers as follows: .1 in contact with combustible material (particularly with fibrous material such as jute, cotton or sisal) or sulphur, danger of spontaneous combustion; .2 in contact with ammonium compounds, powdered metals or oils, danger of explosion.

DG.name: POTASSIUM CHLORATE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Leakage and subsequent evaporation of the water may present increased dangers as follows: .1 in contact with combustible material (particularly with fibrous material such as jute, cotton or sisal) or sulphur, danger of spontaneous combustion; .2 in contact with ammonium compounds, powdered metals or oils, danger of explosion.

DG.name: SODIUM CHLORATE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Leakage and subsequent evaporation of the water may present increased dangers as follows: .1 in contact with combustible material (particularly with fibrous material such as jute, cotton or sisal) or sulphur, danger of spontaneous combustion; .2 in contact with ammonium compounds, powdered metals or oils, danger of explosion.

DG.name: SODIUM CHLORATE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Leakage and subsequent evaporation of the water may present increased dangers as follows: .1 in contact with combustible material (particularly with fibrous material such as jute, cotton or sisal) or sulphur, danger of spontaneous combustion; .2 in contact with ammonium compounds, powdered metals or oils, danger of explosion.

DG.name: CALCIUM CHLORATE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Leakage and subsequent evaporation of the water may present increased dangers as follows: .1 in contact with combustible material (particularly with fibrous material such as jute, cotton or sisal) or sulphur, danger of spontaneous combustion; .2 in contact with ammonium compounds, powdered metals or oils, danger of explosion.

DG.name: CALCIUM CHLORATE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Leakage and subsequent evaporation of the water may present increased dangers as follows: .1 in contact with combustible material (particularly with fibrous material such as jute, cotton or sisal) or sulphur, danger of spontaneous combustion; .2 in contact with ammonium compounds, powdered metals or oils, danger of explosion.

DG.name: ALKYLPHENOLS, SOLID, N.O.S. (including C2–C12 homologues)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to pale straw-coloured solids with penetrating odours (sometimes camphor-like). Some have low melting points. Insoluble in water. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALKYLPHENOLS, SOLID, N.O.S. (including C2–C12 homologues)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to pale straw-coloured solids with penetrating odours (sometimes camphor-like). Some have low melting points. Insoluble in water. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALKYLPHENOLS, SOLID, N.O.S. (including C2–C12 homologues)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to pale straw-coloured solids with penetrating odours (sometimes camphor-like). Some have low melting points. Insoluble in water. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ANISIDINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reddish or yellowish oily liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: N,N-DIETHYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellow-brown oily liquid. Combustible. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLORONITROTOLUENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. Oxidizing substance which may explode or burn fiercely when in contact with organic materials. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIBENZYLDICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYLPHENYL- DICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: THIOACETIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellow liquid with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: METHYLPHENYL- DICHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIMETHYLACETYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 19°C c.c. Boiling point: 108°C. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SODIUM HYDROGENDIFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, crystalline powder. Soluble in water. Decomposed by heat or acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic extremely irritating and corrosive gas. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: STANNIC CHLORIDE PENTAHYDRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, deliquescent solid. Melting point: about 60°C. Soluble in water. In the presence of water, corrosive to most metals. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TITANIUM TRICHLORIDE, PYROPHORIC or TITANIUM TRICHLORIDE MIXTURE, PYROPHORIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Finely divided, violet, crystalline solid. May ignite on exposure to air or moisture. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRICHLOROACETYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with a pungent odour, which fumes in moist air. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Liquid and vapours cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: VANADIUM OXYTRICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid. Decomposition occurs on exposure to moist air, forming red fumes of vanadic acid and hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Reacts with, or dissolves, many organic compounds. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: VANADIUM TETRACHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reddish-brown liquid. Decomposes under the influence of light, evolving chlorine, a highly toxic and irritating gas. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Liquid and vapours cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROCRESOLS, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals. Melting point: 32°C or above. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS, WHITE, MOLTEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Molten liquid. Melting point: 44°C. Ignites spontaneously in air. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Shipped molten above its melting point.

DG.name: SULPHUR, MOLTEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Melting point: 119°C. Molten sulphur may contain hydrogen sulphide, which is highly poisonous in low concentrations. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic, very irritating and suffocating gas. Forms explosive and extremely sensitive mixtures with oxidizing substances. Shipped molten above its melting point.

DG.name: NITROGEN TRIFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, non-toxic, colourless, odourless gas. Strong oxidizing agent; reacts violently with many substances, e.g. grease, oil, etc. Much heavier than air (2.4). May cause slight eye irritation.

DG.name: ETHYLACETYLENE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, colourless gas with an odour similar to acetylene. Heavier than air (1.9). Boiling point: 8°C. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYL FLUORIDE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 161)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, colourless gas. Explosive limits: 5% to 10%. Heavier than air (1.7). Boiling point: -37°C.

DG.name: METHYL FLUORIDE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 41)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, colourless gas. Heavier than air (1.2).

DG.name: METHYL NITRITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Transport is prohibited.

DG.name: 2-CHLOROPROPENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.5% to 12%. Boiling point: 23°C. Immiscible with water. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2,3-DIMETHYLBUTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -29°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.2% to 7%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Narcotic in high concentrations.

DG.name: HEXADIENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. 1,3-HEXADIENE: flashpoint -3°C c.c. 1,4-HEXADIENE: flashpoint -25°C c.c. 1,5-HEXADIENE: flashpoint -27°C c.c. 2,4-HEXADIENE: flashpoint -7°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-METHYL-1-BUTENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a disagreeable odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-METHYL-2-BUTENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a disagreeable odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYLPENTADIENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White to grey powder. In contact with water, acids or moisture, evolves hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: BERYLLIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or light yellow deliquescent crystals, or fine dust. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: DICHLOROISOCYANURIC ACID, DRY or DICHLOROISOCYANURIC ACID SALTS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline powder or granules; slightly hygroscopic. Partially soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM SUPEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow flakes. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite, following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRICHLOROISOCYANURIC ACID, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless powder or granules. Mixtures with combustible material are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. On contact with nitrogen compounds, fumes of nitrogen trichloride can be formed, which are very explosive. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ZINC BROMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: PHENYLACETONITRILE, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light brown liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: OSMIUM TETROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale yellow, crystalline, volatile solid with an irritating odour. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM ARSANILATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, crystalline powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: THIOPHOSGENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Red fuming liquid with a foul phosgene-like odour. Decomposes slowly in water. Reacts with acids, evolving toxic and corrosive fumes. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: VANADIUM TRICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pink, deliquescent crystals. Decomposes in water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL ISOTHIOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Usually shipped as an oily liquid with a flashpoint below 60°C c.c. Melting point: 36°C (pure substance). Flashpoint: 32°C c.c. (pure substance). Insoluble in water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ISOCYANATES, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S. or ISOCYANATE SOLUTION, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable toxic liquids with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but react with it to form carbon dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOCYANATES, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S. or ISOCYANATE SOLUTION, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable toxic liquids with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but react with it to form carbon dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: -7°C c.c. (pure product). Boiling point: 38°C (pure product). Vapour heavier than air. Immiscible with water but reacts violently with it. In contact with water or acids, evolves highly toxic nitrous fumes. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: -18°C to 0°C c.c. Boiling point: 60°C. Immiscible with water but reacts violently with it. On contact with water or acids, or when heated above boiling point, evolves highly toxic nitrous fumes. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: n-PROPYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but reacts violently with it, evolving gases. Flashpoint: -18°C to 23°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: -10°C to 0°C c.c. Immiscible with water but reacts violently with it, evolving gases. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: tert-BUTYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but reacts violently with it, evolving gases. Flashpoint: 11°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: n-BUTYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but reacts violently with it, evolving gases. Flashpoint: 19°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOBUTYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water but reacts violently with it, evolving gases. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHENYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 51°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Reacts with water, evolving carbon dioxide. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CYCLOHEXYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish liquid with an irritating odour. Flashpoint: 53°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Reacts with water, evolving carbon dioxide. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICHLOROISOPROPYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHANOLAMINE or ETHANOLAMINE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless. Miscible with water. Corrosive to copper, copper compounds, copper alloys and rubber. Reacts violently with acids. Liquid and vapour cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXAMETHYLENEIMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish liquid with an ammoniacal odour. Flashpoint: 18°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Absorbed through the skin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: IODINE PENTAFLUORIDE
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG19 SG35 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, fuming liquid (density 3.75). Powerful oxidant; may cause fire in contact with organic material such as wood, cotton or straw. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, extremely corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In contact with acids or acid fumes, evolves highly toxic fumes of iodine, fluorine and their compounds. Highly corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PROPIONIC ANHYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, combustible liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts with water, forming propionic acid. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1,2,3,6-TETRAHYDRO- BENZALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 57°C o.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: TRIS-(1-AZIRIDINYL)- PHOSPHINE OXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Aqueous solution. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TRIS-(1-AZIRIDINYL)- PHOSPHINE OXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Aqueous solution. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: VALERYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with a penetrating odour. Flashpoint: 23°C c.c. or above. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM TETRACHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, lustrous crystals. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: TETRABROMOETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquid with a camphor-like odour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: AMMONIUM FLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or powder with an ammonia-like odour. Readily soluble in water. Decomposes in contact with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a corrosive gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: AMMONIUM HYDROGEN SULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, rhombic crystals. Soluble in water. When involved in a fire, evolves extremely irritating and corrosive fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROPLATINIC ACID, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Red-brown crystals. Soluble in water.

DG.name: MOLYBDENUM PENTACHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black or green-black crystals. Hygroscopic. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, a corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Harmful if swallowed. Dust and vapour irritate skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM HYDROGEN SULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Soluble in water. When involved in a fire, evolves extremely irritating and corrosive fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-CHLOROPROPIONIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, aqueous solution with a specific odour. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINOPHENOLS (o-, m-, p-)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or brownish (ortho- and para-) or reddish-yellow (meta-) crystals. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOACETYL BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear liquid, colourless. Boiling point: 150°C. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen bromide, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Reacts violently with alkalis such as ammonia and hydrazine. Causes very severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Vapour causes tears.

DG.name: BROMOBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a characteristic odour. Flashpoint: 51°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.5% to 2.8%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: BROMOFORM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid or crystals (melting point 9°C) with a chloroform-like odour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Narcotic effect.

DG.name: CARBON TETRABROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Melting point: 48°C. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation of dust and vapour.

DG.name: 1-CHLORO-1,1-DIFLUORO- ETHANE (REFRIGERANT GAS R 142b)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable gas. Explosive limits: 8.5% to 14%. Much heavier than air (3.5).

DG.name: 1,5,9-CYCLODODECATRIENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CYCLOOCTADIENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water. 1,5-CYCLOOCTADIENE: flashpoint 38°C c.c. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIKETENE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 44°C c.c. Immiscible with water, but hydrolyses slowly in contact with it. The presence of acids, bases or amines can initiate explosive polymerization. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-DIMETHYLAMINOETHYL METHACRYLATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Combustible liquid. Causes tears. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ETHYL ORTHOFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ethereal odour. Flashpoint: 30°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ETHYL OXALATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily, aromatic liquid. Slowly decomposed by water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: FURFURYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale yellow, oily liquid. Flashpoint: 37°C o.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOBUTYL ACRYLATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 29°C o.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOBUTYL ISOBUTYRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fruity odour. Flashpoint: 37°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.96% to 7.59%. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ISOBUTYRIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 55°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2% to 9.2%. Miscible with water. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHACRYLIC ACID, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, combustible liquid with a specific odour. Miscible with water. Polymerizes readily above its melting point (15°C), thereby generating heat and possible risk of explosion; should therefore be properly stabilized. Cooling below melting point (15°C) followed by subsequent reheating can release uninhibited monomer that readily polymerizes. Decomposes when heated, evolving toxic gases. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL TRICHLOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: METHYLCHLOROSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, toxic and corrosive colourless gas with a pungent odour. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas. Heavier than air. Boiling point: 9°C. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 4-METHYLMORPHOLINE (N-METHYLMORPHOLINE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ammonia-like odour. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYLTETRAHYDROFURAN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an ether-like odour. Flashpoint: -11°C o.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: NITRONAPHTHALENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals. Insoluble in water. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: TERPINOLENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to pale amber liquid with a lemon odour. Flashpoint: 37°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: TRIBUTYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, combustible liquid with an amine odour. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HAFNIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black amorphous powder. Insoluble in water. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: HAFNIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black amorphous powder. Insoluble in water. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: HAFNIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Black amorphous powder. Insoluble in water. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: TITANIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Grey powder. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: TITANIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Grey powder. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: TITANIUM POWDER, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Grey powder. Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: SODIUM SUPEROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale yellow coarse powder or granules. Particularly if wetted with small quantities of water, a mixture with combustible material may ignite, following impact or friction. When involved in a fire, or in contact with water or acids, decomposes, evolving oxygen. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLORINE PENTAFLUORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. Forms dense, white, corrosive fumes in moist air. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Powerful oxidizing agent which may cause violent fires with combustible materials. Much heavier than air (4.5). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HEXAFLUOROACETONE HYDRATE, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: METHYLALLYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish, volatile liquid with a penetrating odour. Flashpoint: -12°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.3% to 9.3%. Immiscible with water. When involved in a fire, may evolve highly toxic phosgene gas. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROCELLULOSE WITH WATER (not less than 25% water, by mass)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Nitrocellulose may be granular or in flakes, blocks or fibrous form. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: NITROCELLULOSE WITH ALCOHOL (not less than 25% alcohol, by mass, and not more than 12.6% nitrogen, by dry mass)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Nitrocellulose may be granular or in flakes, blocks or fibrous form. In case of leakage, flammable vapours are evolved which, in closed compartments, may form explosive mixtures with air. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. Highly explosive when dry. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: NITROCELLULOSE with not more than 12.6% nitrogen, by dry mass, MIXTURE WITH or WITHOUT PLASTICIZER, WITH or WITHOUT PIGMENT
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Nitrocellulose may be in granular form or in flakes. This product may also contain added pigments. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments, these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. Burns extremely rapidly with intense heat radiation. The formulation should be prepared so that it remains homogeneous and does not separate during transport. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: EPIBROMOHYDRIN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 56°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-METHYLPENTAN-2-OL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 30°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 3-METHYL-1-BUTENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with a disagreeable odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRICHLOROACETIC ACID SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, clear solution with a pungent odour. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRICHLOROACETIC ACID SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, clear solution with a pungent odour. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICYCLOHEXYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear, colourless, combustible liquid with a fishy odour which may taint other cargoes. Immiscible with water. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SODIUM PENTACHLOROPHENATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or light brown powder with a pungent odour. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CADMIUM COMPOUND
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Powder or crystals with various colours. May be soluble or insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CADMIUM COMPOUND
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Powder or crystals with various colours. May be soluble or insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CADMIUM COMPOUND
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Powder or crystals with various colours. May be soluble or insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ALKYLSULPHURIC ACIDS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless oily liquids. React with water, evolving heat. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Highly corrosive to metal.

DG.name: PHENYLHYDRAZINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale yellow oily liquid. Melting point: 20°C. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: THALLIUM CHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Slightly soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: TRICRESYL PHOSPHATE with more than 3% ortho-isomer
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. A mixture of isomers. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS OXYBROMIDE, MOLTEN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Melting point: 56°C. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen bromide, a toxic and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Reacts violently with organic materials (such as wood, cotton, straw), causing fire. When involved in a fire, evolves highly toxic and corrosive gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapours and liquid cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Shipped molten above its melting point.

DG.name: PHENYLACETYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolves highly toxic fumes. Corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates eyes and mucous membranes. Liquid is corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS TRIOXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals or white deliquescent powder. Melting point: 23°C. Reacts with water, evolving heat and at normal temperatures phosphoric acid, but at higher temperatures phosphine, a highly toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PIPERAZINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, deliquescent crystals, turning dark on exposure to light. Soluble in water. Decomposes when heated and when involved in a fire, evolving highly toxic nitrous fumes. The solution in water is a strong base and is highly corrosive. Reacts violently with acids. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM BROMIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquid. Highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Liquid causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM CHLORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquid. Highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Liquid causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FERRIC CHLORIDE SOLUTION
