DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light brown liquid. Highly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: ALKYLSULPHONIC ACIDS, SOLID or ARYLSULPHONIC ACIDS, SOLID with more than 5% free sulphuric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When involved in a fire, evolve highly toxic gases. Corrosive to most metals, especially in the presence of moisture. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALKYLSULPHONIC ACIDS, LIQUID or ARYLSULPHONIC ACIDS, LIQUID with more than 5% free sulphuric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids usually with a pungent odour. When involved in a fire, evolve highly toxic gases. Highly corrosive to most metals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALKYLSULPHONIC ACIDS, SOLID or ARYLSULPHONIC ACIDS, SOLID with not more than 5% free sulphuric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solids. When involved in a fire, evolve highly toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALKYLSULPHONIC ACIDS, LIQUID or ARYLSULPHONIC ACIDS, LIQUID with not more than 5% free sulphuric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids usually with a pungent odour. When involved in a fire, evolve highly toxic gases. Corrosive to most metals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BENZOQUINONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals with an irritating and penetrating odour resembling that of chlorine. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PESTICIDE, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PESTICIDE, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PESTICIDE, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: VINYL CHLOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 50°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ASBESTOS, CHRYSOTILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Mineral fibres of varying length. Non-combustible. Inhalation of the dust of asbestos fibres is dangerous and therefore exposure should be avoided at all times. Always prevent the generation of asbestos dust. A safe level of airborne concentration of asbestos fibres may be obtained through effective packing. Cargo spaces or freight containers that have contained any type of raw asbestos should be carefully cleaned before discharging any remaining cargo, loading other cargo or carrying out repair or maintenance work. Whenever possible, cleaning of cargo spaces should be carried out whilst the ship is in a port where proper facilities and equipment, including proper respiratory apparatus and protective clothing, are available. Parts of the body that may have been exposed should be immediately and thoroughly washed. All waste material should be collected in impermeable and sealed bags for safe disposal ashore. If cleaning cannot be carried out at the discharge port, arrangements should be made in advance for cleaning to be carried out at the next port where necessary facilities are available.

DG.name: XENON, REFRIGERATED LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, inert, colourless and odourless gas. Much heavier than air (4.5).

DG.name: CHLOROTRIFLUOROMETHANE AND TRIFLUOROMETHANE AZEOTROPIC MIXTURE with approximately 60% chlorotrifluoromethane (REFRIGERANT GAS R 503)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, colourless gas with a mild ethereal odour. Much heavier than air (3.2).

DG.name: CYCLOBUTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquefied, flammable, colourless gas. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 10%. Heavier than air (1.9). Boiling point: 13°C.

DG.name: DICHLORODIFLUORO-METHANE AND DIFLUOROETHANE AZEOTROPIC MIXTURE with approximately 74% dichlorodifluoromethane (REFRIGERANT GAS R 500)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, colourless and odourless gas. Much heavier than air (3.7).

DG.name: CYCLOHEPTATRIENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to dark yellow liquid with a characteristic odour. Flashpoint: 0°C to 4°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Reacts vigorously with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BORON TRIFLUORIDE DIETHYL ETHERATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless fuming flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 59°C c.c. The flashpoint will be lower when free ether is present. Reacts vigorously with oxidizing substances. Decomposes in contact with water, evolving toxic, corrosive and flammable vapours. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Inhalation of small quantities of vapour can cause breathing difficulties.

DG.name: METHOXYMETHYL ISOCYANATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 13°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHYL ORTHOSILICATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with an ethereal odour. Immiscible with water. Flashpoint: -18°C to 19°C c.c. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. May cause blindness.

DG.name: ACROLEIN DIMER, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 48°C o.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROPROPANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Explosive limits: 2.2% to 11%. 1-NITROPROPANE: flashpoint approx. 33°C c.c. 2-NITROPROPANE: flashpoint approx. 28°C c.c. Partially miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation.

DG.name: TRIALLYL BORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid. Hydrolyses in contact with water, forming allyl alcohol. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TRIALLYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: 39°C o.c. Corrosive when in contact with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: PROPYLENE CHLOROHYDRIN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a mild odour. Flashpoint: 51°C c.c. Miscible with water. Decomposes when heated, evolving highly toxic fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: METHYL PROPYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an ethereal odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2% to … Boiling point: 39°C. Partially miscible with water. Narcotic. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: METHALLYL ALCOHOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 34°C c.c. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYL PROPYL ETHER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquids. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.7% to 9.0%. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIISOPROPYL BORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 17°C to 60°C c.c. Reacts with water, evolving flammable vapours.

DG.name: TRIISOPROPYL BORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 17°C to 60°C c.c. Reacts with water, evolving flammable vapours.

DG.name: METHYLCYCLOHEXANOLS, flammable
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, viscous liquid with a menthol-like odour. Flashpoint: 58°C c.c. Partially miscible with water.

DG.name: VINYLTOLUENES, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Flashpoint: 54°C to 60°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.9% to 6.1%. Partially miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BENZYLDIMETHYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with an aromatic odour. Flashpoint: 58°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Harmful if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMYL BUTYRATES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Flashpoint: 52°C to 58°C c.c. Partially miscible with water.

DG.name: ACETYL METHYL CARBINOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid with a pleasant odour. Flashpoint: 44°C to 52°C c.c. Miscible with water. Reacts vigorously with oxidizing substances. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: GLYCIDALDEHYDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 31°C o.c. Miscible with water. Toxic by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FIRELIGHTERS, SOLID with flammable liquid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A porous solid, e.g. cellular urea–formaldehyde resin, compacted wood shavings, etc., impregnated with flammable liquid, usually white spirit or kerosene, and designed to burn in a controlled manner. When heated, evolves flammable vapours.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM SILICIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder or crystals. Reacts with water or steam, evolving hydrogen, a flammable gas. In contact with acids, evolves silane, a spontaneously flammable gas.

DG.name: CHLORIC ACID, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with not more than 10% chloric acid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. May decompose, evolving chlorine and oxygen with toxic, corrosive and oxidizing effects. May form explosive mixtures with ammonium compounds, combustible material or powdered metals. Corrosive to most metals. Transport of CHLORIC ACID, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with more than 10% chloric acid is prohibited.

DG.name: NITRITES, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids. Solid mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Solid mixtures with ammonium compounds or cyanides may explode. If heated, may decompose, giving off toxic nitrous fumes. Harmful if swallowed. Transport of AMMONIUM NITRITES and mixtures of an inorganic nitrite with an ammonium salt is prohibited.

DG.name: POTASSIUM FLUOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid. Soluble in water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM FLUOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Soluble in water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SELENATES or SELENITES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of toxic solids. Generally soluble in water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: FLUOROACETIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Melting point: 33°C. Soluble in water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: METHYL BROMOACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to straw-coloured liquid. Slightly miscible with water. Causes tears. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: METHYL IODIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Boiling point: 42°C to 43°C. Slightly miscible with water. When heated, evolves toxic fumes. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Has strong narcotic effects.

DG.name: PHENACYL BROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals changing to a greenish colour under the influence of light. Melting point: 50°C. Insoluble in water. Causes tears. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HEXACHLOROCYCLO- PENTADIENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale yellow liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water. Causes tears. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: MALONONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Melting point: 32°C. Soluble in water. When heated, evolves highly toxic cyanogen fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: 1,2-DIBROMOBUTAN-3-ONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes tears.

DG.name: 1,3-DICHLOROACETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals. Melting point: 45°C. Soluble in water. Decomposes when heated, evolving highly toxic fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. Causes tears.

DG.name: 1,1-DICHLORO-1-NITRO-ETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid. Immiscible with water. May react vigorously with oxidizing substances. Decomposes when heated, evolving highly toxic fumes (oxides of nitrogen). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 4,4’-DIAMINODIPHENYL- METHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Tan-coloured flakes or lumps. Slightly soluble in water. Decomposes when heated, evolving highly toxic fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. May be carried in the molten state.

DG.name: BENZYL IODIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Melting point: 24°C. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. Causes tears.

DG.name: POTASSIUM FLUOROSILICATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids which react with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride and silicon tetrafluoride, irritating and corrosive gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: QUINOLINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water. When heated, evolves highly toxic fumes (of oxides of nitrogen). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SELENIUM DISULPHIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Bright red-yellow crystals with a faint odour. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM CHLOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NITROTOLUIDINES (MONO)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow to orange-red crystalline solids. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: HEXACHLOROACETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquid. Slightly miscible with water. When heated, evolves extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Causes tears. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIBROMOMETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear, colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BUTYLTOLUENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROACETONITRILE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 56°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Decomposes when heated, evolving highly toxic fumes of cyanides. Reacts with steam and acids, evolving toxic and flammable vapours. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROCRESOLS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solutions with a phenol-like odour. Slightly miscible with water. Decompose when heated, evolving extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROCRESOLS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solutions with a phenol-like odour. Slightly miscible with water. Decompose when heated, evolving extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CYANURIC CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals with a pungent odour. Reacts with water, forming toxic and corrosive acids. Decomposes when heated, evolving toxic and corrosive gases. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINOPYRIDINES (o-, m-, p-)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder or crystals. Melting points: 58°C to 64°C. Soluble in water. Reacts violently with acids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: AMMONIA SOLUTION relative density between 0.880 and 0.957 at 15°C in water, with more than 10% but not more than 35% ammonia
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Corrosive to copper, nickel, zinc and tin and their alloys such as brass. Not significantly corrosive to iron and steel. Reacts violently with acids. Liquid and vapour cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-AMINO-4-CHLOROPHENOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Light brown crystals. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM FLUOROSILICATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids which react with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride and silicon tetrafluoride, irritating and corrosive gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: STIBINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a foul odour. Decomposes violently in the presence of water. Much heavier than air (4.3).

DG.name: RUBIDIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: RUBIDIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: RUBIDIUM HYDROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Greyish-white solid, very hygroscopic. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: LITHIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: LITHIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: LITHIUM HYDROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Soluble in water. Reacts violently with acids. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CAESIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to glass, aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CAESIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to glass, aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CAESIUM HYDROXIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or yellowish hygroscopic crystals. Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to glass, aluminium, zinc and tin. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMMONIUM SULPHIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid with a foul odour (of rotten eggs). When heated, evolves toxic and flammable vapours. Reacts violently with acids, evolving hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 3-DIETHYLAMINO- PROPYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: 59°C o.c. Miscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: N,N-DIETHYLETHYLENE- DIAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid with a fishy odour. Flashpoint: 46°C o.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by skin contact. Irritating to eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-DIETHYLAMINOETHANOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Miscible with water. Reacts violently with oxidizing substances. Explosive limits: 1.8% to 28%. Flashpoint: 46°C to 60°C c.c. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DICYCLOHEXYLAMMONIUM NITRITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder. Insoluble in water. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: 1-BROMO-3-CHLOROPROPANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Decomposes when heated, evolving highly toxic fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: GLYCEROL-alpha- MONOCHLOROHYDRIN
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: N-n-BUTYLIMIDAZOLE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to amber mobile liquid. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS PENTABROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow hygroscopic crystals, evolving fumes in the air which are corrosive and heavier than air. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen bromide, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Reacts violently with ammonia, bases and many other substances and may cause fire and explosion. Decomposes when heated, evolving corrosive and toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BORON TRIBROMIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless fuming liquid. Reacts violently with water, evolving toxic and corrosive fumes. Decomposes when heated, evolving toxic fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Liquid and vapour cause severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BISULPHITES, AQUEOUS SOLUTION, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with a pungent odour. Reacts with acids, evolving sulphur dioxide, a toxic gas. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TETRAHYDROPHTHALIC ANHYDRIDES with more than 0.05% maleic anhydride
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline powders. React with water, evolving heat and forming tetrahydrophthalic acid. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. When heated, evolve acrid fumes which are irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TRIFLUOROACETIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, fuming, hygroscopic liquid with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. When heated to decomposition or in contact with acids, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapours are highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Liquid causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1-PENTOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a perceptible odour. May react in contact with acids and alkalis. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIMETHYLDIOXANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pungent odour. Partially miscible with water. React vigorously with oxidizing substances. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIMETHYLDIOXANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pungent odour. Partially miscible with water. React vigorously with oxidizing substances. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BUTYLBENZENES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with an unpleasant odour. Flashpoint: 34°C to 60°C c.c. Explosive limits: 0.7% to 6.9%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIPROPYL KETONE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 49°C c.c. Immiscible with water.

DG.name: ACRIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Small colourless to yellowish crystals or needles. Sublimes at 100°C. Practically insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ZINC RESINATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Powder or clear amber lumps. Insoluble in water. Liable to spontaneous heating. Irritating to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM RESINATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Cream to brown coloured mass. Insoluble in water. Liable to spontaneous heating. Irritating to skin and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1,4-BUTYNEDIOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals. Melting point: 58°C. Soluble in water. Forms explosive mixtures with mercury salts, acids, alkaline compounds and halides. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CAMPHOR, synthetic
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless or white crystals, granules or easily broken masses with a penetrating, pungent and aromatic odour. Slightly soluble in water. When heated, evolves flammable and explosive vapours. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: BARIUM BROMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals or powder. Slightly soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: CHROMIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Purple crystals. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Solutions in water are slightly corrosive. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: COPPER CHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Blue-green deliquescent crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: LITHIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and burn fiercely. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM CHLORATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White deliquescent crystals or powder. Soluble in water. Melting point: 35°C. Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. The cargoes should be protected from moisture prior to and after loading. If weather is inclement, hatches should be closed.

DG.name: MANGANESE NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pale pink deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Melting point between 26°C and 35°C. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Solutions in water are slightly corrosive. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: NICKEL NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Green deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Melting point: 55°C. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Solutions in water are slightly corrosive. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: NICKEL NITRITE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reddish-yellow crystals. Decomposes if heated, giving off toxic nitrous fumes. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Mixtures with ammonium compounds or cyanides may explode. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: THALLIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystals. Soluble in water. Mixtures with combustible material are readily ignited and may burn fiercely. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ZIRCONIUM NITRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystals, flakes or powder. Soluble in water. Solutions in water are slightly corrosive. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: HEXACHLOROBENZENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White needle-like crystals. Insoluble in water. Decomposes when heated, evolving highly toxic fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: NITROANISOLES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Light reddish or amber liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROBROMOBENZENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to pale yellow liquids. Melting point of 1-BROMO-3-NITROBENZENE: 17°C. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: AMINES, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or POLYAMINES, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquids with an unpleasant odour. Some are very volatile. Miscible with water. Corrosive to most metals, especially to copper and its alloys. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. React violently with acids. Harmful by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINES, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or POLYAMINES, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquids with an unpleasant odour. Some are very volatile. Miscible with water. Corrosive to most metals, especially to copper and its alloys. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. React violently with acids. Harmful by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINES, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or POLYAMINES, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquids with an unpleasant odour. Some are very volatile. Miscible with water. Corrosive to most metals, especially to copper and its alloys. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. React violently with acids. Harmful by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S. or POLYAMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish flammable liquids or solutions with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. Corrosive to most metals, especially to copper and its alloys. React violently with acids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S. or POLYAMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish flammable liquids or solutions with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. Corrosive to most metals, especially to copper and its alloys. React violently with acids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or POLYAMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquids or solutions with a pungent odour. Miscible with or soluble in water. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. Corrosive to most metals, especially to copper and its alloys. React violently with acids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or POLYAMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquids or solutions with a pungent odour. Miscible with or soluble in water. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. Corrosive to most metals, especially to copper and its alloys. React violently with acids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or POLYAMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquids or solutions with a pungent odour. Miscible with or soluble in water. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. Corrosive to most metals, especially to copper and its alloys. React violently with acids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: N-BUTYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Amber liquid with a perceptible odour. Immiscible with water. May react vigorously with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BUTYRIC ANHYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Decomposes in water to form butyric acid.

DG.name: n-PROPYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 28°C c.c. Decomposed by water, generating propyl alcohol. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BARIUM HYPOCHLORITE with more than 22% available chlorine
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White powder with pungent odour. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated or by friction. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are sensitive to friction and are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. Dust irritates mucous membranes. Contact with eyes will cause serious injury to the cornea (blindness) if not treated immediately by using copious amounts of water followed by medical attention.

DG.name: CHLOROFORMATES, TOXIC, CORROSIVE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to yellowish flammable liquids. React and decompose with water or heat, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Flashpoint: cyclohexyl chloroformate: 53°C c.c. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: n-BUTYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to yellowish flammable liquids. React and decompose with water or heat, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Flashpoint: 32°C c.c. to 39°C c.c. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CYCLOBUTYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to yellowish flammable liquids. React and decompose with water or heat, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Flashpoint: 38°C c.c. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROMETHYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to yellowish liquids. React and decompose with water or heat, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHENYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to yellowish liquids. React and decompose with water or heat, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: tert-BUTYLCYCLOHEXYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquid. Reacts with water or decomposes if heated, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-ETHYLHEXYL CHLOROFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of colourless to yellowish liquids. React and decompose with water or heat, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TETRAMETHYLSILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Boiling point: 27°C. Immiscible with water. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1,3-DICHLOROPROPANOL-2
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, slightly viscous liquid with a chloroform-like odour. Immiscible with water. Decomposes when heated, evolving extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIETHYLTHIOPHOSPHORYL CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a perceptible odour. Reacts slowly with water, forming hydrochloric acid. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases (hydrogen chloride and sulphur dioxide). Vapour highly irritating to eyes and mucous membranes. Liquid causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 1,2-EPOXY-3-ETHOXY-PROPANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. Flashpoint: 47°C c.c. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: N-ETHYLBENZYLTOLUIDINES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids with a strong odour. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: N-ETHYLTOLUIDINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light amber liquids. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CARBAMATE PESTICIDE, SOLID, TOXIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CARBAMATE PESTICIDE, SOLID, TOXIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CARBAMATE PESTICIDE, SOLID, TOXIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CARBAMATE PESTICIDE, LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, flashpoint less than 23°C
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pesticides frequently contain petroleum or coal tar distillates, or other flammable liquids. Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CARBAMATE PESTICIDE, LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, flashpoint less than 23°C
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pesticides frequently contain petroleum or coal tar distillates, or other flammable liquids. Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 4-THIAPENTANAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an extremely foul and persistent odour. Miscible with water. Decomposes rapidly in contact with acids and bases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOTIN PESTICIDE, SOLID, TOXIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid pesticides present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pesticides frequently contain petroleum or coal tar distillates, or other flammable liquids. Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOTIN COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic liquids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOTIN COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic liquids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOTIN COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide variety of toxic liquids. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ACETIC ACID, GLACIAL or ACETIC ACID SOLUTION, more than 80% acid, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a pungent odour. When pure, crystallizes below 16°C. Flashpoint: 40°C c.c. (pure product), 60°C c.c. (80% solution). Explosive limits: 4% to 17%. Miscible with water. Corrosive to lead and most other metals. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ACETIC ACID SOLUTION not less than 50% but not more than 80% acid, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. Corrosive to lead and most other metals. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ACETIC ACID SOLUTION more than 10% and less than 50% acid, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. Corrosive to lead and most other metals. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FERROUS METAL BORINGS, SHAVINGS, TURNINGS, or CUTTINGS in a form liable to self-heating
DG.Propertiesandobservations: These cargoes are liable to self-heating and to ignite spontaneously, particularly when in a finely divided form, wet or contaminated with such materials as unsaturated cutting oil, oily rags and other combustible matter. Self-heating or inadequate ventilation may cause dangerous depletion of oxygen in the stowage spaces. Excessive amounts of cast iron borings or organic materials may encourage heating. The swarf should be protected from moisture prior to and after loading. If, during loading, the weather is inclement, hatches should be closed or otherwise protected to keep the material dry.

DG.name: BATTERIES, WET, FILLED WITH ACID electric storage
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Metal plates immersed in acid electrolyte in a glass, hard rubber or plastics receptacle. When electrically charged, may cause fire through short-circuiting of terminals. Acid electrolyte is corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Used batteries being transported for disposal or reclamation should be carefully checked prior to shipment to ensure the integrity of each battery and its suitability for transport.

DG.name: BATTERIES, WET, FILLED WITH ALKALI electric storage
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Metal plates immersed in alkaline electrolyte in a glass, hard rubber or plastics receptacle. When electrically charged, may cause fire through short-circuiting of terminals. Alkaline electrolyte is corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin. Reacts violently with acids. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Used batteries being transported for disposal or reclamation should be carefully checked prior to shipment to ensure the integrity of each battery and its suitability for transport.

DG.name: SULPHURIC ACID with not more than 51% acid or BATTERY FLUID, ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid, mixture not exceeding 1.405 relative density. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BATTERY FLUID, ALKALI
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts violently with acids. Reacts with ammonium salts, evolving ammonia gas. Corrosive to aluminium, zinc and tin.

DG.name: PHENYLPHOSPHORUS DICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHENYLPHOSPHORUS THIODICHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid which fumes slightly in air. Reacts with water or steam, evolving toxic and flammable vapours. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BATTERIES, WET, NON-SPILLABLE electric storage
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Metal plates immersed in gelled alkaline or acid electrolyte in a glass, hard rubber or plastics receptacle of a non-spillable type. When electrically charged, may cause fire through short-circuiting of terminals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DYE, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or DYE INTERMEDIATE, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of corrosive liquids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DYE, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or DYE INTERMEDIATE, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of corrosive liquids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DYE, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. or DYE INTERMEDIATE, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of corrosive liquids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: COPPER CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White to yellow-brown crystals or powder. Partially to fully soluble in water. Corrosive to steel. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: GALLIUM
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Silvery-white metallic element that melts at 29°C, becoming a bright, shiny liquid. Insoluble in water. Highly corrosive to aluminium. Harmful if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Special care should be taken if a leakage occurs when carried in aluminium freight containers. Carriage should be prohibited in hovercraft and other ships constructed from aluminium.

DG.name: LITHIUM HYDRIDE, FUSED SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, crystalline mass. Reacts with water, moisture or acids, evolving hydrogen which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: LITHIUM NITRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brownish-red crystals or fine, free-flowing powder. Reacts slowly with water to form lithium hydroxide and ammonia.

DG.name: MAGNETIZED MATERIAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Not subject to the provisions of this Code but may be subject to provisions governing the transport of dangerous goods by other modes.

DG.name: MERCURY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A silvery metallic element occurring in the liquid state at normal temperatures. Relative density: 13.546. Melting point: -39°C . Highly corrosive to aluminium. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Special care should be taken if a leakage occurs during transport, especially when carried in breakable packages and in aluminium freight containers. Carriage should be prohibited in hovercraft and other ships constructed from aluminium.

DG.name: TOXIC LIQUID, ORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXIC LIQUID, ORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXIC LIQUID, ORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXIC SOLID, ORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXIC SOLID, ORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXIC SOLID, ORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM ALUMINATE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Not subject to the provisions of this Code but may be subject to provisions governing the transport of dangerous goods by other modes.

DG.name: INFECTIOUS SUBSTANCE, AFFECTING HUMANS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Substances which are dangerous to humans or to humans and animals.

DG.name: N-AMINOETHYLPIPERAZINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid. Miscible with water. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: AMMONIUM HYDROGEN- DIFLUORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Miscible with water. Highly corrosive to most metals and glass. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMMONIUM HYDROGEN- DIFLUORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Miscible with water. Highly corrosive to most metals and glass. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMMONIUM POLYSULPHIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Unstable yellowish liquid with a foul odour (of rotten eggs). Miscible with water. Reacts violently with acids. Decomposes in contact with acids, evolving hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMMONIUM POLYSULPHIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Unstable yellowish liquid with a foul odour (of rotten eggs). Miscible with water. Reacts violently with acids. Decomposes in contact with acids, evolving hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: AMYL ACID PHOSPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear colourless liquid. A mixture of primary and amyl isomers. Immiscible with water. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BUTYRIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a penetrating and unpleasant odour. Freezing point: -5°C to -8°C. Miscible with water. Corrosive to most metals. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation. Corrosive to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHENOL SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish solutions with a perceptible odour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Rapidly absorbed through the skin.

DG.name: PHENOL SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellowish solutions with a perceptible odour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Rapidly absorbed through the skin.

DG.name: 2-CHLOROPYRIDINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless oily liquid. Slightly miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CROTONIC ACID, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline solid. Soluble in water. Decomposes when heated, evolving toxic fumes. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYL CHLOROTHIOFORMATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 29°C c.c. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CAPROIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Oily, colourless or yellowish liquid. Melting point: -4°C. Partially miscible with water. Corrosive to mild steel. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: LITHIUM FERROSILICON
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Dark, crystalline, metal-like powder or brittle lumps. In contact with moisture, evolves flammable and toxic gases.

DG.name: 1,1,1-TRICHLOROETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Decomposes when heated, evolving highly toxic fumes (phosgene and hydrogen chloride). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Narcotic in high concentrations.

DG.name: PHOSPHOROUS ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellow deliquescent crystals. Soluble in water. Mildly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: SODIUM ALUMINIUM HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, crystalline solid. Reacts with water, moisture or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: BISULPHATES, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to white liquid. Miscible with water. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BISULPHATES, AQUEOUS SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to white liquid. Miscible with water. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: VINYL BUTYRATE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 12°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.4% to 8.8%. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALDOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear, colourless to yellow viscous liquid. Miscible with water. Decomposes at 85°C, evolving toxic fumes. May react vigorously with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BUTYRALDOXIME
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Flashpoint: 58°C c.c. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DI-n-AMYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ammoniacal odour. Flashpoint: 52°C c.c. Slightly miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROETHANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, oily liquid. Flashpoint: 28°C c.c. Explosive limits: 3.4% to … When involved in a fire, evolves nitrous toxic fumes. Slightly soluble in water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM MANGANESE SILICON
DG.Propertiesandobservations: In contact with water, evolves hydrogen, a flammable gas. In contact with acid, evolves silane, a spontaneously flammable gas.

DG.name: PYROPHORIC LIQUID, ORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Highly flammable liquids, may ignite spontaneously in moist air. In contact with air, evolve irritating and slightly toxic fumes.

DG.name: PYROPHORIC SOLID, ORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. If shaken, may produce sparks. In contact with water, evolve hydrogen, a flammable gas.

DG.name: 3-CHLOROPROPANOL-1
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to light-yellow liquid. Miscible with water. Mildly corrosive to steel. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PROPYLENE TETRAMER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. 1-dodecene is not marine pollutant.

DG.name: BORON TRIFLUORIDE DIHYDRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, non-fuming liquid. Boiling range: 58°C to 60°C. Reacts with water, evolving corrosive and toxic fumes. Corrosive to mild steel. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: DIPICRYL SULPHIDE, WETTED with not less than 10% water, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Golden-yellow, crystalline leaflets. Explosive and sensitive to shock and heat in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM FLUOROSILICATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids which react with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride and silicon tetrafluoride, irritating and corrosive gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: AMMONIUM FLUOROSILICATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids which react with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride and silicon tetrafluoride, irritating and corrosive gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ZINC FLUOROSILICATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids which react with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride and silicon tetrafluoride, irritating and corrosive gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: FLUOROSILICATES, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids which react with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride and silicon tetrafluoride, irritating and corrosive gases. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: REFRIGERATING MACHINES containing non-flammable, non-toxic gases or ammonia solutions (UN 2672)
ZIRCONIUM, DRY coiled wire, finished metal sheets, strip (thinner than 254 microns but not thinner than 18 microns)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Hard silvery metal.

DG.name: AMMONIUM METAVANADATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline powder. Slightly soluble in water. May act as an oxidizing substance. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: AMMONIUM POLYVANADATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Orange powder. Slightly soluble in water. May act as an oxidizing substance. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: VANADIUM PENTOXIDE, non-fused form
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brownish powder. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM AMMONIUM VANADATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Orange wet cake (with 10% to 15% water). Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: POTASSIUM METAVANADATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline powder. Slightly soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HYDROXYLAMINE SULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to white crystalline powder. Soluble in water. May decompose explosively when heated. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TITANIUM TRICHLORIDE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Violet crystalline solid. Reacts in moist air or in water, evolving heat and hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TITANIUM TRICHLORIDE MIXTURE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Violet crystalline solid. Reacts in moist air or in water, evolving heat and hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ALUMINIUM BOROHYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid. Ignites spontaneously in air. Reacts with water or steam to produce heat or hydrogen, which may form explosive mixtures with air.

DG.name: ANTIMONY POWDER
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Metallic antimony in the form of a fine grey powder. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: DIBROMOCHLOROPROPANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a perceptible odour. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIBROMOCHLOROPROPANES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a perceptible odour. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIBUTYLAMINOETHANOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a perceptible odour. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: FURFURYL ALCOHOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Clear, colourless, mobile liquid, becoming brown to dark-red upon exposure to light and air. Miscible with water. Reacts explosively with oxidizing substances. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HEXACHLOROPHENE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White, odourless powder or crystals. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: RESORCINOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White to pink crystals. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: TITANIUM SPONGE GRANULES or TITANIUM SPONGE POWDERS
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Silvery grey granules or dark grey, amorphous powder. May react with carbon dioxide, evolving oxygen. Forms explosive mixtures with oxidizing substances.

DG.name: SELENIUM OXYCHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, yellowish liquid. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes severe burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED or CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED MIXTURE with not less than 5.5% but not more than 16% water
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine- like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Dust irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED or CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED MIXTURE with not less than 5.5% but not more than 16% water
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine- like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Dust irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: METAL CATALYST, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air.

DG.name: METAL CATALYST, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. See entry above

DG.name: METAL CATALYST, DRY
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liable to ignite spontaneously in air. See entry above

DG.name: INFECTIOUS SUBSTANCE, AFFECTING ANIMALS only
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Substances which are dangerous to animals only. For action to be taken in the event of damage to, or leaking from, a package containing infectious substances, refer to 7.8.3.

DG.name: BROMINE CHLORIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reddish-yellow non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. When heated to decomposition, emits highly toxic and corrosive fumes of bromine and chlorine. Reacts with water, evolving toxic and corrosive fumes. Powerful oxidizing agent which may cause violent fires with combustible materials. Much heavier than air. Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PESTICIDE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid pesticides which present a very wide range of toxic hazard. Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PESTICIDE, LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S.

DG.name: PESTICIDE, LIQUID, TOXIC, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S. flashpoint not less than 23°C

They frequently contain petroleum or coal tar distillates, or other flammable liquids. Flashpoint and miscibility with water depend upon the composition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROPHENOLATES, LIQUID or PHENOLATES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of corrosive liquids. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROPHENOLATES, SOLID or PHENOLATES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A wide range of corrosive solids. Soluble in water. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOSORBIDE DINITRATE MIXTURE with not less than 60% lactose, mannose, starch, or calcium hydrogen phosphate
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Pure isosorbide dinitrate is explosive. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: VANADYL SULPHATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Blue, crystalline powder. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: METHYL 2-CHLORO- PROPIONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with an ether-like odour. Flashpoint: 32°C c.c. Slightly soluble in water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL 2-CHLORO- PROPIONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a sweetish odour. Flashpoint: 50°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ETHYL 2-CHLORO-PROPIONATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 38°C c.c. Immiscible with water. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: THIOLACTIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Oily liquid with a foul odour. Melting point: 10°C. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: alpha-METHYLBENZYL ALCOHOL, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Slightly miscible with water. Melting point: 21°C (pure substance). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 9-PHOSPHABICYCLONONANES (CYCLOOCTADIENE- PHOSPHINES)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, waxy solids. Melting point: 40°C to 60°C. React in contact with materials such as sawdust or other cellulose- based materials, resulting in charring and evolution of toxic fumes. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FLUOROANILINES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids. Freezing points: -28°C to -2°C. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2-TRIFLUOROMETHYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid. Immiscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TETRAHYDRO-FURFURYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquid with an ammoniacal odour. Flashpoint: 45°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: N-METHYLBUTYLAMINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: 0°C c.c. Miscible with water. Harmful by inhalation. Causes burns to skin and eyes. Irritating to mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-AMINO-5-DIETHYLAMINO- PENTANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid with an acrid odour. Miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ISOPROPYL CHLOROACETATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Flashpoint: 56°C c.c. Slightly soluble in water. Harmful by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 3-TRIFLUOROMETHYLANILINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to yellowish liquid. Melting point: 5°C. Slightly miscible with water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM HYDROSULPHIDE, HYDRATED with not less than 25% water of crystallization
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless needles or yellow flakes. Soluble in water with a foul odour. Melting point: 52°C. Reacts violently with acids, evolving hydrogen sulphide, a toxic and flammable gas. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: MAGNESIUM GRANULES, COATED particle size not less than 149 microns
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Coated granules with particle size ranging from 149 to 2000 microns. In contact with water or acids, evolve hydrogen, a flammable gas.

DG.name: 5-tert-BUTYL-2,4,6-TRINITRO- m-XYLENE (MUSK XYLENE)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Insoluble in water. May explode if involved in a fire under confined conditions. Sensitive to strong detonation shock. Harmful if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: BORON TRIFLUORIDE DIMETHYL ETHERATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquid. Flashpoint: 20°C c.c. but widely variable, depending upon free ether content. Freezing point: -14°C. Decomposes in contact with water, forming dimethyl ether, a flammable gas. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: THIOGLYCOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a foul odour. Miscible with water. Decomposes when heated, evolving sulphur dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SULPHAMIC ACID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline powder. Soluble in water. Decomposes when heated, evolving toxic fumes. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: MANEB, STABILIZED or MANEB PREPARATION, STABILIZED against self-heating
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow powder. May evolve toxic, irritating or flammable fumes when wet, when involved in a fire or in contact with acids. Requires certification from the shipper that the substance is not class 4.2.

DG.name: CASTOR BEANS or CASTOR MEAL or CASTOR POMACE or CASTOR FLAKE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Whole beans or meal. The latter is the residue remaining after the oil has been extracted from the seeds. Castor beans contain a powerful allergen which, by inhalation of dust or by skin contact with crushed bean products, can give rise to severe irritation of the skin, eyes and mucous membranes in some persons. They are also toxic by ingestion. When handling these products, wear at least a dust mask and goggles. Avoid unnecessary skin contact.

DG.name: RADIOACTIVE MATERIAL, URANIUM HEXAFLUORIDE non fissile or fissile-excepted
ETHYLENE OXIDE AND PROPYLENE OXIDE MIXTURE with not more than 30% ethylene oxide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquid with an ethereal odour. Flashpoint: below -18°C c.c. Explosive limits: 2.2% to 55%. Boiling point: 23°C to 28°C. Miscible with water. Corrosive to aluminium. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGEN PEROXIDE, AQUEOUS SOLUTION with not less than 8% but less than 20% hydrogen peroxide (stabilized as necessary)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Slowly decomposes, evolving oxygen; the rate of decomposition increases in contact with metals, except aluminium.

DG.name: CHLOROSILANES, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pungent odour. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. React violently with water, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROSILANES, CORROSIVE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, flammable liquids with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water. React violently with water or steam, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROSILANES, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquids with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water. React violently with water or steam, evolving hydrogen chloride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. When involved in a fire, evolve toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROSILANES, WATER- REACTIVE, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG5 SG8 SG13 SG25 SG26 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, very volatile liquids, flammable and corrosive, with a pungent odour. Immiscible with water. React violently with water or steam to produce heat which may lead to self-ignition; toxic and corrosive fumes will be evolved. May react vigorously in contact with oxidizing substances. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: LEAD PHOSPHITE, DIBASIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fine white crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Combustion can be sustained, even in the absence of air. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: LEAD PHOSPHITE, DIBASIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fine white crystals or powder. Insoluble in water. Combustion can be sustained, even in the absence of air. Harmful if swallowed.

DG.name: LIFE-SAVING APPLIANCES, SELF-INFLATING
DG.Propertiesandobservations: These articles may contain: .1 class 2.2 compressed gases; .2 signal devices (class 1) which may include smoke and illumination signal flares; signal devices must be packed in plastic or fibreboard inner packagings; .3 electric storage batteries; .4 first aid kit; or .5 “strike anywhere” matches.

DG.name: CARBAMATE PESTICIDE, LIQUID, TOXIC, FLAMMABLE, flashpoint not less than 23°C
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid flammable pesticides having a flashpoint between 23°C and 60°C c.c., presenting a very wide range of toxic hazard. They frequently contain petroleum or coal tar distillates, or other flammable liquids. Flashpoint and miscibility with water depend upon the composition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PESTICIDE, LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S., flashpoint less than 23°C
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pesticides frequently contain petroleum or coal tar distillates, or other flammable liquids. Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 1,2-BUTYLENE OXIDE, STABILIZED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Flashpoint: -15°C c.c. Explosive limits: 1.5% to 18.3%. Reacts violently with acids, alkalis and oxidizers. Miscible with water. Harmful if swallowed or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: 2-METHYL-2-HEPTANETHIOL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a foul odour. Flashpoint: 31°C c.c. Miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: COUMARIN DERIVATIVE PESTICIDE, LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, flashpoint less than 23°C
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pesticides frequently contain petroleum or coal tar distillates, or other flammable liquids. Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.
