DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts vigorously with sulphuric acid. Reacts fiercely with cyanides when heated. May form explosive mixtures with combustible material, powdered metals or ammonium compounds. These mixtures are liable to ignite. When involved in a fire, may cause an explosion.

DG.name: CHLORONITROBENZENES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow liquid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 4-CHLORO-o-TOLUIDINE HYDROCHLORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: beta-NAPHTHYLAMINE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: beta-NAPHTHYLAMINE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: FORMIC ACID with not less than 10% but not more than 85% acid by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FORMIC ACID with not less than 5% but less than 10% acid by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a pungent odour. Corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM CYANIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: POTASSIUM CYANIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: POTASSIUM CYANIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: SODIUM CYANIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: SODIUM CYANIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: SODIUM CYANIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Highly toxic if swallowed or by skin contact.

DG.name: SODIUM FLUORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid. Reacts with acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, irritating and corrosive gas, apparent as white fumes. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROACETOPHENONE, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquid evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: XYLYL BROMIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals or powder, evolving irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 2,4-TOLUYLENEDIAMINE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BORON TRIFLUORIDE ACETIC ACID COMPLEX, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline solid. Melting point: 23°C. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: BORON TRIFLUORIDE PROPIONIC ACID COMPLEX, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White crystalline solid. Melting point: 28°C. Highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM HYDROGEN DIFLUORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Decomposed by heat or acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, extremely irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM HYDROGEN DIFLUORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Decomposed by heat or acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, a toxic, extremely irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POTASSIUM FLUORIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Decomposed by acids, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an irritating and corrosive gas. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TETRAMETHYLAMMONIUM HYDROXIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Very soluble in water with a strong ammonia-like odour. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. When heated emits toxic fumes of nitrogen and ammonia. Corrosive to metals and tissue. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: AMMONIUM DINITRO-o- CRESOLATE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: The commercial product is a 50% suspension in water. May support combustion and burn without oxygen. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes. Forms extremely sensitive explosive compounds with lead, silver or other heavy metals and their compounds. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: AMMONIUM DINITRO-o- CRESOLATE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: The commercial product is a 50% suspension in water. May support combustion and burn without oxygen. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes. Forms extremely sensitive explosive compounds with lead, silver or other heavy metals and their compounds. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOACETIC ACID, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, deliquescent crystals. Melting point: 51°C. Corrosive to most metals. Harmful if swallowed. Causes burns to eyes and skin.

DG.name: ACRYLAMIDE SOLUTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROBENZYL CHLORIDES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless crystalline solid. Melting point: 29°C. Immiscible with or insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: 3-CHLORO-4-METHYLPHENYL ISOCYANATE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless solid with a pungent odour. Melting point: 23°C. Insoluble in water. Reacts with water, evolving carbon dioxide. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLOROTOLUIDINES, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Brown liquid. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: XYLENOLS, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: The commercial products are liquids with a pungent tar odour. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROBENZOTRIFLUORIDES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Low melting point (31°C to 32°C) solids with an aromatic odour. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: POLYCHLORINATED BIPHENYLS, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solids with perceptible odour. Insoluble in water. Harmful by ingestion or by skin contact. If spilled, can be a persistent hazard to the environment. This entry also covers articles, such as rags, cotton waste, clothing or sawdust, containing polychlorinated biphenyls where no free visible liquid is present.

DG.name: NITROCRESOLS, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Slightly miscible in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HEXAFLUOROACETONE HYDRATE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: This entry covers solid hydrate and hexafluoroacetone. Melting point of the pure substance: 23°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLOROCRESOLS, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or pink crystals with a phenol-like odour. Melting point: 45°C to 68°C. Slightly soluble in water. Decomposes when heated, evolving extremely toxic fumes (phosgene). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: alpha-METHYLBENZYL ALCOHOL, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Slightly soluble in water. Melting point: 21°C (pure substance). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITRILES, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid, evolving toxic vapours. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITRILES, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid, evolving toxic vapours. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITRILES, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid, evolving toxic vapours. Reacts with acids or acid fumes, evolving hydrogen cyanide, a highly toxic and flammable gas. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SELENIUM COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SELENIUM COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: SELENIUM COMPOUND, LIQUID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CHLORODINITROBENZENES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystals. Melting point: 27°C to 53°C. May explode if involved in a fire. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DICHLOROANILINES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid with a penetrating odour. Liquid mixtures of various isomers of dichloroanilines, some of which in the pure state may be solid, with a melting point varying from 24°C to 72°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DINITROBENZENES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: May explode if involved in a fire. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE HYDROCHLORIDE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Deliquescent crystals or solids or pastes. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NICOTINE SULPHATE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid or paste. Soluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROTOLUENES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow solid. Melting point: para-NITROTOLUENE: 52°C to 54°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROXYLENES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow solid. Melting points: 4-NITRO-2-XYLENE: 29°C to 31°C, 5-NITRO-3-XYLENE: 72°C to 74°C. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TEAR GAS SUBSTANCE, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: “Tear gas substance” is a generic term for substances which, in minute quantities dispersed in air, cause extreme eye irritation and profuse tears. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TEAR GAS SUBSTANCE, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: “Tear gas substance” is a generic term for substances which, in minute quantities dispersed in air, cause extreme eye irritation and profuse tears. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: BROMOBENZYL CYANIDES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Volatile, yellow crystals evolving irritating vapours (“Tear Gas”). Melting point: meta-BROMOBENZYL CYANIDE 25°C. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: DIPHENYLCHLOROARSINE, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When pure, volatile, colourless crystals evolving an irritating vapour (“Tear Gas”). Melting point: 41°C. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOLUIDINES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: para-TOLUIDINE is solid in pure form, with a melting point of approximately 45°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: XYLIDINES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: 3,4-Dimethylaniline is a solid, which has a melting point of 47°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: PHOSPHORIC ACID, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Very deliquescent, crystalline solid. Melting point: 42°C. Soluble in water. Mildly corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: DINITROTOLUENES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Yellow crystals or flakes, insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: CRESOLS, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Light yellow solid. Soluble in water. Melting points of CRESOLS: ortho-CRESOL: 30°C, para-CRESOL: 35°C. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: NITROSYLSULPHURIC ACID, SOLID
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Crystalline solid. Oxidant which may cause fire with organic materials (such as wood, straw, etc.). When involved in a fire, evolves toxic gases. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLORONITROTOLUENES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Melting range 20°C to 40°C. Insoluble in water. Oxidizing substance which may explode or burn fiercely when in contact with organic materials. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROANISOLES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Light reddish or amber crystals. Melting points: 38°C to 54°C. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: NITROBROMOBENZENES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless to pale yellow crystals which may liquefy under transport conditions. Melting points: 1-BROMO-2-NITROBENZENE: 43°C. 1-BROMO-4-NITROBENZENE: 127°C. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: N-ETHYLBENZYLTOLUIDINES, SOLID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Solid which may liquefy under transport conditions. Strong odour. Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXINS, EXTRACTED FROM LIVING SOURCES, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxins from plant, animal or bacterial sources which contain infectious substances or toxins that are contained in infectious substances should be classified in class 6.2. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXINS, EXTRACTED FROM LIVING SOURCES, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxins from plant, animal or bacterial sources which contain infectious substances or toxins that are contained in infectious substances should be classified in class 6.2. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXINS, EXTRACTED FROM LIVING SOURCES, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxins from plant, animal or bacterial sources which contain infectious substances or toxins that are contained in infectious substances should be classified in class 6.2. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PROPIONIC ACID, with not less than 90% acid by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid with a pungent odour. Miscible with water. Corrosive to lead and most other metals. Burns skin. Vapours irritate mucous membranes. Pure PROPIONIC ACID: flashpoint 50°C c.c.

DG.name: ORGANOPHOSPHORUS COMPOUND, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOPHOSPHORUS COMPOUND, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOPHOSPHORUS COMPOUND, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOARSENIC COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOARSENIC COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOARSENIC COMPOUND, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: METAL CARBONYLS, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: METAL CARBONYLS, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: METAL CARBONYLS, SOLID, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Insoluble in water. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOMETALLIC COMPOUND, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOMETALLIC COMPOUND, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: ORGANOMETALLIC COMPOUND, SOLID, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HYDROGEN IN A METAL HYDRIDE STORAGE SYSTEM or HYDROGEN IN A METAL HYDRIDE STORAGE SYSTEM CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or HYDROGEN IN A METAL HYDRIDE STORAGE SYSTEM PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Article containing flammable odourless gas, which is much lighter than air.

DG.name: PAINT, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE (including paint, lacquer, enamel, stain, shellac, varnish, polish, liquid filler and liquid lacquer base) or PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE (including paint thinning or reducing compound)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Corrosive contents cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PAINT, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE (including paint, lacquer, enamel, stain, shellac, varnish, polish, liquid filler and liquid lacquer base) or PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE (including paint thinning or reducing compound)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Corrosive contents cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PAINT, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE (including paint, lacquer, enamel, stain, shellac, varnish, polish, liquid filler and liquid lacquer base) or PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE (including paint thinning or reducing compound)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Corrosive contents cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PAINT, CORROSIVE, FLAMMABLE (including paint, lacquer, enamel, stain, shellac, varnish, polish, liquid filler and liquid lacquer base) or PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, CORROSIVE, FLAMMABLE (including paint thinning or reducing compound)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Miscibility with water depends upon the composition. Corrosive contents cause burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGENDIFLUORIDES SOLUTION, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When involved in a fire or in contact with acids, evolves hydrogen fluoride, an extremely irritating and corrosive gas. Corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGENDIFLUORIDES SOLUTION, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: When involved in a fire or in contact with acids, evolves hydrogen fluoride, an extremely irritating and corrosive gas. Corrosive to glass, other siliceous materials and most metals. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CROTONIC ACID, LIQUID
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT containing flammable liquids
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fuel cell cartridges containing flammable liquids including methanol or methanol/water solutions. Fuel cell cartridges may also be shipped in, or packed with, equipment.

DG.name: 1-HYDROXYBENZOTRIAZOLE MONOHYDRATE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. White to light beige powder. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. When involved in a fire, evolves toxic fumes; in closed compartments these fumes may form an explosive mixture with air. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals or their salts.

DG.name: ETHANOL AND GASOLINE MIXTURE or ETHANOL AND MOTOR SPIRIT MIXTURE or ETHANOL AND PETROL MIXTURE, with more than 10% ethanol
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless, volatile liquids. Miscibility with water depends on the composition.

DG.name: FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT, containing water-reactive substances
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fuel cell cartridges containing water-reactive substances may also be shipped in, or packed with, equipment.

DG.name: FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT, containing corrosive substances
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fuel cell cartridges containing corrosive substances may also be shipped in, or packed with, equipment.

DG.name: FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT, containing liquefied flammable gas
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fuel cell cartridges containing butane or other flammable liquefied gas may also be shipped in, or packed with, equipment.

DG.name: FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or FUEL CELL CARTRIDGES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT, containing hydrogen in metal hydride
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Fuel cell cartridges containing hydrogen, butane or other flammable odourless gas, which is much lighter than air, may also be shipped in or packed with equipment.

DG.name: LITHIUM ION BATTERIES (including lithium ion polymer batteries)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Electrical batteries containing lithium ion may react (e.g. flame, heat, emission of toxic, corrosive or flammable gases or vapours) or disassemble due to damage, defects or short circuit.

DG.name: LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT (including lithium ion polymer batteries)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Electrical batteries containing lithium ion may react (e.g. flame, heat, emission of toxic, corrosive or flammable gases or vapours) or disassemble due to damage, defects or short circuit.

DG.name: ALKALI METAL DISPERSION, FLAMMABLE or ALKALINE EARTH METAL DISPERSION, FLAMMABLE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Finely divided alkali or alkaline earth metal suspended in a flammable liquid. Reacts violently with moisture, water or acids, evolving hydrogen, which may be ignited by the heat of the reaction.

DG.name: MOTOR FUEL ANTI-KNOCK MIXTURE, FLAMMABLE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Volatile flammable liquids evolving toxic vapour. Mixture of tetraethyllead or tetramethyllead with ethylene dibromide and ethylene dichloride. Insoluble in water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: HYDRAZINE AQUEOUS SOLUTION, FLAMMABLE with more than 37% hydrazine, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless flammable liquid. Powerful reducing agent, burns readily. Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, DRY, CORROSIVE or CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE MIXTURE, DRY, CORROSIVE with more than 39% available chlorine (8.8% available oxygen)
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish corrosive solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine-like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE MIXTURE, DRY, CORROSIVE with more than 10% but not more than 39% available chlorine
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish corrosive solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine-like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED, CORROSIVE or CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED MIXTURE, CORROSIVE with not less than 5.5% but not more than 16% water
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish corrosive solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine-like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED, CORROSIVE or CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE, HYDRATED MIXTURE, CORROSIVE with not less than 5.5% but not more than 16% water
DG.Segregation: SGG8 SG35 SG38 SG49 SG53 SG60
DG.Propertiesandobservations: White or yellowish corrosive solid (powder, granules or tablets) with chlorine-like odour. Soluble in water. May cause fire in contact with organic material or ammonium compounds. Substances are liable to exothermic decomposition at elevated temperatures. This condition may lead to fire or explosion. Decomposition can be initiated by heat or by impurities (e.g. powdered metals (iron, manganese, cobalt, magnesium) and their compounds). Liable to heat slowly. Reacts with acids, evolving chlorine, an irritating, corrosive and toxic gas. In the presence of moisture, corrosive to most metals. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TOXIC BY INHALATION LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. with an LC50 lower than or equal to 200 mL/m3 and saturated vapour concentration greater than or equal to 500 LC50
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A variety of toxic liquids which present a highly toxic inhalation hazard as well as being flammable and corrosive. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TOXIC BY INHALATION LIQUID, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. with an LC50 lower than or equal to 1000 mL/m3 and saturated vapour concentration greater than or equal to 10 LC50
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A variety of toxic liquids which present a highly toxic inhalation hazard as well as being flammable and corrosive. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: TOXIC BY INHALATION LIQUID, WATER-REACTIVE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S. with an LC50 lower than or equal to 200 mL/m3 and saturated vapour concentration greater than or equal to 500 LC50
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A variety of toxic liquids which present a highly toxic inhalation hazard as well as being water-reactive and flammable. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: TOXIC BY INHALATION LIQUID, WATER-REACTIVE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S. with an LC50 lower than or equal to 1000 mL/m3 and saturated vapour concentration greater than or equal to 10 LC50
DG.Propertiesandobservations: A variety of toxic liquids which present a highly toxic inhalation hazard as well as being water-reactive and flammable. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PETROLEUM SOUR CRUDE OIL, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. Evolves hydrogen sulphide, which is a flammable, toxic gas with a foul odour, heavier than air (1.2). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PETROLEUM SOUR CRUDE OIL, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. Evolves hydrogen sulphide, which is a flammable, toxic gas with a foul odour, heavier than air (1.2). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: PETROLEUM SOUR CRUDE OIL, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Immiscible with water. Evolves hydrogen sulphide, which is a flammable, toxic gas with a foul odour, heavier than air (1.2). Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation.

DG.name: IODINE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Bluish-black solid with a metallic lustre and a pungent odour. Melting point: 114°C. Below its melting point, may evolve vapours which are irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Slightly soluble in water but soluble in most organic solvents. Corrosive to most metals.

DG.name: BATTERIES, NICKEL-METAL HYDRIDE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Nickel-metal hydride cells or batteries packed with or contained in equipment and nickel-metal hydride button are not subject to the provisions of this Code.

DG.name: KRILL MEAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pink to red meal derived from Krill which is a shrimp-like marine organism. Medium odour, which may affect other sensitive cargo. Liable to self-heating. Naturally rich in anti-oxidants, which lessen the risk of spontaneous heating.

DG.name: KRILL MEAL
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pink to red meal derived from Krill which is a shrimp-like marine organism. Medium odour, which may affect other sensitive cargo. Liable to self-heating. Naturally rich in anti-oxidants, which lessen the risk of spontaneous heating.

DG.name: IODINE MONOCHLORIDE, LIQUID
DG.Segregation: SGG1 SG6 SG16 SG17 SG19 SG36 SG49
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Red Liquid. Reacts violently with water, evolving irritating and corrosive gases apparent as white fumes. Powerful oxidant: may cause fire in contact with organic materials such as wood, cotton or straw. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to most metals. Vapour irritates mucous membranes.

DG.name: CAPACITOR, ELECTRIC DOUBLE LAYER (with an energy storage capacity greater than 0.3 Wh)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Articles intended to store energy containing a non-dangerous activated carbon and an electrolyte. Electric double layer capacitors installed in equipment may be transported in a charged state.

DG.name: CHEMICAL UNDER PRESSURE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids, pastes or powders, pressurized with a propellant which meets the definition of a gas.

DG.name: CHEMICAL UNDER PRESSURE, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids, pastes or powders, pressurized with a propellant which meets the definition of a gas.

DG.name: CHEMICAL UNDER PRESSURE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids, pastes or powders, pressurized with a propellant which meets the definition of a gas.

DG.name: CHEMICAL UNDER PRESSURE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids, pastes or powders, pressurized with a propellant which meets the definition of a gas.

DG.name: CHEMICAL UNDER PRESSURE, FLAMMABLE, TOXIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids, pastes or powders, pressurized with a propellant which meets the definition of a gas.

DG.name: CHEMICAL UNDER PRESSURE, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Liquids, pastes or powders, pressurized with a propellant which meets the definition of a gas.

DG.name: MERCURY CONTAINED IN MANUFACTURED ARTICLES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Mercury (UN 2809) is highly corrosive to aluminium. Carriage should be prohibited in hovercraft and other ships constructed with aluminium.

DG.name: URANIUM HEXAFLUORIDE, RADIOACTIVE MATERIAL, EXCEPTED PACKAGE, less than 0.1 kg per package, non-fissile or fissile-excepted
CAPACITOR, ASYMMETRIC (with an energy storage capacity greater than 0.3Wh)
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Articles intended to store energy containing positive and negative electrodes comprised of different materials and an electrolyte. Asymetric capacitors may be transported in a charged state.

DG.name: PACKAGINGS, DISCARDED, EMPTY, UNCLEANED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: This entry shall not be used for sea transport. Discarded packaging shall meet the requirements of 4.1.1.11. Discarded packaging means packagings, large packagings or intermediate bulk containers (IBC), or parts thereof, which have contained dangerous goods, other than radioactive material, which are transported for disposal, recycling or recovery of their material, other than reconditioning, repair, routine maintenance, remanufacturing or reuse, and which have been emptied to the extent that only residues of dangerous goods adhering to the packaging parts are present.

DG.name: ADSORBED GAS, TOXIC, FLAMMABLE, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
ADSORBED GAS, TOXIC, OXIDIZING, CORROSIVE, N.O.S.
BORON TRIFLUORIDE, ADSORBED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas. Forms dense white corrosive fumes in moist air. Reacts violently with water, evolving hydrogen fluoride, an irritating and corrosive gas apparent as white fumes. In the presence of moisture, highly corrosive to glass and most metals. Much heavier than air (2.35). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: CHLORINE, ADSORBED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive yellow gas with a pungent odour. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Much heavier than air (2.4). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes. Powerful oxidant which may cause fire.

DG.name: SILICON TETRAFLUORIDE, ADSORBED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with a pungent odour. Corrosive to metals. In moist air, produces hydrogen fluoride. Much heavier than air (3.6). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ARSINE, ADSORBED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a garlic odour. Explosive limits: 3.9% to 77.8%. Much heavier than air (2.8).

DG.name: GERMANE, ADSORBED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a pungent odour. Much heavier than air (2.6).

DG.name: PHOSPHORUS PENTAFLUORIDE, ADSORBED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Non-flammable, toxic and corrosive gas with an irritating odour. Reacts with water or moist air to produce toxic and corrosive fumes. Corrosive to glass and to most metals. Much heavier than air (4.3). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: PHOSPHINE, ADSORBED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a garlic odour. Ignites spontaneously in air. Heavier than air (1.2). Irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: HYDROGEN SELENIDE, ADSORBED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Flammable, toxic, colourless gas with a disagreeable odour. Much heavier than air (2.8). Highly irritating to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: POLYESTER RESIN KIT, solid base material
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Polyester resin kits consist of two components: a base material (flammable solid) and an activator (organic peroxide), each separately packed in an inner packaging.

DG.name: POLYESTER RESIN KIT, solid base material
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Polyester resin kits consist of two components: a base material (flammable solid) and an activator (organic peroxide), each separately packed in an inner packaging.

DG.name: ENGINE, INTERNAL COMBUSTION, FLAMMABLE LIQUID POWERED or ENGINE, FUEL CELL, FLAMMABLE LIQUID POWERED or MACHINERY, INTERNAL COMBUSTION, FLAMMABLE LIQUID POWERED or MACHINERY, FUEL CELL, FLAMMABLE LIQUID POWERED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Types of articles transported under this entry include engines or machinery, powered by fuels classified as dangerous goods via internal combustion systems or fuel cells (e.g. combustion engines, generators, compressors, turbines, heating units, etc.).

DG.name: ENGINE, INTERNAL COMBUSTION, FLAMMABLE GAS POWERED or ENGINE, FUEL CELL, FLAMMABLE GAS POWERED or MACHINERY, INTERNAL COMBUSTION, FLAMMABLE GAS POWERED or MACHINERY, FUEL CELL, FLAMMABLE GAS POWERED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Types of articles transported under this entry include engines or machinery, powered by fuels classified as dangerous goods via internal combustion systems or fuel cells (e.g. combustion engines, generators, compressors, turbines, heating units, etc.).

DG.name: ENGINE, INTERNAL COMBUSTION or MACHINERY, INTERNAL COMBUSTION
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Types of articles transported under this entry include engines or machinery, powered by fuels classified as dangerous goods via internal combustion systems (e.g. combustion engines, generators, compressors, turbines, heating units, etc.).

DG.name: POLYMERIZING SUBSTANCE, SOLID, STABILIZED, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Polymerizes at elevated temperatures or in a fire. Burns vigorously. Insoluble in water. Contact with alkalis or acids may cause dangerous polymerization. The products of combustion or self-accelerating polymerization may be toxic by inhalation.

DG.name: POLYMERIZING SUBSTANCE, LIQUID, STABILIZED, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Polymerizes at elevated temperatures or in a fire. Burns vigorously. Immiscible with water. Contact with alkalis or acids may cause dangerous polymerization. The products of combustion or self-accelerating polymerization may be toxic by inhalation.

DG.name: POLYMERIZING SUBSTANCE, SOLID, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Polymerizes at temperatures higher than the self-accelerating polymerization temperature or in a fire. Burns vigorously. Insoluble in water. Contact with alkalis or acids may cause dangerous polymerization. The products of combustion or self-accelerating polymerization may be toxic by inhalation. Control and emergency temperatures can be found in the transport document as required in 5.4.1.5.5. The temperature must be checked regularly.

DG.name: POLYMERIZING SUBSTANCE, LIQUID, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Polymerizes at temperatures higher than the self-accelerating polymerization temperature or in a fire. Burns vigorously. Immiscible with water. Contact with alkalis or acids may cause dangerous polymerization. The products of combustion or self-accelerating polymerization may be toxic by inhalation. Control and emergency temperatures can be found in the transport document as required in 5.4.1.5.5. The temperature must be checked regularly.

DG.name: TOXIC SOLID, FLAMMABLE, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: TOXIC SOLID, FLAMMABLE, INORGANIC, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation.

DG.name: LITHIUM BATTERIES INSTALLED IN CARGO TRANSPORT UNIT lithium ion batteries or lithium metal batteries
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Cargo transport unit containing lithium metal or lithium ion batteries which is designed to serve as mobile power supply unit.

DG.name: ARTICLES CONTAINING NON-FLAMMABLE, NON- TOXIC GAS, N.O.S.
ARTICLES CONTAINING A SUBSTANCE LIABLE TO SPONTANEOUS COMBUSTION, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: * F-G, S-M for pyrophoric substances, F-A, S-J for self-heating substances.

DG.name: ARTICLES CONTAINING A SUBSTANCE WHICH EMITS FLAMMABLE GAS IN CONTACT WITH WATER, N.O.S.
ARTICLES CONTAINING TOXIC SUBSTANCE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by dust inhalation. *When competent authority approval is required by SP391, the stowage and handling will be specified by the competent authority.

DG.name: ARTICLES CONTAINING CORROSIVE SUBSTANCE, N.O.S.
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Causes burns to skin, eyes and mucous membranes.

DG.name: ARTICLES CONTAINING MISCELLANEOUS DANGEROUS GOODS, N.O.S.
MEDICAL WASTE, CATEGORY A, AFFECTING HUMANS, solid or MEDICAL WASTE, CATEGORY A, AFFECTING ANIMALS only, solid
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Waste containing substances which are dangerous to humans and/or animals.

DG.name: COBALT DIHYDROXIDE POWDER, containing not less than 10% respirable particles
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Pink odourless powder. Toxic by dust inhalation.

DG.name: SODIUM ION BATTERIES with organic electrolyte
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Electrical batteries containing sodium ion may react (e.g. flame, heat, emission of toxic, corrosive or flammable gases or vapours) or disassemble due to damage, defects or short circuit.

DG.name: SODIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or SODIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT, with organic electrolyte
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Electrical batteries containing sodium ion may react (e.g. flame, heat, emission of toxic, corrosive or flammable gases or vapours) or disassemble due to damage, defects or short circuit.

DG.name: DISILANE
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Gas that is extremely flammable and spontaneously ignites in air (pyrophoric). Repulsive odour. Slowly decomposes with water. Irritant to mucous membranes and is an asphyxiant. Boiling point –14.3°C. Lighter than air (0.675).

DG.name: GALLIUM CONTAINED IN MANUFACTURED ARTICLES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Gallium (UN 2803) is highly corrosive to aluminium. Carriage should be prohibited in hovercraft and other ships constructed from aluminium.

DG.name: TRIFLUOROMETHYL- TETRAZOLESODIUM SALT IN ACETONE, with not less than 68% acetone, by mass
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Desensitized explosive. Explosive and sensitive to friction in the dry state. May form extremely sensitive compounds with heavy metals and their salts.

DG.name: VEHICLE, LITHIUM ION BATTERY POWERED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: This entry applies to vehicles powered by lithium ion batteries with the batteries installed, such as electrically-powered cars, lawn tractors, wheelchairs and other mobility aids.

DG.name: VEHICLE, LITHIUM METAL BATTERY POWERED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: This entry applies to vehicles powered by lithium metal batteries with the batteries installed, such as electrically-powered cars, lawn tractors, wheelchairs and other mobility aids.

DG.name: VEHICLE, SODIUM ION BATTERY POWERED
DG.Propertiesandobservations: This entry applies to vehicles powered by sodium ion batteries with the batteries installed, such as electrically-powered cars, lawn tractors, wheelchairs and other mobility aids.

DG.name: FIRE SUPPRESSANT DISPERSING DEVICES
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Articles which contain a pyrotechnic substance, which are intended to disperse a fire extinguishing agent (or aerosol) when activated, and which do not contain any other dangerous goods.

DG.name: TETRAMETHYLAMMONIUM HYDROXIDE AQUEOUS SOLUTION with not less than 25% tetramethylammonium hydroxide
DG.Propertiesandobservations: Colourless liquid with a strong ammonia-like odour that is miscible with water. Highly toxic if swallowed, by skin contact or by inhalation. Corrosive to metal. When heated emits toxic fumes of nitrogen oxides and ammonia. Causes burns to skin, eyes, and mucous membranes. Reacts violently with acids.
